session_synopses.AD_AdventurervsKid: Barth is threatening Meli, who has stolen a locket from him. Meli is playing dumb and/or threatening him in return.
session_synopses.Trainee1: Player speaking directly to a tiefling child who's learning to fight.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutTrespass: Mol has caught the player in her hideout and advises them to leave, starting to count down. She's threatening and serious.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_002: Not Critpath. A small tiefling girl (7-9 years old), very shy and nervous, is planning on stealing from the player and is surprised that they're talking to her. Though she's a gifted thief, she's not good at lying. There is also a portion of this dialogue where the player can get her to partially admit to having stolen from them.
session_synopses.HideoutKid_001: A young woman in her early teens, crime boss, leader of the thiefling kids in the Den. She reacts to the various ways the player has treated her kids so far, and if necessary, can return items to the player that her kids have stolen.
session_synopses.AD_HideoutGuards: The sneaky kids are talking amongst themselves in their secret hideout.
session_synopses.AD_MerchantLeaves: When the scammer (Lim) and the pickpocket walk away, having stolen from the player.
session_synopses.VB_FoundStolenGoods: Said with a lilt of suspicion. They have found their own things, which a kid stole, but don't know they were robbed in the first place
session_synopses.HideoutGuard_002: Little kid talkign to the player-- trying to be tough.
session_synopses.CaughtThief: Non-critpath. Occurs when the player catches the small tiefling girl (7-9 years old) is stealing from them. The player can grab and shake her, as per design.
session_synopses.Pickpocket_001: Non-critpath. A tiefling merchant kid who's trying to distract the player while his partner/sister steals the player's belongings. Orphaned street rat, works for Mol (Boss kid in the hideout)
session_synopses.AD_CannotFitCrack: Player found a crack through which they potentially can or cannot enter the kids' hideout.
session_synopses.Trainee3: Tiefling child far too confident they can fight goblins next time, even when scared.
session_synopses.AD_RobberKid: Child pickpocket, bored out of his mind, talking out loud.
session_synopses.Trainer: Non-critpath. Trainer asks the player to inspire the children. Player can give speeches or roar. Trainer, Asharak should sound weary and a little sad. He doesn't want to have to train children to fight.
session_synopses.Trainee2: Tiefling child confident they can fight goblins next time they come.
session_synopses.AD_Trespassing: A crime reaction dialog said by the kids in the Thiefling Hideout.
session_synopses.Adventurer_Solo: Non-critpath. Takes place after the player resolves the confronation between this adventurer and the thiefling boy who stole the adventurer's necklace.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee2Responses: Training in combat with an adult tiefling. Ide is 9-10. Nervous, but trying to be brave
session_synopses.AD_MagicTrick: Silfy tries to learn Mattis's sleight of hand tricks. Big brother indulging his younger sister.
session_synopses.AD_Trainee1Responses: Training in self-defence with an adult. Umi is 8-9 years old and timid.
session_synopses.AD_TrainerLessons: A trainer speaking to children being taught to defend themselves in a makeshift outdoor training arena.
session_synopses.AD_PickpocketTrader: Scammer kid mutters to himself after having swindled someone.
session_synopses.AD_KidGuardReport: Player is fighting Mol and the other kids. The kids are calling for help from the other tieflings.

AD_Ritual.speaker: Aelar, Karrik, Inwe, Tahan, Elwyn
AD_Ritual.context: NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Een OOM-brahm CRAY-toose, sahn-GWEE-neh ee-you-RAH-toose.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Find our master. Return to me then.
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Speaking to the bird. NodeContext: Stern but also love in her voice. She knows the bird will do its best.

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Apikusis
AD_SearchingBird.text: Tell me what you find. Tell only me. Understand?

AD_SearchingBird.speaker: Tingmiaq
AD_SearchingBird.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hopping from foot NodeContext: Cheerful, excited.

RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
RitualDruid2.text: Aggeniculamur in umbra tua, Pater Arborum.
RitualDruid2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: AH-jeh-nee-koo-lah-moor een OOM-brah TWO-ah, PAH-tehr ARR-bore-oom.

RitualDruid3.speaker: Inwe
RitualDruid3.text: I'm seeing goblins in every shadow.
RitualDruid3.context: NodeContext: The goblin threat is dealt with, but she's still afraid and paranoid.

AD_RitualDruid1.speaker: Aelar
AD_RitualDruid1.text: Complexum tuum... it's still in my head.
AD_RitualDruid1.context: NodeContext: Prnounced: Com-PLECK-soom TOO-oom, He's got a chant stuck in his head.

RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
RitualDruid5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes closed, focused on the chant, channelling magical energy.NodeContext: Chanting a magic spell: Ahb SPEE-ree-too oo-MOHK, AH-coo-lay-oos VEE-tees-kway.

AD_RitualDruid2.speaker: Karrik
AD_RitualDruid2.text: We'll be stronger for all of this.
AD_RitualDruid2.context: NodeContext: The ritual has been stopped, and the goblin threat has passed. Karrik has calmed - he is feeling introspective.

AD_RitualDruid5.speaker: Tahan
AD_RitualDruid5.text: Those tieflings brought nothing but trouble.
AD_RitualDruid5.context: NodeContext: The ritual has stopped and the goblin threat is dealt with. Tahani is bitter - she blames players and tiefling for bringing trouble to the grove in the first place.

session_synopses.AD_BirdSender: |Druid sending a bird to find Halsin. |
session_synopses.AD_Ritual: Five druids participate in a ritual around a sacred pool. The chant will summon a coccoon of thorns that will encircle their entire grove. Lines play sequentially, each druid saying one line, then the next, etc.They're chanting at a normal to low volume. They're attempting to suss power out from the earth itself, but they're not forcing it out. There should be a loose rhythm to it (think Arwen from LoTR when she summons the river horses), but it shouldn't come across like a drum circle.
session_synopses.AD_SearchingBird: |Talking to her friend and companion, a bird. She wants it to fly over the area and search for her missing master, Halsin. |
session_synopses.RitualDruid2: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Kerrick is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Kerrick is furious - he feels betrayed by Kagha, and doesn't quite care if she's been killed.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Kerrick has calmed down a good bit - now that the danger's passed, he's seeing things with a bit more clarity. The player always encounters Kerrick around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.RitualDruid3: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Inwe is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Inwe is ashamed at her involvement.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Inwe is still a bit shaken - she knows the threat is over, but she's still jumping at shadows.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid1: This AD plays after the druid's ritual has been stopped. In this AD, Aelar is dazed from days of chanting.
session_synopses.RitualDruid5: This dialogue can occur in three different states: In the first, Tahani is in a trance, chanting a spell that will cover the druid grove in thorns. In the second, the ritual has been stopped after a druid named Kagha was exposed as a Shadow Druid. Tahani is furious that players stopped the ritual - even though Kagha had ulterior motives, Tahani still believes her path was best and that players had no right to intervene.In the third, a group of goblins that had threatened the grove has been dealt with and the grove is considered safe again. In this state, Tahani isn't convinced the threat is really over. She thinks her fellow druids will lead them down the same path again, taking pity on people that will only bring trouble to their door.The player always encounters Inwe around a sacred druid pool. She's more or less the xenophobic conservative of the chanting druids.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid2: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Kerrick was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid. In this state, Kerrick feels angry and betrayed - he thought he was part of something good when really he was being used.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In this state, Kerrick is reflective and calm. The threat is gone, but there's much to be learned from it.
session_synopses.AD_RitualDruid5: This AD has two phases: the first plays if a druid ritual Tahani was part of was stopped because their leader was exposed as a shadow druid.The second state plays once the goblins that threatened the grove - and necessitated the ritual - have been dealt with. In both states, Tahani is bitter, muttering her xenophobic ideas to herself. She thinks the tieflings (and the player) are the cause of all their troubles and that they should've been thrown out a long time ago.

AD.speaker: Shadowheart
AD.text: There must be something I can learn from it.
AD.context: NodeContext: Talking to herself, trying to figure out a mysterious artefact.

session_synopses.AD: Shadowheart tries to figure out the mysterious cube that she carries with her while resting in the Druid Grove (the cube is a powerful relic that she was to retrieve deliver to her superiors - she does not know its exact nature, but has to protect it at all costs).

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.context: CinematicNodeContext: player sees the landscape ahead through the telescope lens - the dragon is gone

Telescope.speaker: Player
Telescope.text: Focus the telescope on the distant object, trying to get a clear view.

Telescope.speaker: Narrator
Telescope.text: *You see a dragon circling like a bird of prey. Hunting.*
Telescope.context: NodeContext: watching the dragon through a telescope so fear but no immediate danger

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: You have good timing. Never been much of a fighter, so wrestling a bugbear would have gone poorly.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: But you're not here for heroics, are you? Avernus' stench is all over your skin.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Let me guess: your devil mistress sent you to get her soul coin back. Too bad. I earned it fair and square.

node_data.speaker: Karlach
node_data.text: Oh man, a soul coin? Wouldn't mind getting my hands on that...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very interested but maybe downplaying her interest.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That bugbear would have crushed your skull. This is the thanks I get?

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Why thank you, dread slayer of bugbears. You shall live forever in my memory.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dramatically exaggerated/sarcastic.

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Now take my regards back to that pouting erinyes and leave me alone.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Very flat, almost cold.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: How about this? You give me the coin. Now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You hand the coin over, or I kill you. How about that?
True

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: Considering you turned that bugbear into paste...

node_data.speaker: Nadira
node_data.text: ...that's a good trade. Except the coin seems to have slipped through a hole in my pocket somewhere. Damn it.

session_synopses.Telescope: The player interacts with a telescope at a druid grove, looking out at the scenery and potentially spotting a dragon in the sky.
session_synopses: Nadira is a witty tiefling that survived Avernus and escaped with a soul coin, a valuable currency of the Hells. She suspects the player works for the original owner of the coin, a devilish erinyes, and will have to be persuaded in order to hand it over.

AD_Training.speaker: Wyll
AD_Training.text: Good work, kids. You're all heroes, each and every one of you.

session_synopses.AD_Training: Wyll is encouraging the kids to practice punching goblins.

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: I wonder when the goblins will come.

AD_Guards.speaker: Arka
AD_Guards.text: I could use the target practice.

Caged.speaker: Sazza
Caged.text: Runnin' out of time, worgmeat. My family'll be 'ere soon. Lemme out.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.text: That goblin won't be the last.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Player
GuardsIdle.text: Bit of a fish in a barrel there. You could have given her a fighting chance.

GuardsIdle.speaker: Arka
GuardsIdle.text: Fighting chance? That's more than Kanon got.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: That goblin is in my debt - should prove useful one day.

PAD_Freed.speaker: Player
PAD_Freed.text: Or it'll come back to haunt us.
PAD_Freed.context: NodeContext: Karlach: A little naive but sincere.

session_synopses.AD_Guards: Several conditions of conversations between Arka and Memnos here: Sazza escaped, sazza was killed, the pair wait for the goblin attack at the gates, or Arka's brother, Kanon, has been killed by goblins.
session_synopses.Caged: Character is caged for this entire dialogue If the player saves the goblin captive from being killed, the goblin will try to convince the player to free them and then meet the player later in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.Transit: The grieving tiefling pair moves to Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.AD: Sazza's ADs when she's in the druid grove. She's in a cage for most of these, or could have been broken out by the player. She's at risk of life and limb but that doesn't stop her from antagonizing everyone around her.
session_synopses.GuardsAvenge: The grieving tiefling pair at the gate face off with Sazza. Arka is set on killing Sazza as indirect revenge for the death of Kanon, who was slain by goblins.
session_synopses.GuardsIdle: Arka and Memnos are idle in the druid grove after going to confront the captive goblin Sazza. The goblin may or may not have been killed in this prior scene. Arka remains bitter over the recent death of their friend, Kagha, while Memnos, if present, tries to shake her out of it.
session_synopses.PAD_Freed: This VB plays after Sazza was escorted outside of the Grove.The dialog may play with one or two speakers.Speaker 1 is the character who helped her escape.Speaker 2 is an accompanying party member, and as such may have an opinion on the issue.

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Eramas
AD_ZorruGuard.context: NodeContext: Finding his colleague tiresome for even asking

AD_ZorruGuard.speaker: Zorru
AD_ZorruGuard.text: Just wait 'til you see 'em. Yellow all over. Covered in spots. No noses to speak of.

AD_TieflingKid004.speaker: Zaki
AD_TieflingKid004.text: You're one of those toad-people Zorru saw!

session_synopses.AD_ZorruGuard: Zorru and another tiefling speak. Zorru mentions the gith are after him - Tilses isn't sure they even exist.
session_synopses.AD_TieflingKid004: Tiefling kid recognises Lae'zel as a githyanki via AD

AD_Parents.speaker: Locke
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Crying - grieving. Your daughter is dead

AD_Parents.speaker: Komira
AD_Parents.context: NodeContext: Holding back tears to comfort your husband - trying to be strong

Guard3.speaker: Mino
Guard3.text: The Rite of Thorns has ceased; it seems you will be allowed to stay - but behave.
Guard3.context: NodeContext: The atmosphere in the grove is slightly less tense when this line is spoken, but it's not exactly friendly either.

Guard2.speaker: Maggran
Guard2.text: You're lucky I'm not in my bear form. Back off.
Guard2.context: NodeContext: Human form. He's done talking and wants rid of the player

AD_Protesters.speaker: Amek
AD_Protesters.text: Your master let us in here. We're your guests!
AD_Protesters.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting at some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_Protesters.speaker: Rechel
AD_Protesters.context: NodeContext: Angry, Shouting in reference to some druids who're trying to force them out of the grove and into danger.

AD_ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
AD_ParentsScene.text: Step back - you sully our holy ground!

node_data.speaker: Maggran
node_data.text: *Roar!*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Threatening roar + aggressive stance from the bear/druid. But he doesn't attack.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Calm, Maggran. Give them a chance.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druid guard raises a hand to her bear colleague, stilling him.NodeContext: She's addressing the bear, but 'give him/her a chance' is more for the player's benefit.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - get back.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna (druid1) turns to address the player.NodeContext: Entry not up for discussion.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: If it weren't for me, you'd be overrun by goblins by now. I'll go where I please.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: Keep back. Force my hand, and I'll show you its claws.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Bear-druid glowers menacingly when druid says 'show you its claws'.NodeContext: Final warning.

node_data.speaker: Mino
node_data.text: A moment, Jeorna.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mino  interjects, approaching Jeorna's side.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: What...? Oh. I understand.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mino whispers something inaudible to Jeorna, who glances at you with realisation of something.

node_data.speaker: Jeorna
node_data.text: You - apparently Kagha wants to see you. Go ahead.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jeorna's attention is fully with the player again. She waves them through the checkpoint.NodeContext: Sudden change of tone. She bruskly allows the player to pass.

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Let my daughter go - right now.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: In the guards face - have the feeling of a showdownNodeContext: AbSolutely furious and ready to fight ever single druid with your bare hands if you have to. These people took your daughter  - and you're going to get her back.

ParentsScene.speaker: Jeorna
ParentsScene.text: She's a thief, hellspawn. And you will wait for Kagha's judgement. Now get back.
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Leaning over her - roaring in her faceNodeContext: Snapping back at the woman. The child is a thief and a liar as far as you're concerned. Right in her face as you snap at her to get back,

ParentsScene.speaker: Komira
ParentsScene.text: Argh. Let me through, mragreshem, or I'll rip your damned throat out!
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Move as if to push past the guardsNodeContext: You've lost your temper, you're pushing past - utterly furious

ParentsScene.speaker: Maggran
ParentsScene.context: CinematicNodeContext: Transform into a bear. Stamping the ground and roaring - the tieflings jumpe back wards.NodeContext: Roar in rage as you transform into a bear

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.text: Unless you have news of Arabella I don't want to hear it.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You still don't know if your daughter is okay. Tense and irritated - snapping a little though you don't mean to. You're just worried.

Parents.speaker: Player
Parents.text: Kagha will release her soon, just hold on.

Parents.speaker: Komira
Parents.context: NodeContext: Player has just said your daughter will be released 'soon'. Snapping and frustrated. You need to see here and you're terrified for her.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Hang on, love. This'll be over soon enough - we just gotta wait a bit longer.
Parents.context: NodeContext: You see your wife's temper rising and you're trying to calm the situation. You know she's just worried for your daughter.

Parents.speaker: Locke
Parents.text: Thank you. Sincerely. I don't know what we'd do without our little girl.
Parents.context: NodeContext: Turning to the player - love and gratitude in your voice.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Komira
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: Damn it. We could have taken those guards.

AD_ParentsLeaving.speaker: Locke
AD_ParentsLeaving.text: I'd rather you not get eaten by a bear.

SoloParentB.speaker: Komira
SoloParentB.text: The ritual is stopped. That's all Arabella wanted. That's what she tried so hard to do. Please - leave me.

session_synopses.AD_Parents: Situation 1: Locke and Marrick have learned their daughter is dead - killed by Sagha and her snake. Situation 2: Locke and Marrick have been denied entry into the inner grove. They are standing close to the entrance trying to figure out their next step. Marrick is happy to charge in but Locke is advising caution. Their daughter is inside.
session_synopses.Guard3: A druid guarding the entrance to the inner part of a sacred druid grove. He curtly warns the player to behave.
session_synopses.Guard2: Maggran (druid guarding the entrance to the inner sanctum of the Emerald Grove) is in bear form. He delivers curt, bestial one-liners if the player has speak with animals. He doesn't want them around. He has a lone human fallback line should he somehow transform.
session_synopses.AD_Protesters: Three tieflings voice their anger at how they're being treated by the druids of the grove. They've been barred from entry into an innermost section while the fdruids conduct a ritual that will ultimately seal off the grove.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsScene: (script comment: it is repeated, but I don't want it to be culled out)This occurs as the player approaches the scene. Locke and Marrick are arguing with two druid guards - trying to get in. Their daughter is inside but they are being denied entrance.Tensions are high and voices are raised. This is a tense exchange.
session_synopses: Three druids guard the entrance to the inner part of their sanctuary, blocking any outsiders. They're on edge, having recently driven back some outraged tiefling refugees who know the druids hold one of their children captive. One of the druids transformed into a bear during this confrontation, causing the tieflings to back down. Now we try to gain passage while tempers are still running hot.
session_synopses.ParentsScene: Marricko and Locke are trying to force their way past multiple guards to get into the inner grove. Their daughter was taken by the druids and stands accused of thievery. This is a tense scene - the threat of violence close to the surface. Their daughter is NOT present - she is in the inner chambers of the druid grove.
session_synopses.Parents: Locke and Marrick are parents who are scared for their daughter Arabella. Taken by the druids, Arabella is appearing in court on accusations of thievery. Her parents have no doubt that she is guilty but they are terrified for her and trying to get to her.Marrick hides his concern throughout with anger and threats of violence. It is easier to deal with fury then it is to temper fear. Locke is more level-headed but no less close to violence. Marrick and Locke are both at the entrance to the inner grove and the sacred pool and have just been denied entry.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsLeaving: Parents have just walked away from guards after being threatened. The situation has dissolved but they are tense - the wife in particular.
session_synopses.SoloParentB: Marricko's dialog after her kid is back (and she thanked and rewarded the player) or after learning that her kid is dead.
session_synopses.AD_ParentsSeeCorpse: This is the edgecase in which the player takes Arabella's corpse and dumps it in front of her parents. They are hysterical with grief.

AD_Flee.text: Blast it all! I'm going home.

AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Calling out to someone she has seen but not met. Friendly and inviting.

session_synopses.AD_Flee: Auntie Ethel has been either attacked or disrupted in some way and runs off home - annoyed.
session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: This is the hag calling out to a player she doesn't know. The player is a distance from her, and she is cheerily waving a hello.

FrescoFoundingGrove.speaker: Narrator
FrescoFoundingGrove.text: *The fresco shows a group of druids, gathered in Silvanus' name. You are on sacred ground.*

FrescoAlliance.speaker: Narrator
FrescoAlliance.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

VB_EmptyHolder.speaker: Player
VB_EmptyHolder.text: The stone's less worn here. Recently uncovered.

VB_LockedLibrary.speaker: Player
VB_LockedLibrary.text: I can't even see a lock to pick.

FrescoWorking.speaker: Narrator
FrescoWorking.text: *The druids of this grove cleansed the land once.*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
the moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

FrescoVictory.speaker: Narrator
FrescoVictory.text: *History or myth. Whatever is depicted here is long past.*

VB_ObtainedReward.speaker: Player
VB_ObtainedReward.text: The glaive the druid's notebook mentioned. Its owner thought it was cursed...

session_synopses.FrescoFoundingGrove: Player is examining a mural on the wall of the Druid's Grove, depicting its foundation.
session_synopses.FrescoAlliance: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting two sides agreeing an alliance. Pass a test to realise that one side are the druids of the wild, and the other the Harpers - a secret organisation.
session_synopses.VB_EmptyHolder: Player finds a slot in the wall where you can fit a slab of stone. This is where we'll place a stone rune, if we find one.
session_synopses.VB_LockedLibrary: Player tries to open a stone door, but it's just a blank slab. There's no place for a key.
session_synopses.FrescoWorking: Player is viewing a mural depicting druids and animals driving monsters from the forest.
session_synopses.FrescoVictory: In a well-lit cave. Player looks at a fresco depicting a group of druids standing over a vanquished army. Pass a test to realise that the army was the army of Shar - a Dark Goddess.
session_synopses.VB_ObtainedReward: Player finds a glaive in a locked room. Reading a nearby book you might learn it was taken from the Shadow cursed lands by Halsin, who found it was infused with dark power. (It does have a special power - the glaive deals 1d6 extra necrotic damage to characters UNLESS they're standing in sunlight.)

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: Have you heard? Scouts have just reported the goblins have been neutralised. The way is clear!

Transition.speaker: Gerson the Bent
Transition.text: The others are gathering near the gate - come on!

session_synopses.Transition: This scene plays for people in the Druid Grove if another player kills the Goblin Leaders away from the Grove.

AD.speaker: Guex
AD.context: NodeContext: Concentrating, exerting himself - then flubbing it.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Step, parry, strike - damn it! It's just not... agh!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Trying and failing at swordplay practiceNodeContext: Frustrated. Practicing swordplay with little success - then reacts with alarm upon seeing a gith

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Sorry, sorry. I've just never seen... your face is... well. I should get back to it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Apologising, A little unnerved by a gith

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You'd better surrender - that target's a far better fighter.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You have a better way? 'Cause I'm all ears.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fed up

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: We need to be ready for a fight - but I'm useless with a sword.
node_data.context: NodeContext: 'I'm doing my best, but my best isn't good enough'

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No wonder you're struggling - you've no balance. Space your feet farther apart.
True

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: I'll try and brace them better - like so. Step-brace, parry, swing! Yes!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Practicing his swing.NodeContext: Successful attempt

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Good advice - If I had two copper, I'd owe you one.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful (but he has nothing to give the player)

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: You really know what you're doing! Found this by the road - bet you'll put it to good use.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Keep training. In time, you'll make short work of any goblins.

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: Hopefully it's just the goblins we have to worry about - the druids are treating us like vermin.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He's still got misgivings - the goblins aren't the only threat

node_data.speaker: Guex
node_data.text: But I'll keep at it. Thank you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grateful

session_synopses.AD: Guex, a tiefling refugee, practices his swordplay on a wooden dummy. If he received pointers from the player, his efforts are improved. Otherwise, he stuggles.
session_synopses: Tiefling is practicing his swing on  a dummy, trying to improve. The player can offer advice, potentially improving the tiefling's form.

GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.speaker: Narrator
GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft.text: *The druids will not stand by while you abscond with their idol. Your next move will decide your fate.*

session_synopses.GroveConflict_IdolWarningTheft: This dialog triggers when you attempt to move or steal the idol.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: Dance upon the stars tonight. Smile and pain will fade away. Words of mine will change - no. Become - ugh.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lightly strumming her lute. Not looking at the player. NodeContext: Softly singing. Sadness in every note. There is a small pause between every line as you softly sing.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: More like butchering. Don't know why I bother.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at lute - frustratedNodeContext: Speaking of her own music. Embarassed and frustrated with herself. Dejected.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: No. I'm moments away from a grisly death...
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks at player. NodeContext: Sarcasm mixed with frustation.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: ...at the hands of this bloody song. I can't... nothing fits, you know?
Bard.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and frustrated with herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Why are you songwriting now? Hardly the best time.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I... we lost people on the way here.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: And the dead deserve to be remembered. That's what my teacher always said.
Bard.context: NodeContext: She's thinking of her teacher who died on the way. Grief in her voice.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: This grove could become a battlefield soon enough. It's not the time for music.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I know. I should be packing up, but I need to finish this song. It's... it's important.
Bard.context: NodeContext: Player has advised her to leave. But she can't - she has to finish her song. Frustrated, mainly at herself.

Bard.speaker: Player
Bard.text: Snatch the lute out of her hands and smash it.
CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player grabs the lute out of Alfira's hands and smashes it on the ground.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: What did you do?! My teacher gave me that! And she - and she's dead, you bastard.
Bard.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stands up. NodeContext: Player smashed your lute - you're hysterical and furious.

Bard.speaker: Alfira
Bard.text: I wanted to write a song for her and you - you ruined it. You ruined everything.

AD_QuitComposing.speaker: Alfira
AD_QuitComposing.text: If not a bard, then an adventurer? No, I don't have the stomach for it.
AD_QuitComposing.context: NodeContext: Doesn't sound hopeful. Was convinced by the player to quit music. Dejected.

session_synopses.Bard:
Alfira is a young bard who was apprenticed to a woman called Lihala. On their journey to the camp, they were attacked by gnolls, and Lihala died horribly.
Alfira is trying to compose a song in honour of the teacher she loved so dearly, but is struggling. The player can help her play, talk ther through the lyrics, steal her instrument, or even convince her to give up music.
This is a very soft and touching moment in the grove. Should Alfira finish her song (with the aid of the player) she will stand up and sing it in a cinematic scene.
session_synopses.AD_QuitComposing: Dejected, the bard wonders what she will do as the player has convinced her to give up music.

CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.speaker: GROUP_Civilians, GROUP_Dwarves, GROUP_Elves, GROUP_Gith, GROUP_Guards, GROUP_Humans, GROUP_Tiefling
CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime.text: The goblin is escaping! Kill it!

session_synopses.CapturedGoblin_AD_Crime: Assorted residents of the Druid Grove react to a goblin prisoner having broken free.

AD_GreetingPlayer.speaker: Asharak
AD_GreetingPlayer.context: NodeContext: Introducing the player to his students.

session_synopses.AD_GreetingPlayer: Trainer introducing the player to the class. The player has just walked up.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Wyvern poison. Let's hope it doesn't come to that.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better a quick draught than ceremorphosis, nonetheless.

PAD_Cyanide.speaker: Player
PAD_Cyanide.text: Better to have on hand than not.

AD_Busy.speaker: Nettie
AD_Busy.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hand raised in a sign to wait and then turns back to what she was doing .NodeContext: Terse, impatient. She's dealing with serious matters right now.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: I see you. Just give me a moment.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Examining Injured birdNodeContext: Examining Injured bird

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Is there anything I can do to help?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: A moment!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still working on the birdNodeContext: Working on bird, doesn't look up at player

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Vis medicatrix...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Casts spell (healing word) on the bird.NodeContext: A quietly murmured spell

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: There. It's up to her now. Life or death.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Still looking at the birdNodeContext: Still looking at the bird

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Now, what -
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Turns to the playerNodeContext: Friendly, but cuts herself off when she sees you're a race she doesn't like

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Drow. Last time I saw one of you folk, he tried to slit me open. I hope you're more agreeable.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Doesn't like drow, but she's willing to give you a chance.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'm looking for Nettie.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: You found her. But I still don't know what she can do for you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know anything about mind flayers?

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: ...Why are you asking?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Cautious. You've just asked what she knows about very dangerous creatures.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Humour my curiosity.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: I know they're nasty creatures. Can get in your head and convince you up is down.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Suspects you're not telling her everything

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: And that's not all they'll do inside your head.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: Tell me honestly: are you infected? Is that why you're asking?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: No, of course not. I ask everyone that question.

node_data.speaker: Nettie
node_data.text: All right. Well, come back if you need anything.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Not fully convinced

AD.speaker: Nettie
AD.text: I'll have to tidy this place.

AD_TadpoledStart.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledStart.text: We need to be quick. This way.
AD_TadpoledStart.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing for the player to follower her as she escorts them to the storage room, where they will be quarantined. NodeContext: Concerned

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I wonder what happened to that drow.

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: Is there a dead tadpole in that jar?

PAD_SeeDrow.speaker: Player
PAD_SeeDrow.text: I can't tell if this is a temple or a library.

AD_TadpoledCombat.speaker: Nettie
AD_TadpoledCombat.text: Please. Don't make me do this.

PAD_LockedUp.speaker: Player
PAD_LockedUp.text: So much for honesty. Our healer turned into a jailor pretty quickly once she heard about the tadpole.

PAD_LockedUp.speaker: Player
PAD_LockedUp.text: Can't blame anyone for reacting with fear - but it might do to keep our condition on a need-to-know basis.

PAD_Relieved.speaker: Player
PAD_Relieved.text: I can feel the poison clearing - I'm cured!

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: This 'Halsin' has been studying the tadpole.

PAD_TadpoleResearch.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleResearch.text: We should find him, maybe he can help?

AD_Studying.speaker: Nettie
AD_Studying.text: The more I read, the more sure I am. This is for the best.

LockedUp.speaker: Nettie
LockedUp.text: I'm sorry. There's nothing you can say to change my mind.

session_synopses.PAD_Cyanide: Context: Nettie has given the player a vial of poison to take if they start turning into mind flayers. Players reflect on whether they should actually take it if the time comes.Speaker 1 has just promised Nettie they will take the poison if they begin to turn. (SPEAK TO JORDI, The Speaker 1 nodes may need to be changed. )Speaker 2 reacts to Speaker 1 acquiring the poison after swearing to Nettie they'll use it if they start to turn.Gale - Shadowheart: We'll resort to poison if necessary.Lae'zel - Astarion - Wyll - Karlach: It won't come to that - don't entertain the option.
session_synopses.AD_Busy: Nettie is dealing with a player and has been interrupted by another player.
session_synopses: Nettie is the apprentice of Halsin, the missing druid. We can tell her about the parasite in our heads. She listens with compassion but decides the player is too dangerous and must be quarantined. If she knows about the parasite, she'll invite the player to come with her deeper into her rooms for "treatement."
session_synopses.AD: This triggers as Nettie is at her desk in Halsin's lab, researching and organising. The bird she was treating may have died at this point.
session_synopses.Bird: This bird has been told to go and find Halsin and you're interupting him just as he's getting ready to take flight. He's tense and in a hurry to be gone, so he'll only answer one question before taking to the skies and carrying out his mission.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledStart: Nettie's comments as she walks with the 'infected' player to the storage room, where they will be quarantined.
session_synopses.PAD_SeeDrow: The player broke inside the room without Nettie. Normally they follow her inside and they get the info from her. The VB stops playing when the tadpoled scene with Nettie starts or when Halsin is found in the goblin camp.
session_synopses.AD_TadpoledCombat: The player triggered combat during the tadpoled scene
session_synopses.AD_WithBird: Nettie is tending to a badly wounded bird. The bird is weak, its life hangs in the balance, but Nettie is doing what she can.
session_synopses.PAD_LockedUp: This is the VB that plays after Nettie locks the players up in her study once the players refuse to take the poison. She doesn't fight them, but the party reflects on her actions as a result of confessing the existence of the tadpoles.Speaker 1 is the player who disclosed the information and may show regret or indifference towards the current state.Speaker 2 comments on speaker 1 telling the truth to Nettie.
session_synopses.PAD_Relieved: The player is cured from poison ( the status DEN_APPRENTICE_THORN). This status has 3 stages leading to death. Each time the player make a long rest, they get closer to death.This PAD of relief plays only if the status reached the stages 2 or 3. The status was getting worse and worse, which must have been worrying, but now they've been cured.
session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleResearch: Player read Halsin's research on the mind flayer tadpole. The VB plays only if they didn't find Halsin already and didn't go through the tadpoled scene with Nettie (otherwise they got all that information from her so it's not a surprise).
session_synopses.AD_ToStorage: Nettie has arrived with the 'infected' player and is  gesturing for them go into the storage unit.
session_synopses.AD_Studying: After poisoning the tadpoled player, Nettie settles down at her old Master's desk to see if she can uncover any secrets about the tadpole in his research.
session_synopses.LockedUp: During the scene where she scratches you. Nettie is in the lab, sitting at a table, studiying Halsin's notes. The player can still try to persuade her to give the antidote. The player must also accept to take the wyvern poison. The other choice is to kill Nettie.

AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.speaker: Olodan
AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba.text: Nature's ruination! You have spoiled everything!

SnakesCourt.speaker: Arabella
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: The druids are holding court. The child stands with a snake guarding her, facing judgment. She cries out an apology.

SnakesCourt.speaker: Rath
SnakesCourt.text: This is madness, Kagha. She's just a...

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: A what, Rath? A thief? A poison? A threat?

SnakesCourt.speaker: Kagha
SnakesCourt.text: I will imprison the devil. And I will cast out every stranger.
SnakesCourt.context: CinematicNodeContext: . |Kagha turns and stares directly at you after the first line,

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

Denouncing.speaker: Player
Denouncing.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

Denouncing.speaker: Olodan
Denouncing.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

Denouncing.speaker: Rath
Denouncing.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

PAD_FoundSecretLocation.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundSecretLocation.text: Hm - must be the tree from the note to Kagha. What's that cleft there?

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *You see a sharp intelligence behind its eyes. Is it a familiar or another druid enjoying their wildshape?*

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Mercy on us, Silvanus - mercy, mercy, mercy.

Opposed.speaker: Player
Opposed.text: The child is to blame. She shouldn't have stolen in the first place.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: Preventable. The sickening result of sickening beliefs.

Opposed.speaker: Rath
Opposed.text: We let this happen. We let this snake replace our leader.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: Shadow Druids? There's more to Kagha than meets the eye.

PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter.text: It's time we had a talk with her, don't you think?

Leader.speaker: Kagha
Leader.text: Go on. Say it. You think I'm a monster.

Leader.speaker: Wyll
Leader.text: Monster? Too kind. A demon, more like.

Leader.speaker: Player
Leader.text: Honestly, I just wanted to see what would happen.

KidFreed.speaker: Arabella
KidFreed.text: Not now, I have to get back!

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *You consider the Rite of Thorns. A rare art, plucked from illicit domains.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Player
SelfReflection.text: Think back to your teachings. What are the rite's perils?

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *When the prayer ends, vines curl upwards from the earth and thorns sprout forth.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *Those within are isolated and those without, rejected. Isolation breeds violence. Few circles survive it.*

SelfReflection.speaker: Narrator
SelfReflection.text: *There is more to Kagha's tale. The grove must hide her secrets.*

session_synopses.AD_ShadowDruid_001_DruidLeaderDied_Comba: Leader of the shadow druids ADs in combat.
session_synopses.SnakesCourt: Druids hold court to determine whether or not to lock up a tiefling child for stealing their precious artifact. If you fail to stop them, the child tries to run and is attacked by their guardian snakes.Sagha the druid leader is the main player in this scene. She is machiavellian, and flips to evil should the snakes attack the child.
session_synopses.Denouncing: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundSecretLocation: Player notice the tree that contains Kagha's letter from the Shadow Druids. They might find it by chance or know it was there.The note that sends players here reads like this: [The marks crisscrossing the page don't look scribed so much as slashed.]Kagha.Swamp-docks. Tree. Meet me. Alone.Olodan.
session_synopses.001: Shadow Druid in rat shape. Trying to use speak with animals or animal handling results in nothing.
session_synopses.Opposed: Rath is a human druid opposed to Kagha, who has taken control of the grove in Halsin's absence. He is a kind, determined man, who seeks to keep nature in balance and prevent violence at all costs.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundRecruitmentLetter: Player found and read the recruitment letter that Kagha got from the Shadow Druids.
session_synopses.Leader: Player speaks with Kagha, the secret Shadow druid. Various paths of conversation reflect whether Kagha's actions led to a child's death or not. She may be neutral/Machiavellian or pure evil, depending.
session_synopses.KidFreed: |Arabella (Snake Kid) after she ran away from the druid lair.|
session_synopses.AD_LeaderPersuaded: Plays ONLY if Rath died in the combat against the Shadow Druids! If Rath is alive, He and Kagha have an AD together instead. In all cases, Kagha is mourning, shocked and repentant at what she has done.
session_synopses.SelfReflection: Following Kagha's dialogue, if druid player asked about the rite and has not already discovered the shadow druid connection, they experience a self-reflection. There is more to this tale; you should search Kagha's quarters. Journal entry to search her quarters appears.

session_synopses.DEN_PleaAtTheGate_Adventurers: World behaviours for Aradin and the group, they are banging at the gate

session_synopses.AD: AD of very lazy bear in the water.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: He didn't come back, did he? His smell is gone. He's gone...
Bear.context: NodeContext: Detecting the bear's panick and concern.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: Master. He left with the weaponed two-legs. He said he'd be back.

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: But I can smell them - the weaponed ones. And I cannot smell him... he's not coming back...

Bear.speaker: Ormn
Bear.text: No... the woods have gone dark. There's too many predators lately - even for Master.

session_synopses.Bear: The bear is worried and depressed because Halsin hasn't come back yet.

AD_DarkUrgeSeesDeadChild.text: Is this the first time I've caused a child's death?

session_synopses.AD_DarkUrgeSeesDeadChild: Dark Urge sees a dead child after the destruction of the Den at the hands of goblins

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: Another stranger come to vex me. What will you do? Hunt me? Grab my tail? Shout until my head hurts?
002.context: NodeContext: This is a wild animal and the wrong move might endanger us

002.speaker: Player
002.text: I just wanted to give you my smell. I'll leave you be.

002.speaker: Silver
002.text: No - wait. You smell fresh. Safe. You can stay. If you must.
002.context: NodeContext: He's relazed, and wants the player to stay, though he doesn't want to admit it.

AD_BirdStealReaction.speaker: Topaz
AD_BirdStealReaction.context: InternalNodeContext: Custom crime reaction exclusive to the blue jay in this booster

session_synopses.002: An aggravated wolf in a druid grove. He has learned obedience from Rath but is still a wild thing at heart. There are newcomers to his home and his instincts tell him to chase them away, to harm them, but he's not allowed to. He's like a coiled spring, ready to strike.
session_synopses.AD_BirdStealReaction: AD of blue jay reacting to you stealing from its nest.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: |Cinematic: The woman cradled a carved wooden box, from which a soft melody chimed.|
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Lost in thought, holding the box as it's the most precious thing in the world.NodeContext: Sitting

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What are you doing?

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: Oh! Sorry, I'm just... I'm just listening.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Starting out of a reverie - suddenly embarrassed

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I used to hate this tune - told my husband as much when he made the bloody thing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Laughing, self-deprecating, self-conscious

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: But it kept our little monster quiet. Reason to love it if nothing else, trust me.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A tired and exasperated parent, remembering.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: ... how much do you think it's worth? Old Ethel said she'd offer me gold for it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She closes the box and plays her fingers along the lid. Abruptly, she offers it up.NodeContext: Hesitant and suddenly serious, intent on  your response

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why do you want to sell it?

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: I... don't have anything else. My husband was carrying our packs when the gnolls found us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little lost. Remembering something painful.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: My daughter, sh-she thought they were just big dogs. I tried to get to her... I tried, but-
node_data.context: NodeContext: Breaking up towards end of sentence, grieving

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: You must - you must think I'm a monster.  But they say you need coin to enter the city. Bribes.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Approaching hysteria, doesn't know what to do

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're no monster. I'm sorry you had to go through that.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: You're kind, but I - I can't think about that now. We promised one another we'd get there, whatever it took.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Waving off your sympathy - she's barely holding it together as it is.

node_data.speaker: Nerela
node_data.text: If we... if I don't, it... then they'll have died for nothing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Knows it's not logical, but can't dwell on tragedy or she'll break down

session_synopses: Nerela is wondering whether to sell a music box, the only memento she has of the husband and daughter who were killed by gnolls on the road here. It's a scam - her story is fabricated and the box is a dime a dozen. Player can comfort her or see through her story. Her overall demeanour is weary, fragile (unless you uncover her scam)

AD_Victory.speaker: Zevlor
AD_Victory.context: NodeContext: Announcing to everyone it's time to leave. Eager, putting on a brave face.

HeadedToCave.speaker: Zevlor
HeadedToCave.text: Hm? Come introduce yourself in the caves. I need to get people moving.
HeadedToCave.context: InternalNodeContext: The player can avoid DenIntro by progressing into the caves without talking to Zevlor

AD_WithGuard.speaker: Zevlor
AD_WithGuard.text: I hardly need a bodyguard, Tilses. This isn't Avernus.
AD_WithGuard.context: NodeContext: Wry - they're civilians but his former lieutenant is sticking to him like glue. [TIL-sez]

AD_WithGuard.speaker: Tilses
AD_WithGuard.text: No sir. At least the monsters there looked like monsters.
AD_WithGuard.context: NodeContext: Unperturbed, matter of fact - she doesn't trust the druids around them

PAD_ZevlorsMap.speaker: Player
PAD_ZevlorsMap.text: Looks like we're in Elturgard. East of the city of Baldur's Gate.

session_synopses.AD_Victory: Plays after the tieflings won Attack on Den or after completing Goblin Hunt. Zevlor is standing on the plateform above the gate of the Grove and he's watching the other tieflings below.
session_synopses.HeadedToCave: |Zevlor's default dialog need a timeline context, so this dialog here is used as a transition when Zevlor is walking back to his default spot after a big event happened in the Grove. There's 2 cases: after the raiding party and after druid attack.|
session_synopses.AD_WithGuard: Zevlor and Tilses are chatting together in his sub-region. Zevlor is worrying over plans for the future while Tilses stands ready to help.
session_synopses.PAD_ZevlorsMap: |Player clicked on Zevlor's map (a map of Elturgard that shows the road to Baldur's Gate). Zevlor will likely have drawn on it.|

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Hells, we can't just leave. They're kin.
Group.context: NodeContext: This is the start of the dialog but clearly an ongoing argument. You think it's your responsibility, as a tiefling, to stay and help your kin. You're angry, voice is level but will soon grow louder, and utterly convinced that staying at the camp is the right thing to do.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: I'll not gamble our lives, our futures, on people who are as good as dead. We must leave for Baldur's Gate - at once.
Group.context: NodeContext: You're angry but your voice is level. You think staying at the camp is essentially suicide. You cannot believe it was even suggested. You and your friends have brand new lives waiting for you in Baldur's Gate - to stay at the camp is reckless and pointless to you.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Can we all just take a moment? Please?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking for one to the other. Stuck in between them, pleading. Hands out as he tries to calm the situation. NodeContext: Your friend and sister are screaming at each other in front of you. Light and easygoing tone as you try to calm the argument.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: What's the point in blades and spells if we don't bloody use them? We should stay.
Group.context: NodeContext: Your voice is getting louder. You're very angry now. It's your civic duty to use the skills you have to help people. You cannot believe how selfish Rolan is being.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: These people aren't fighters. We can help.

Group.speaker: Cal
Group.text: Or yell louder. That's fine too.
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sighing as he shrugs. He knows neither is listening to him. NodeContext: Your friend and sister have ignored your plea. You know once they've started they'll just keep arguing until one of them gives in. This is almost said with a shrug and in a light, jokey tone.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You should all stay. A single blade could make a difference.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: No. This place is a death trap. Let us leave - immediately!
Group.context: NodeContext: Player has disagreed with you. You're frustrated and angry. You think it's ludicrous that anyone would disagree with you.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: Or would you deny your brother here his chance at fortune in Baldur's Gate?
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at Lia but gesturing to Cal. NodeContext: You know the argument is likely going your way and you're being a little bit of a dick here. You know mentioning Lia's brother is a guarantee that she'll give in to your side and leave with you. It's a bit of an underhanded move.

Group.speaker: Player
Group.text: You want fortune? There's coin in it if you stay.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: You know, that money could go towards a spiffy new outfit for your apprenticeship...?
Group.context: NodeContext: Smile, knowing rolan will give in

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.context: CinematicNodeContext: Generic 'taking' animation. Taking coin from the player.NodeContext: 'ZUR-gan.' Frustrated but giving in to the promise of going.

Group.speaker: Rolan
Group.text: If we survive, it'll make for a good story I suppose...
Group.context: NodeContext: Kinda sulky but accepting that you'll stay in the grove.

Group.speaker: Lia
Group.text: Thank you, Rolan. And thank you, friend.
Group.context: NodeContext: Warm and sincere. Directed at rolan and then player.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: We don't even know these people!
AD.context: NodeContext: Arguing with Lia. He thinks her suggestion to stay is suicide.

AD.speaker: Lia
AD.context: NodeContext: Rolan has claimed you don't even know the other tieflings. You're snapping back.

AD.speaker: Rolan
AD.text: Of course it does. You would choose strangers over us!

AD.speaker: Cal
AD.context: NodeContext: You sister and your best friend are arguing and it's getting progressively heated. You're trying to calm the situation but you also know they're going to keep ignoring you.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I can spare but a moment - Baldur's Gate awaits! Oh, I can almost smell the city.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Leaving for Baldur's Gate after a hell of an argument but isn't bothered. Excited to be leaving and seems oblvious to that fact that Lia is next to him, SEETHING.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You're cheerful for someone about to abandon his kin.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Well, you're here, aren't you? You can help them if you want.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: I don't believe in sacrifices for a lost cause.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: We're leaving for Baldur's Gate. And we will make it.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Are you always this selfish?

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: Tch. You're as bad as Lia.

node_data.speaker: Rolan
node_data.text: And I think one of her is quite enough in my life. Good day to you.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: Those goblins will rue the day they chose to tangle with this grove.

Sister.speaker: Lia
Sister.text: You and I will do some good here - I can feel it.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Lia and Rolan would never admit it, but they'd take an arrow for the other. Also stab each other. Not sure what'll come first.
Brother.context: NodeContext: You have broken up a fight between Lia and Rolan more times than you can count. You're tone is light and friendly as you joke with the player.

Brother.speaker: Cal
Brother.text: Thanks for cutting in - there might have been more than words if you hadn't.
Brother.context: NodeContext: A big friendly smile - you are the most genuine of the group

session_synopses.Group:
Three people are having an argument. Rolan, Lia and Cal. Lia and Cal are brother and sister, but the three of them have grown up together. They're young, talented tieflings who are heading to Baldur's Gate to start their lives and careers. Rolan argues that they should leave now and get to the city while they still can. Lia argues that it is irresponsible to leave their kin behind. Cal is stuck in the middle.
This is a passionate and fiery argument, both sides are convinced that they are correct.
session_synopses.AD: This occurs betwen Lia, Cal and Ronan. There are mixed ADs which occur - when they're arguing about when to stay and go, when they've decided to stay and when they've decided to go.
session_synopses: This occurs after the argument with Lia. If they're leaving for Baldur's Gate he's pretty relaxed about the argument and dismissive of Lia and her concerns. If they're staying in the grove, he's furious and is convinced they'll die here.
session_synopses.Sister: This occurs after the argument betwen Lia and Rolan. Lia is still stewing after the fight. Opportunity to get to know her better and understand the group dynamics.
session_synopses.Brother: This dialog occurs after the argument between Lia and Rolan that Cal attempted to mediate. It's light and friendly, and mainly a chance for the player to get to know Cal.

RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.speaker: Barth
RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses.text: Damn it. I wish we could at least give them a proper burial.

RaidAdventurer.speaker: Remira
RaidAdventurer.text: Once we're patched up, we're gone.

LeaderAtCorpses.speaker: Aradin
LeaderAtCorpses.text: Thought you was busy with the foulbloods in Halsin's grove.

AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses.speaker: Barth
AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses.text: He didn't make it this far. You saw them grab him.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: You shouldn't have brought Liam along. Lad was too young.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Aradin
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Everyone needs to cut their teeth sometime.

AD_AradinAndRemira.speaker: Remira
AD_AradinAndRemira.text: Cut his teeth?! For his sake, I hope he's dead already.

session_synopses.RobbedAdventurerAtCorpses: The adventurer is standing next to the corpses of her comrades he left behind while running for the goblins.
session_synopses.RaidAdventurer:
Age: mid-30-40s.
Female
Bio: Rough and working-class. A veteran of many expeditions, Remira is nonetheless shaken after a raid gone horribly wrong and trying to hide it behind bravado. She feels guilty for leaving a new recruit to die, but tries to wave it away and gets defensive if confronted over it. She’s sarcastic and casually racist.
session_synopses.LeaderAtCorpses: Aradin comes across the corpses of some of his friends, who were lost during the goblin raid. He's in a neutral location at a bridge and observing the corpses of his people and of goblins, who were also killed in the fight.
session_synopses.AD_RemiraBarthAtCorpses: Remira and Aradin are discussing the fate of their fallen comrades at the hands of goblins
session_synopses.AD_AradinAndRemira: Aradin and Remira are having a drink after arriving back in the Druid Grove.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: If it ain't the fearless goblin-slayer.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Aggressive, but not powerfully so. He's not a friendly guy.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: You sure you want to be seen with me? I ain't exactly popular with this lot.
node_data.context: NodeContext: with a grimace - 'this lot' refers specifically to the tiefling refugees who are nearby but not necessarily in-shot, but he's grumpy enough that it also refers to just about everybody in the world

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You could try to be a little friendlier.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Thanks, mum. Now please do feck off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Thick with sarcasm

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Feck off yourself - I saved your skin back at the gates.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Yeah, you really saved the day, swooping in and playing the hero.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Sarcastic and punchable

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Now I'm gonna take the blame for leading the goblins here, and losing track of the bloody druid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: He knows these things are his fault, but he's sulking and petulant about it

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Where did the goblins come from?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: They chased us all the way from the ruins we were poking around in.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Sounds like you were looking for trouble.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: We was looking for a relic. Had a contract to find it, and the fella who runs this place came along on the job with us.
node_data.context: NodeContext: petulant

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Didn't work out, though. Goblins got him when we were turning tail. He's either diggin' latrines or boilin' in a cookpot by now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Did you think getting rich would be easy?

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Dunno what I expected. That much gold for some long-lost relic. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: And from a wizard, too. I shoulda known. The gold probably turns to lead the moment you leave Baldur's Gate.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: Stupid thing to die for...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: But gold ain't any use if you're too cold to spend it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Flippant

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just tell me where to find the relic.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: It's called the Nightsong. Supposed to be hidden under the temple where the goblins jumped us.

node_data.speaker: Aradin
node_data.text: I'd give you the map and wish you a happy funeral, but my mate Brian kept hold of it like his own todger. Goblins made short of the fat old chunk.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Disrespectful

session_synopses: Adventurer leader dialogue. Mostly used during Adventurers Quest. This is after the player has stopped Zevlor and Aradin from fighting one another. Aradin returns to his den to lick his wounds.

BridgeSign.speaker: Player
BridgeSign.context: NodeContext: Reading a signpost. Elturel pronounced 'ELL-tur-ELL'. Baldur pronounced 'Ball-dur'

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

session_synopses.BridgeSign: Sign near a stone bridge linking the Druid Grove to the Ruined Village. Establishes where the player is in relation to the city of Baldur's Gate. After reading this, natives of the city may pass comment, noting that they know broadly where they are now.
session_synopses.EmptyMindflayerPod: Players encountered an empty pod in forest.

PAD_SeluniteNecklace.speaker: Player
PAD_SeluniteNecklace.context: NodeContext: Guarded disdain upon seeing a Selunite necklace (SH is not known to be a Shar worshipper)

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

session_synopses.PAD_SeluniteNecklace: Reflection on the Selunite necklace found in the abandoned village.
session_synopses.AD_FoundJournal: The party finds a old diary in the ruined schoolhouse of an abandoned village. They comment that it might shed some light on what happened here.

session_synopses.AD_Mocking: Worg laughing at the unfoiruntae gnome getting tossed around.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

session_synopses.PAD: Players see plans at the workstation where Sampson used to clear his head.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Tracker
node_data.text: Send them to the dirt!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Preparing for battle - and excited for it.

session_synopses: A goblin tracker stands guard as their leader torments a captive. If the player interferes, they turn hostile (unless the player is a drow - in this case the goblins are servile and afraid). Delivery should be vicious and mean-spirited - they're torturing a helpless gnome for sport.

Spotted.speaker: Chock
Spotted.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ogres eating a corpse and remark on what it tastes like, custom scene viewer

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Gentlemen - contain yourselves. This quarrel sours our feast. Besides - taste like pork!

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Brothers, look here. I have eyed yet another prize. Fortune favours our bellies!

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Stranger: be you friend or food? The mark is Her measure: show us the brand of the Absolute.

Spotted.speaker: Player
Spotted.text: You're quite eloquent for an ogre.

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: Am I not astonishing? A robust diet makes for a shrewd mind, you see. I am a gourmand...

Spotted.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
Spotted.text: ... and you, a delicacy - unless you bear the mark, of course.

session_synopses.Spotted:
Three ogres are eating remains and arguing about what the remains taste like..Then they spy the player, who needs to prove themselves to keep from being eaten.

Two of them are stupid, like most ogres. One of them, Lump, is very smart after accidentally eating a headband of intellect. His voice should be deep, and he should sounds lascivious in the way he speaks of food.

VB_EggPickedUp.speaker: Player
VB_EggPickedUp.text: She'll tear me in two for touching her egg.
VB_EggPickedUp.context: NodeContext: Urgent. The player's taken an owlbear's unhatched egg while in combat with the owlbear mother (think a grizzly bear with a beak).

session_synopses.VB_EggPickedUp: The player discovers an intact owlbear egg (think something the size of an ostrich egg) and makes an impressed remark. If there's an adult owlbear nearby, the player will remark that interferring with the egg will put them in danger.

session_synopses.VB_DiscoverPriests: Player spots the wounded True Soul and his minions, is wary about what's going on.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Huh. Haven't seen that game in years.
PAD.context: NodeContext: Karlach: Little sing-song to the tune of 'one, two, buckle my shoe'

session_synopses.PAD: A faded children's game marked on the floor - tic-tac-toe or hopscotch, maybe. Different races remark may or may not recall the game from their youth. Planar or gith might not recognize it - assume it's code.

session_synopses.AD_Dog: Scratch the courier's dog barks and growls as you near him, warning you away. Sound effects only.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Urrrgh... magga cammara - those pustulent thugs!
node_data.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Cinematic/actor context - the deep gnome sways dizzilyNodeContext: 'Magga cammara' pronounced 'Mag-ah cam-ah-rah'. Gnomish exclamation meaning 'by the stones'.
Barcus the deep gnome is suffering some grogginess after spinning on the sail of a windmill for the last while.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well - get on with it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of sorts after his ordeal spinning on a windmill, now a mixture of resigned and annoyed. He's expecting you to extort him now.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Get on with what?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You saved me. Now you'll extort me. That's how this works, yes?
node_data.context: NodeContext: impatient

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You owe me nothing.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I could extort you, if that's what you want.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: You're teasing me now. I'm certain of it.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Take my pack if you can find it. The only reason those goblins caught me was its weight. I'll travel lightly from now on.
node_data.context: InternalNodeContext: Has not offered pack yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

SlowDown.speaker: Fezzerk
SlowDown.text: What's goin' on back there? Go check it out!
SlowDown.context: NodeContext: He turns to his right as he tells the other goblins to check it out.

session_synopses: The player speaks to a deep gnome after freeing him from some goblins, who'd had him tied to the sail of a windmill. The player discovers that the deep gnome travelled to the region as he learned his old friend is in danger. By way of thanks, he provides the player with the means to craft smokepowder, an explosive item. He then leaves for the Underdark in search of his friend. There, the player may encounter him again.
session_synopses.SlowDown: The player senses a windmill's rotation slow or halt entirely, or speed up, after the player changed the speed. If present, some goblins go to investigate the disturbance.
session_synopses.AD: If the player gets the windmill to stop spinning, then clicks Barcus, Barcus will get these lines. Barcus will be impatient, mistrustful of the player, but still in need of player's help.
session_synopses.AD_RotatingFasterReaction: Said while being spun faster on the pane of a windmill. Should be in a panic.

AD.speaker: Player
AD.text: Seems like nature's provided a shortcut.
AD.context: NodeContext: Pleased (but also oblivious - when this line fires, the player has failed to realise that the tree trunk bridge they're crossing is dangerously rotten and about to collapse)

session_synopses.AD: The party crosses a fallen tree bridging a gorge. Their senses may perceive that the trunk is rotten and they mustn't cross all at once, or they may remain oblivious to the danger.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Never thought I'd ever walk in on a bugbear and an ogre.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Everytime I close my eyes, I can see... it.

session_synopses.PAD_AfterFight: VB that plays after killing the bugbear and the ogre when we got attacked barging in on them having sex.Speaker 1 and Speaker 2 ended up fighting them.

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

session_synopses.AD_MissingPoster: A faded poster of missing children in an abandoned village, indicating an earlier Dark Justiciar abduction.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sickle is yours for the taking.*

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: There's only one place I'm finding a sussur tree: the Underdark.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

session_synopses.VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear: Player sees a phase spider slip in and out of reality.Probably not clear exactly what it was.
session_synopses.ForgeWeapon: The player has all the ingredients and fires up the furnace to make their masterwork.This is all narration; narration needed as most of this scene will likely not be visually communicative.
session_synopses.PAD_NatureCheckOutcome: Player is commenting on a rare ingredient needed for crafting a powerful weapon. Sussur bark can only be found in the Underdark.
session_synopses.PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined: After the player places the sussur bark he will react to it. If they know about the plans they will say to use one of the three weapons. If not they'll say that maybe they can do something with the forge.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: Go on - more of us inside.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Git over there. Surround 'em, like.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gesturing to the other goblinsNodeContext: In a loud whisper

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I know you're there. Show yourselves.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: You spotted us. Good. 'S like they say...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Hands on hips, cockyNodeContext: Covering up their surprise

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: No fun in skewerin' a pig what doesn't know he's cooked.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A threat

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I don't want any trouble.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: An' I didn't want to be stuck moppin' up nosy trespassers like you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The goblin is annoyed to be stuck on guard duty

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Ain't no one gettin' their way today.

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Or you turn around, an' your backside gets the same treatment.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Just let me by and we'll pretend this never happened.
False

node_data.speaker: Goblin Booyahg
node_data.text: Here's what I'm thinkin' - we kill you, an' I keep your ears to remember the occasion.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Not impressed.

PatrollingGoblin.speaker: Goblin Brawler
PatrollingGoblin.text: Hello, yer high and mightiness. Welcome to Bogrot.

session_synopses.CheckpointGuards: This goblin is guarding the entrance to a town his squad have occupied. The residents are long-dead, the town abandoned, and so he's taken it upon himself to rechristen the village as 'Bogrot'.
session_synopses.PAD_SpottedAmbush: This PAD plays if players pass a successful Perception check when entering an abandoned village. Goblins are sneaking around in the village, setting up an ambush.
session_synopses: This dialogue triggers when players enter a village being guarded by goblins. The goblins are on rooftops - the player may either be on the ground or on the rooftops with them (if they've snuck in). If the player has passed a perception check beforehand, the dialogue starts while the goblins are still getting into place for an ambush. Otherwise, the goblins are already in place, surrounding the player.If the player is not a drow, the goblins will attack the player at the end of the dialogue unless players can talk them out of it.
session_synopses.PatrollingGoblin: A goblin is patrolling around the abandoned village on the lookout for intruders. He doesn't want to be bothered.

Ogre_Dead.speaker: Player
Ogre_Dead.text: What were you doing in the village?

VB_Scholar.speaker: Player
VB_Scholar.text: Yikes, don't disturb a half-ogre in the making!
