session_synopses.AD_OgreKilled: The players have killed the ogress (the bugbear's lover) and he swears revenge.
session_synopses.AD_BugbearKilled: The players have killed the bugbear (the Ogress' lover) and she swears revenge.
session_synopses.Ogre_Dead: Butthir the ogre has been killed - you are now speaking with her corpse.
session_synopses.Bugbear_Dead: A dialogue with the bugbear's corpse after a player killed him. 'Butters' is Buthir, the ogre he loves.
session_synopses.VB_Scholar: Comment made after seeing the ogre and bugbear having sex AND passing a successful Nature check.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: What've we got 'ere...? Oh.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The lead goblin's face falls mid-sentence when he realises he's being confronted by a drow.NodeContext: The goblin loses his bluster mid sentence upon realising he's facing a feared drow

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Stop this thiiiing!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: A captive deep gnome swings past on the sail of a spinning windmill. Though he's in peril, this is basically being played as a comedic beat.NodeContext: Distressed. The deep gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he rotates. He's a short-moderate distance away and has to shout to be heard.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The goblin seems unsure whether to bow to you or attack.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: Narration.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-what do you want, or, I mean... what do you need?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous, fumbling over his words. He's naturally afraid of drows such as the player.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Did I tell you to stop? Turn around and continue as you were.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Erm... all right...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk is surprised and still wary of the drow player's intentions.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: K-keep him spinning! Make that birdie chirp!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Fezzerk continues to taunt the captive gnome, but is now nervous and self-conscious due to the observing drow player. It's like his boss is breathing down his neck.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Stop! Pleeaaase!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome rotates on a windmill sail helplessly. He's in peril, but this is basically a comedic beat.NodeContext: Projecting. The gnome is tied to the sail of a windmill and desperately calls for help as he swings around.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: Erm... not that I'm complainin'... but you are blessed, ain't ya?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: You... you are blessed, ain't ya? A True Soul?
node_data.context: NodeContext: Warily seeking confirmation that the player is a superior of his, and not some random stranger.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Attack the goblins.

node_data.speaker: Fezzerk
node_data.text: W-wha? Quick, get 'em!

AD_InvestigateMill.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_InvestigateMill.text: Why's the spinnymajigger stopped? Get it moving again!
AD_InvestigateMill.context: NodeContext: Impatient and suspicious.The windmill that the goblins are using to torment their captive has stopped - their leader wants his cronies to investigate and get the windmill working again.

AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.speaker: Fezzerk
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.text: Look's like the fun's over. C'mon, let's see who else we can snatch.
AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone.context: NodeContext: Calling to his assembled goblin cronies - 'c'mon fellas, let's wrap it up here.'

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.text: Fezzerk... best raider... east o' the... Sea o' Swords...
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

session_synopses: The party comes across a trio of goblins who've captured a gnome and have turned to tormenting him - they've tied him to a windmill and are watching him spin around. The party can try to intervene and save the gnome, possibly using a cult symbol of authority as a way to convince the goblins, if they have it. FOR_GnomeGoblin_1 (Fezzerk) is the leader of the goblins and does most of the talking. If the player is a drow, the goblins will be much more nervous and easier to intimidate. At times, the captive goblin pipes up from the windmill, loudly pleading or berating his captors.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigateMill: Some goblins tormenting a gnome tied to a windmill are surprised when it stops rotating.
session_synopses.AD_UnfortunateGnomeGone: The goblins are leaving after witnessing their captive gnome get launched from the blade of a windmill at high speed. Now that their amusement's been catapulted away, they have no reason to linger.
session_synopses.Dead: A speak with dead dialogue with a slain goblin, Fezzerk. As he's been just temporarily resurrrected from the afterlife, he speaks in slow, cryptic, fragmented phrases. From him, the player can gain a little insight into their hostage-taking activities. If Fezzerk recognises the player as his killer, he won't speak at all.

VB_BookDestroyed.speaker: Player
VB_BookDestroyed.text: Well done. The world's better off without it.

session_synopses.PAD_FindBook: PAD when you pick up 'The Necromancy of Thay' (DangerousBook_Tome.lsj). Character might have a sense that the book is evil or just be curious about what it might contain.
session_synopses.VB_BookDestroyed: Companion reaction to the player destroying the DangerousBook ('The Necromancy of Thay'). This book was clearly magical, whispering offers of dark power. You destroyed it by dropping it on the ground and blasting it with radiant damage. When you destroyed it, there were some spooky vfx. Most characters would see this as a good thing. Gale, Astarion wanted the book for themselves, however.

AD_Vanish.speaker: Raphael
AD_Vanish.text: Bah! To hell with the devil, is it? Very well, I shall oblige.

Dinner.speaker: Karlach
Dinner.text: I don't like this at all.
Dinner.context: NodeContext: This place is in the Hells, though Karlach doesn't realize that yet. She's put off but trying to stay cool.

Dinner.speaker: Raphael
Dinner.text: And deny you the honour of my hospitality?

session_synopses.Dinner: The monitor has teleported you to a mysterious room and offered you dinner - and a deal.

session_synopses.001: Novice Andrick, a junior member of the cult of the Absolute, currently standing guard in the goblin camp. If the player met and won him over previously in the forest, he'll refer to this and speak deferentially.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A feast fit for an ogre. You notice a peculiar dagger protruding from the tough, leathery meat.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger still juts from the meat.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Examine the meat. Perhaps there is some trick to removing the dagger.
False

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The dagger is tightly embedded in the carcass. You notice nothing unusual.*

session_synopses: Near a forest village, there are remains of an ogre campfire and meat spit over it. There's a cool dagger stuck in the meat. The player can attempt to retrieve it in a few ways (2 are listed here, but feel free to add another branch).

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: C'mon, blood-breath. Let's find you something to eat.
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Speaking to a worg companion, urging it to come along.

AD_Leaving.speaker: Worg
AD_Leaving.context: NodeContext: Worgs are vicious beasts but have a little more sentience than most animals, and are capable of rudimentary speech.

session_synopses.AD_Leaving: A band of goblins elect to leave the area where they've been 'playing' with gnome prisoner after the player convinced them to clear off, one way or another. One goblin beckons to a worg - time to head off.

session_synopses.VB_EnterNest: The player sees the gigantic spider in the spider nest.

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

session_synopses.ApproachedUnfortunateGnome: Rather than openly approaching the goblins/worgs near the windmill, a player snuck by and then gets spotted once they're near the windmill. Combat starts immediately.

node_data.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
node_data.text: Mm. Temptation knocks.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Loomp is the smart ogre. he checks for your mark since he is working for the goblin boss. You can convince him (and his fellow ogres, if they are there) to join you in battle. He should sound intelligent and HUNGRY.

node_data.speaker: Worg
node_data.text: Urh...  drow. No hurt me, goblin-master. Me good. Me kill for you.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Grovelling

session_synopses: A worg stands guard along with a band of goblins while they torment a captive deep gnome. If the player gets too close or interferes, the worg turns hostile. An exception is if the player is a drow - then the worg is cowed and servile.

VB_Bookcase.speaker: Player
VB_Bookcase.text: Hmm. Scratch marks on the floor...
VB_Bookcase.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. Noticed a potential clue in an abandoned house.

VB_Mirror.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.

PAD_EnterSecretLab.speaker: Player
PAD_EnterSecretLab.text: A well-guarded laboratory. What were they hiding down here?

QuasitSummon.text: Haha! Run. Run! Or sparky gets you.

VB_TrapStart.speaker: Player
VB_TrapStart.text: What in the hells - get back!
VB_TrapStart.context: NodeContext: Surprise and alarm upon triggering a strange booby trap in an abandoned house.

session_synopses.VB_InspectCookingPot: The player examines a large pot in an abandoned house. They may or may not realise it was used for brewing potions, not cooking,
session_synopses.VB_Bookcase: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player discovers a clue that leads to the wizard's secret lab.
session_synopses.VB_Mirror: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player notices something odd about a mirror, but they can't quite figure out what (they're in fact detecting the energy of a magical trap that resides within the mirror).
session_synopses.PAD_EnterSecretLab: PAD when you enter the Thayan lab in the cellar (after convincing the magical mirror to open for you). It's obviously long abandoned, but full of twisted glass flasks and other old lab equipment.
session_synopses.QuasitSummon: The quasit is a summon that has information about the Thayan cellar. She's alittle shithead who loves nothing more than cutting people up and being an arsehole.
session_synopses.VB_TrapStart: The player is exploring a ruined house that once belonged to a rural doctor. As they look around, they realise that the home's resident was in fact a wizard, laying low and conducting his own secret experiments while maintaining his cover as a doctor. Here, the player reacts to a booby trap they triggered - a magical orb that emerges from a mirrow and attacks them with fire.

PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite.context: NodeContext: Hushed awe. A good omen from their goddess.

session_synopses.PAD_OpenStashAsSelunite: A Selûne-worshipping player manages to unseal a magically locked chest after reading a prayer.

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: These things abandon their hosts as soon as they need to. Vile parasites...

PAD_TadpoleLeaves.speaker: Player
PAD_TadpoleLeaves.text: The longer we wait, the likelier that we share in this fate, or worse. Let's get rid of these things.

session_synopses.PAD_TadpoleLeaves: The players reflect on having just witnessed a tadpole emerge from the corpse of a recently deceased Absolute cultist. They consider the creature that's been causing each of them so much trouble. Despair or determination.This happens at the end of a scene and the characters are interchangeable here. They can all be opinionated.

PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.speaker: Player
PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon.text: They do seem a bit short-handed.

session_synopses.PAD_ToldOfZhentDungeon: The player has just told a Flaming Fist guard that Zhentarim are hiding in a nearby cave. The guard brushes it off because they don't have the numbers to take on a Zhent stronghold.

node_data.speaker: Gauntlet Yeva
node_data.text: They don't have much time. Go!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, facing the player.InternalNodeContext: Desire is trapped behind rubble.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on her way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

session_synopses.PAD: The player sees dead flaming fists and a collapsed tunnel near the Toll House.

session_synopses.Agent_003_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Amnos, a zhentarim mercenary who was killed by a pack of gnolls
session_synopses.Agents_AD_Retreating: One-shot AD for Zhent shipment survivors when they hear/see players starting a fight with the gnoll pack that have them (the agents) cornered. They back away, somewhat cowardly, not wanting to get involved
session_synopses.Agent_002: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agent_001_CrimeSevere: Angry and surprised, a zhent agent prepares to attack as he calls out to a player stealing an item that belongs to him.
session_synopses.VB_BloodSymbol: The party character comments on the blood symbol near the wrecked caravan. They player might reckognize the symbol.
session_synopses.Rugan_AD_AfterCombatReaction: One-shot AD for the Rugan just after he fought gnolls. If Olly is dead Rugan approaches his body to say alternative node.
session_synopses.Agent_002_Crime: Non critpath: The dialogue for the second agent, he mostly tells you to speak with the first agent. Works both if the first agent dead or alive. The gnolls could be either waiting near the entrance or gone (dead / ran away)
session_synopses.Agents_AD_ChestAfterCombat: Shaken Zhent agents check on their cargo after surviving an attack. Always shaken by the attack (which is now finished), and anxious if the cargo is missing/damaged, otherwise relieved.
session_synopses.Olly_AD_NoRuganTouchedChest: Zhent agent reacts to player's interacting with the chest he was guarding. He's not interested in guarding it anymore, and is preparing to leave after losing his companions to monsters.
session_synopses.Agent_001: One of a pair of Zhentarim agents trapped in a cave by gnolls. A veteran mercenary, tough, and above all else a survivor. The rest of their crew are dead. Rugan here is the senior agent of the two, and he's grimly determined to survive this terrible situation.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_FlasksLow: Trapped in a cave by monsters, Olly and Rugan are running low on fire flasks.Olly is panicking and shouting to Rugan as they attempt to hold the line; Rugan is more experienced and putting on a calmer, braver face.
session_synopses.Agents_AD_OutOfFlasks: Zhent agents panic as they prepare to be attacked by gnolls
session_synopses.Agent_002_Dead: Using a speak with dead spell, we are able to talk to the spirit of Oll, a young Zhentarim agent
session_synopses.Agent_001_TiedUp: In situations where Rugan survives after being beaten and tortured by the Zhentarim, players can interact with him in the chair he's tied to. He's exhausted, badly beaten, and barely capable of speaking full sentences.

PAD.speaker: Player

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: I think they're dragon marks. Better keep an eye out.

session_synopses.PAD: This is a booster for PLA. The player comes across deep scratches in rock. Passing an Arcana check reveals the creature responsible to be a dragon.

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator

DeathEvent.speaker: Narrator

VB_PostFight_2P.speaker: Player

04.speaker: Narrator

PAD_HyenaRunning.speaker: Player
PAD_HyenaRunning.text: Watch it - that hyena's going for help!

session_synopses.Healthy_01: A hyena in the plains is displeased when the player is close, wanting to devour them to please Yeenoghu.
session_synopses.DeathEvent: The player encounters a dying hyena that is about to turn into a gnoll. If they discover this in time, they can try to stop the gnoll from being born. Otherwise, the gnoll is born and attacks the player when the dialogue ends.
session_synopses.VB_PostFight_2P: Two players hava just finished a fight with gnolls (biped canine-type monsters). Before or during the fight, they saw new-born gnolls bursting out of the stomaches of dead or dying hyenas. Dialogue changes depending on if players know what gnolls are already.
session_synopses.04: A second player using Speak With Animals talks to a hyena while the first player speaks to the Dying Hyena. This will always end in combat.
session_synopses.SickHyena_AD_Groaning: Sick dying hyena whimpering in pain: a new gnolls is about to be born from it.
session_synopses.PAD_HyenaRunning: When the party starts the combat with dying hyenas, one of them - healthy hyena - will run away to call the gnolls nearby. This PAD is to ensure the player will understand what hyena is up to.
session_synopses.AD_GnollBorn: A hyena erupts, whining in agony as it dies, and unleashing a new gnoll into the world.

AvatarKarlachBeforeEnrage.speaker: Karlach

AvatarKarlachBeforeEnrage.context: InternalNodeContext: Karlach talking to herself silently, this is internal dialogue (no finger-to-temple)

session_synopses.PAD_KarlachAfterEnraged: After Karlach's enrage she will feel a lot more relieved.

node_data.text: Brace yourself to lift the wreckage.
True

node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player lifts the beam a couple of inches. He rolls out from under the beam on "There". Player drops it after he's free.

PAD_FoundChest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundChest.text: Looks like there's a chest buried in that hay.

PAD_TooHeavy.speaker: Player
PAD_TooHeavy.context: CinematicNodeContext: You click on the beam and you lift it or you don't (there is no animation or cut scene) so maybe mocap of the player's face looking frustrated...?NodeContext: You've just tried to life something and it's too heavy for you.

AD_FoundWife.speaker: Benryn
AD_FoundWife.context: NodeContext: Benryn has found his wife's body. He's absolutely devastated - he was afraid she had been killed, but he was holding out hope.

AD_ToWife.speaker: Benryn
AD_ToWife.text: She's not here. Maybe she's all right.
AD_ToWife.context: NodeContext: Hopeful, but not entierly convinced.

session_synopses:
Benryn finds himself faced with multiple crises in this dialogue. When the player finds him, he is frantic and coughing, trapped beneath a collapsed beam within a burning building. If the player rescues him, he frantically and desperately searches for his wife, who was outside when a band of goblins and drow attacked the inn they were staying at. Finally, if the player finds his wife's body, he is heartbroken - he believes her death is his fault, because of a silly argument that they had.

When players first encounter Benryn, he is trapped beneath a heavy beam in a burning building. If the player helps him escape, Benryn joins the party until they exit the building safely. Once outside, Benryn is in shock at the carnage around him - bodies of goblins and humans litter the inn's courtyard. He snaps out of his shock when he thinks of his wife, who was outside when the raiding party arrived. He pleads for the player to help him find her - when players do, she is already dead. Pointed to her body, Benryn breaks down - the weight of guilt immediately crushing him.The barbarian class will have advantage in a strength check to lift the wreckage off Benryn, however if they fail, they can try again with a higher DC. Failure the second time will lead to more debris collapsing and killing Benryn.
session_synopses.PAD_FoundChest: An AD that plays when you notice the dowry in the stack of hay.
session_synopses.AD_Rescued: This AD plays after the player has safely exited the burning inn with Benryn in tow. He is shocked by the scene he sees in the courtyard - blood and corpses everywhere.
session_synopses.PAD_TooHeavy: Player's trying to lift the beams off the half-elf, has previously failed the skill check, and cannot enter interactive dialogue. There is no cutscene or animation - you lift it or you don't - the half-elf is just suddenly free. In this PAD they failed the check and can't lift it.
session_synopses.AD_FoundWife: Benryn has been freed from a burning inn after becoming trapped during a drow/goblin attack. He's just found his wife's body. He'd been holding out hope that she was still alive.
session_synopses.AD_ToWife: This AD plays after the player has told Benryn where he can find his wife's body. He doesn't want to believe it, but he knows it is probably true. If the corpse has been moved after players tell him where he can find her, he has a spark of hope - she's not there, so perhaps she is still alive after all.

node_data.speaker: Fist Recruit Ito
node_data.text: We have to get them out!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Standing, facing the playerInternalNodeContext: Desire is trapped behind rubble.

session_synopses: This dialogue can happen in two phases: while pushing agianst rubble outside of the inn, or in a more generic setting (either searching the inn or clearing rubble).A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on her way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Hey. Hi. You're here. What're you, then?

Hyena_002.speaker: Player
Hyena_002.text: I'm a god, walking in mortal flesh.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: Oh. Holy, good holy. We follow Yeenoghu holy.

Hyena_002.speaker: Hyena
Hyena_002.text: He makes us hungry. Always hungry.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *She is still ravenous, her mind a hungry pit. The flesh of her pack wasn't enough to satisfy her.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: 'she' is a monstrous gnoll - it is hungry for the player's flesh. Anxiety in the player's voice

Flind.speaker: Player
Flind.text: Dominate her mind, commanding her to feast on herself.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *Her tadpole responds, thrashing violently, and the fragile tissue of her brain tears and splits.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: triumphant but disgusted - witnessing a horrifying injury that we caused to an enemy through psychic connection

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *You taste the blood in her throat, feel it pooling in the cavity of her skull. But she still resists.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: growing anxiety - feeling resistance of a wounded enemy through a psychic connection

Flind.speaker: Player
Flind.text: Harness your willpower, and order her to devour herself.

Flind.speaker: Narrator
Flind.text: *Your tadpole wriggles, contented, as she tears out her own throat.*
Flind.context: NodeContext: watching a beast - the flind - preparing to devour itself. We commanded her to do this, but it's still horrifying

Flind_Wounded_AD.speaker: Flind
Flind_Wounded_AD.context: NodeContext: Gnoll idles - SFX only - A gutteral, demonic roar.

session_synopses.Gnoll_FangOfYeenoghu_01: A Fang of Yeenoghu (magically gifted gnoll) communicates with a barking hyena-like laugh
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_01: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Hyena_002: A hyena with a pack of gnolls is anxious and curious about players who get close enough to speak without being attacked by the rest of the pack
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_02: An aggressive gnoll lurks outside a cave where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_03: A gnoll in a pack cackles as it waits to attack prey
session_synopses.Gnoll_Ranger_04: A gnoll pack-member lurks outside a cave, gnawing body of a dead Zhentarim agent.
session_synopses.Flind:
The flind is the leader of a pack of gnolls. Normally, these monsters hunger for flesh and eat anything, but the flind has been infected with a mind flayer's tadpole (like the players) and this has created an internal 'Voice' that guides it toward certain meat, forbidding others. The forbidden meats are those that work for the mind flayers - including the players - leading to a telepathic 'dialogue' when the flind restrains itself from attacking and calls off its pack.

We can attempt to overpower the Flind psionically, allowing us to control it temporarily in order to destroy the pack of gnolls. If we choose to fight the Flind, we should be prepared for a difficult encounter. It is strong, though far from the most powerful of its kind thanks to the war raging in its brain.
session_synopses.GnollRanger04_AD_Angry: Gnoll snarls furiously after being instigated / attacked by Flind
session_synopses.GnollRanger03_AD_Angry: Gnoll gnashes angrily after being instigated / attacked by Flind.
session_synopses.GnollRanger01_AD: Gnoll idle sounds that play as part of a pack of the monsters waits near a cave entrance where prey are hiding
session_synopses.Flind_Wounded_AD: Flind gnoll one-shot AD, when it is first heavily wounded or realy really angry.

PAD_AfterDragon.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterDragon.text: Looks like that dragon destroyed the road.

session_synopses.PAD_AfterDragon: The player reads a sign warning against the Risen Road after having seen the dragon destroy the bridge to the detour.

PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.speaker: Player
PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate.text: There's a pressure plate in the chair, but I'm missing something.

session_synopses.PAD_DiscoveredPressurePlate: A character reacts when sitting on one of the stone chairs in the tollhouse basement and activating the pressure plate hidden there. There is an audible click, but a second character needs to be in the other chair to open the secret chamber. The line needs to hint that there is a second part to solving the puzzle.
session_synopses.Dead_Karlach: Dialog with Karlach if she dies before being recruited into the party.

Dead.speaker: Gauntlet Dain
Dead.text: Searching... Grand Duke... Baldur's Gate... kidnapped...

session_synopses.Dead: A Flaming Fist initially trying to put out the fires at Waukeen's Rest, an inn that was attacked by goblins and drow in the night. If killed, she can be interrogated about what she was looking for - in this case, the missing Duke Ravengard.

002_PostEA.speaker: Trynn
002_PostEA.text: If you want to go poking around in the cellar, be my guest. Plug your nose first though.
002_PostEA.context: NodeContext: Turning her attention from a trapdoor to the player. With a smirk on the last sentence

SpokeWithDeadCrime.context: NodeContext: shouting to alert companions in nearby rooms
NodeContext: quieter than previous lines - a threat to the player right before attacking

session_synopses.002_PostEA: Wary and abrupt. Disguised as a noble paladin of Tyr, this young is actually in league with the archdevil Zariel. She's hiding out in a tollhouse with her companions.
session_synopses.SpokeWithDeadCrime: A group of paladins react angrily to the player casting a speak with dead spell on one of their dead companions. They are angry enough to attack the player if the spell is repeated a second time.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Trying to be authoritative, but completely in over his head.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: I'll feed your innards to the ants before I do that, istik.

DragonEvent.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Last-ditch effort to enforce authority.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: No, look up. That was your last chance, istik. Now burn!
DragonEvent.context: CinematicNodeContext: A dragon appears and does an air-to-ground attack, roasting the Flaming Fists. It goes to land somewhere and its rider, Kith'rak Voss, dismounts. He approaches the other githyanki.InternalNodeContext: Dragon destroys bridge, dragon lands, knight starts talking to BarethaNodeContext: 'I'm done with you'.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Stop wasting time, Baretha. You're not here to play with the locals.
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Berating an underling. Baretha pronounced Bar-eh-tha. A gith name.

DragonEvent.speaker: Sarth Baretha
DragonEvent.text: Of course, kith'rak. We merely sought to -
DragonEvent.context: NodeContext: Kith'rak - 'Captain' - a gith commander in charge of ten sarths (100 warriors total). Pronounced Kith-rack

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: No excuses. Question, kill, then move on. Find the weapon.

DragonEvent.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
DragonEvent.text: Our queen watches us. Fail her at your peril.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Hrast, another one! Keep back, flatface - I know how to handle myself!
TieflingScout.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ellyka is immediately defensive, brandishing a dagger at the gith player.NodeContext: Hrast pronounced hur-RAST-ing. Similar to damn/fuck in common language.

TieflingScout.speaker: Ellyka
TieflingScout.text: Come on, mragreshem! I'll take my chances against you than your friends on the bridge!
TieflingScout.context: NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal for 'shithead'. Pronounced mragRESHem.

PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.speaker: Player
PAD_LaezelKilledByGith.text: Dead - by her own kin's hand.

AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.text: Helm protect me, where'd that beast come from...?
AD_ScoutReactsToDragon.context: NodeContext: A tiefling refugee reacts with terror and awe upon seeing a dragon fly overhead.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Narrator
ConfrontationLaezel.text: *Your skull pounds in response to the githyanki's white-hot stare. Her lips don't move, yet you hear her voice.*

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: You. Stay put, and keep your lips sealed.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Rider - my time is short. Lead me to...
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel begins to bow as she speaks to the kith'rak

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Were I not merciful, I would slice the skin clean from your meat.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
ConfrontationLaezel.text: Yet you are not bleeding. For I am nothing if not merciful.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Player
ConfrontationLaezel.text: If you wish to speak, speak to me.

ConfrontationLaezel.speaker: Lae'zel
ConfrontationLaezel.context: NodeContext: Lae'zel looks up from bowing at the player in anger

CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.
CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The dragon spreads its wings and soars away.
NOTE: this could be used in a number of circumstances in which Voss flies away. Voss is an arrogant senior gith officer, focused on his mission, so he can always depart while being unfazed by preceeding events.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: You are unknown to me, kin. Are you straight from the crèche, wandering unbidden?
Confrontation.context: InternalNodeContext: Do not put a selection speaker here, gith has priority

Confrontation.speaker: Player
Confrontation.text: Play along as a gith. Say you're indeed from the crèche.

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: Lies. You speak like the vermin from this wretched world. What are you, a deserter?

Confrontation.speaker: Kith'rak Voss
Confrontation.text: No matter. Baretha! This one is no kin to us. Kill them. I will continue searching for the weapon.

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Your babbling tires me, istik. Move your carcass!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Authoritative demandingNodeContext: Authoritative demanding. 'istik' =  'Stranger' - Catch-all term for non-gith. Pronounced Iss-tick

AD_StandOff.speaker: Gauntlet Dion
AD_StandOff.text: B-by order of the Flaming Fist, halt!
AD_StandOff.context: CinematicNodeContext: Unintelligent confusionNodeContext: Unintelligent confusion

AD_StandOff.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_StandOff.text: Or what? Show us what you can do, worm.
AD_StandOff.context: NodeContext: Htak'-a meaning "Die!" in gith language

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: A githyanki slate. Give it here!

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.context: NodeContext: Tir'su: the githanki alphabet. Pronounced TEAR-soo.

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *Magical energy courses through the slate, then to Lae'zel. Your own body buzzes in resonance.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Narrator
ReadingMap.text: *A diagram glows before you. Its meaning is beyond your comprehension.*

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: It is a map. A githyanki crèche lies within an ancient temple at the mountain pass.

ReadingMap.speaker: Lae'zel
ReadingMap.text: Hurry forth. Purification is at hand.

PAD_Shield.speaker: Player
PAD_Shield.text: The shield is still warm to the touch. A dragon is not to be trifled with.

PAD_LaezelReadMap.speaker: Lae'zel
PAD_LaezelReadMap.text: A githyanki crèche lies beyond the mountain pass.

AD_LaezelBetrayed.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelBetrayed.text: Traitors to our queen: I will make you suffer!
AD_LaezelBetrayed.context: NodeContext: Calls out after battle starts.

AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.speaker: Sarth Baretha
AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn.text: You are outmatched. An inglorious bloodletting awaits.

AD_ScoutLeaves.speaker: Ellyka
AD_ScoutLeaves.text: Mrag! That's it - I'm getting out of here!
AD_ScoutLeaves.context: NodeContext: Mrag pronounced 'mRAG' (means 'shit' in infernal language). The tiefling decides that things are getting too dangerous and runs off while she still can.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.text: Look at that beast. Seems almost too big to take flight.

PAD_DragonShadow.speaker: Player
PAD_DragonShadow.text: Damn thing could blot out the sun.

AD_LaezelPostConfrontation.speaker: Lae'zel
AD_LaezelPostConfrontation.text: Protocol is clear. I will be purified.

session_synopses.DragonEvent: A Flaming Fist detachment tries to confront a githyanki war band. The Flaming Fists are completely outmatched, however; the githyanki warriors dismiss their demands. Moments later, a githyanki controlled dragon roasts the Flaming Fists in a fly-by. Afterwards, the dragon rider, a senior gith, berates his subordinate for her slow mission progress.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelRunsToKnight: Non-recruited Lae'zel calls out to the gith knight.
session_synopses.TieflingScout: A tiefling scout from the Druid Grove hides and observes as a Githyanki war party massacres some Flaming Fists. The tiefling may warn the player that they are too weak to take on such opponents, before running off.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelKilledByGith: Player returning to the Gith Chokepoint area after leaving Lae'zel behind -- she has been killed by the gith
session_synopses.AD_ScoutReactsToDragon: A tiefling refugee observes a war party of githyanki warriors guarding a bottleneck in the main road leading out of the region. The githyanki are alien and fearsome to the tiefling. She reacts with shock when she sees how they have a dragon circling overhead in support.
session_synopses.ConfrontationLaezel:
Alternate version of the dragon rider scene at chokepoint. Lae'zel is alive and was never recruited. Player can recruit her after this.

Lae'zel approaches the rider to discover where to find the creche. A cure for the tadpole can be found there - or so she believes. However, the knight is under different orders.
session_synopses.CINE_RiderAndDragonLeave: Cinematic: Kith'rak Voss flies away on his dragon.The player interrupted the Gith Chokepoint situation. The most likely interruption is triggering a combat (player attacks any npc there including Voss or the dragon, or drags another hostile npc near them)This interruption happens in gameplay, so normally the Rider (Kith'rak Voss) and the Dragon would also leave in gameplay, but animations don't have the tech support to make the Rider ride the dragon like this, so we play this cutscene instead
session_synopses.Confrontation: Our party encounters a band of githyanki warriors who have taken position at bottleneck in the region - a bridge that provides one of the few paths of progression. The gith confront us and try to see if we know anything about the 'weapon' they seek. (The weapon in question is the strange puzzle box we are carrying.) While reading our thoughts, the githyanki may realise we are tadpoled, resulting in instant combat. If we manage to conceal our tadpoles, they may allow us to pass.
session_synopses.AD_StandOff: A flaming fist solider nervously attempts to challenge a githyanki warrior. The gith is essentially an alien to the lowly soldier; he can't help but feel intimidated.
session_synopses.ZorruFriend_Dead: Yul was Zorru's friend. Player finds him dead already and may have heard about him before if they talked to Zorru with Lae'zel.
session_synopses.ReadingMap: |Item interaction: player clicks on the githyanki map and tries to read it. Githyanki are able to read it.Lae'zel is added in the 3th speaker slot. Any others are in the second slot. If Lae'zel is taking the map from somebody, they are both speakers in the dialog. Otherwise the second or third slot are null.
session_synopses.PAD_Shield: Comment on acquiring or moving a shield of a Flaming Fist mercenary killed by the dragon on the bridge.
session_synopses.PAD_LaezelReadMap: After reading the Githyanki Map, Lae'zel Avatar urges the rest of the party to go to the crèche.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelBetrayed: |Lae'zel Companion only: the player attacked the gith during 'PLA_GithChokepoint_ConfrontationLaezel', and Voss commanded Baretha to kill them all (the player + Lae'zel) OR, the situation naturally ended in combat. Lae'zel is betrayed, and this AD makes it clear to the player.|
session_synopses.AD_GithCaptainFirstTurn: Small remark that the players don't stand a chance.
session_synopses.AD_ScoutLeaves: The tiefling refugee/scout declares she's clearing off when she realises the situation with the nearby githyanki warparty is getting too risky.
session_synopses.PAD_DragonShadow: A dragon flies over the party. They may or may not  recognise it. If they're a gith, they'll always recognise it and suppose that their kin must be operating nearby.
session_synopses.AD_LaezelPostConfrontation: Non-recruited Lae'zel speaks ADs after the battle with the dragon rider. She alternated between the beat of the dragon rider and looking for a creche.

PAD_OtherWay.speaker: Player
PAD_OtherWay.text: There's got to be another way in.
PAD_OtherWay.context: NodeContext: The burning is on fire. Said with some urgency.

session_synopses.PAD_OtherWay: Player remarks that there must be a way inside the burning building if they weren't able to bust down the front door.

AD_Working.speaker: Fist Recruit Aelis
AD_Working.context: NodeContext: Pronounced 'EE-toe'. Trying to lift rubble

session_synopses.AD_Working:
A Flaming Fist trying to force their way inside of a burning inn. They can hear someone inside - they believe it might be a Duke of Baldur's Gate, who they were sent to guard on his way to Elturel. Instead, they found the inn burning, its staff and guests murdered by goblins and drow in the night.

Once inside, they set about trying to clear rubble to reach someone trapped within.

Zhent08_AD.speaker: Karad
Zhent08_AD.text: I can't wait to get back to the city. I'm bloody horny.

Zhent07.speaker: Vol
Zhent07.text: Didn't I tell you to move along?

Zhent03_AD_Idle.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Idle.text: Hope we don't wake anything down there.

Zhent05_AD_Idle.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Idle.text: Don't know why we don't just kill those Fist.

Zhent02_AD_Idle.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Idle.text: Any falls behind, I leave them for the Fist! And in no state to tell tales.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: That's far enough. What's your business down here? Answer honestly, and maybe we'll kill you clean.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Neutral but firm - she's not remotely afraid of us but

Zhent02_Stage1.text: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Almost bored but with a hard edge - we've blundered in and she has more important matters to deal with, just wants rid of us.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Stage1.text: I don't want trouble - I just want to trade.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: Trade with what? Your life was ours the moment you walked in here.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Unimpressed - our life is in her hands, and she's stating it as a simple matter of fact.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: But... maybe I'll let you buy it back. I have a job needs doing.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: Considering us - normally she'd kill us but we just tried to talk our way into her base, and she could use skills like that.

Zhent02_Stage1.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage1.text: We've disarmed the traps. Come down.
Zhent02_Stage1.context: NodeContext: An order, not a request - we're entirely in her power as far as she's concerned.

Zhent06.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06.text: Had a peach of a shot on you as you came in.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: What - come to kill me yourself? You might as well.
DoubtingArtist.context: InternalNodeContext: Peacefull situation, the artist is still captive, already met the playerNodeContext: Intense, eager - waiting for us to tell him he's free

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Player
DoubtingArtist.text: Relax - I'll speak to your captors.

DoubtingArtist.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist.text: Now I don't mean to hurry you - but if you could hurry, I'd be most obliged.

Zhent01.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01.context: NodeContext: Sheepish - he tried to blow you up a minute before, but knows you're a friend now and is glad you survived

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: The doggies nearly got me this time. It was close.
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.context: InternalNodeContext: Only plays if all speakers are available and present.

AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.speaker: Rugan
AD_ZhentShipmentAgents.text: Lass, if you hate me that much, hire someone to kill me.

Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: A little bit of this will turn your blood to treacle.
Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics.text: You should change that. People don't make that face in real life.

VB_Entrance.speaker: Player
VB_Entrance.text: A cave beneath the tavern. I wonder how deep it runs...

Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: Let's see how you like a little rot.
Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: During combat, character is coating their weapon with poison.

Dog_03.speaker: Istor
Dog_03.text: Careful! No stone-scent. No stone-sound. Strange-stone here.

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Something I can help you with?

Zhent03.speaker: Brem
Zhent03.text: Well now! If we're talking, my guess is you've got coin to spend.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who recruited me, Rugan.
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: For this entire exchange, Zarys is standing about ten feet above us on a raised platform.NodeContext: She's overseeing the torture of an agent of hers - one who originally recruited her to the organisation. Tone is chiding and also vaguely disgusted - he should have known better.

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're the one who taught me rule number one, remember?
Zhent02_Trap.context: CinematicNodeContext: A shot of the torturer from behind, the moving aside to reveal Rugan.NodeContext: As if reflecting on 'good old days', but with a harder edge

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Rugan
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: <Bound to a chair> Any moan / gurgle of pain or fear. He's been tortured for quite some time and is too exhausted to scream

Zhent02_Trap.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Trap.text: You're dead the moment you steal from the Zhentarim.
Zhent02_Trap.context: NodeContext: All joviality dropped - flat and icy-cold.

PAD_NoticedFakeWall.speaker: Player
PAD_NoticedFakeWall.text: That wall's an illusion! Hiding what, I wonder...

Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.text: I've been wanting to try this venom...
Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed.context: NodeContext: Mid-combat, character is coating their weapon in poison.

Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied.context: NodeContext: (Zar-iss, Sword-har) Your leader just died in combat - dismay, anger.

DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering.context: InternalNodeContext: All the Zhent around the artist are dead. Now he is threatened by something.

Zhent05.speaker: Bellar
Zhent05.text: See my handiwork? He started squealing before the knives came out, truth be told. But it pays to be thorough.
Zhent05.context: NodeContext: Bellar is referring to a friend he 'had' to torture to death. Bellar is a bit of a sociopath.

Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness.text: Someone's taking out the lights! Fall back!

DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.text: Maybe I'll drink my paints, hm? You won't get your damn ransom then!
DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: Challenging, petulant - they want to keep him prisoner so he's threatening to kill himself (not remotely intending to follow through on it, just out of spite)

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: Wouldn't linger down here, I were you - see all that smokepowder?

Zhent08.speaker: Karad
Zhent08.text: The Flaming Fist won't find nothing here but rubble.

Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent04.text: You don't want to keep Zarys waiting, believe me.

Zhent02_AD_Stage2.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_AD_Stage2.context: NodeContext: A barked order to her men - but not rattled, she's a consummate soldier

Zhent02_Stage3.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Stage3.text: You're making a bad mistake, my friend. Last chance to turn back.

Zhent06_AD.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD.text: Down into the Underdark. Reckon I'll be old by the time I see the sun again.

Zhent07_AD_Combat.speaker: Vol
Zhent07_AD_Combat.text: We've buried tougher than you. Come on!
Zhent07_AD_Combat.context: NodeContext: A threat shouted during combat.

DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.speaker: Oskar Fevras
DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives.text: Wait! They've got oil everywhere - and bloody torches!

Zhent06_AD_Combat.speaker: Jarg
Zhent06_AD_Combat.text: You've messed up. At least you won't live to regret it!

Zhent02_Dead.speaker: Player
Zhent02_Dead.text: Did you have anything of value?

Zhent02_Dead.speaker: Zarys
Zhent02_Dead.text: ...whole outpost... but you don't steal... from Zhentarim...

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Garias
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Did that artist really paint all those things?

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Says his muse made him do it.

Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.speaker: Brem
Zhent03_AD_Zhent04.text: Gods, little brother - read a bleedin' book.

AD_InvestigationCheck2.speaker: Player
AD_InvestigationCheck2.text: Locked. Best find another way in.

Zhent01_AD_Idle.speaker: Salazon
Zhent01_AD_Idle.context: NodeContext: Bored with his menial task.

session_synopses.Zhent08_AD: Karad is standing around on guard duty, bored.
session_synopses.Zhent02_CaughtUp: The player has snuck into the miiddle of a Zhentarim outpost and been spotted - the Zhent would usually run but choose to fight as the player got too close before discovery. In some cases, friendly members of the group recognise the player.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Idle: Brem is chatting to himself as he packs to leave the Zhent hideout.
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck: Player is chasing someone down into a seemingly sealed room - they'll either realise there's another door or just be confused that their quarry has disappeared.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Idle: Bellar is a cheerfully violent thug who is happily chatting to himself while his companions prepare to flee their hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Idle: Zarys is barking orders at her minions as they prepare to leave the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage1:
Zarys is standing on a raised platform just as we stumble into her secret outpost, speaking to us across a gap of about 15 feet. We have to convince her we're friendly or she's ready to have us killed.

Her gang are preparing to burn down their hideout when they leave, and in some cases she'll give the order to start that process if she thinks we're a threat.
session_synopses.Zhent06: Jarg is a veteran of the crime organisation - as friendly as they come but would plant an arrow between your eyes without thinking twice.
session_synopses.Dog_01: Younger dog is following her master on patrol duty, mindful of all the beastly scents in the underdark.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist:
An artist captued by the Zhentarim, Oskar is being forced to paint against his will. He'll discreetly approach the player and beg them to buy him, mindful that he's within earshot of his brutal captors. 
If he is freed by whatever means, he'll regain some of his old haughtiness but will ultimately still be grateful as he relates his story - that he's torn between two loves. The first is the patron who has offered to marry him, and the second is a first true love from his pre-fame and -wealth past.
session_synopses.Zhent01: Salazon is a guard the player will have encountered on entering the dungeon he'll either have fled from us, tried to blow us up, or let us pass.
session_synopses.Zhents_AD_ZhentAgentEscape: The player has freed a Zhent prisoner - tied up and beaten because he failed to return to the hideout with a valuable shipment. The NPC sees the prisoner freed and running for the exit.
session_synopses.AD_ZhentShipmentAgents: Back and forth between Olly, Zarys and Rugan in their idle states .
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_ArtCritics: Brem is commenting on paintings by the doubting artist.
session_synopses.VB_Entrance: Player exclaims on entering a hidden underground cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04_AD_Welcome: Garias is guarding a lowly gang hideout. ADs as he approaches you to open the door.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Dog_03: This dog is guarding an illusory wall. It looks solid to him (and the player), but he can't smell it.
session_synopses.Zhent03: Brem is a trader for the Zhentarim. When we meet him, he's holding an artist prisoner and offering us a portrait. We can persuade him to release the prisoner or just buy him outright - or just trade normally. He'll indicate that there are more illicit items he can show us - once we prove ourselves to his leader.
session_synopses.AD_UseLift: On interacting with a broken elevator.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Trap: We walk in to find Zarys overseeing the torture of an agent that handed over special cargo to us. The agent is currently bound to a chair and badly beaten, and we're due to get the same treatment in her eyes - unless we can talk her out of it.Volume is likely louder than normal conversation but not shouting - she's standing on a raised platform perhaps ten feet above us and the tortured agent,
session_synopses.Dog_02: This older dog is following his master on guard duty, uncomprehending the endless circles they walk but happy to do it anyway.
session_synopses.PAD_NoticedFakeWall: In exploring the zhent dungeon, the player has discovered an illusory wall.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_PoisonUsed: One-shot combat AD to play when the character uses a Poison Vail.
session_synopses.Zhent05_AD_Combat_LeaderDied: One-shot combat AD to play when the leader of the Zhentarim - Zarys, - dies.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage2: Zarys is fleeing the player, setting traps as she goes (ADs account for if she is unable to do so)
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Cowering: Doubting artist is cowering because something potentially harmfull is happening. He don't want to talk until it is resolved.
session_synopses.Zhent05: Bellar is a common thug working for the Zhent. We can find him beating one of their own members for incompetence, or waiting to flee the hideout.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage1Darkness: Zarys is responding to the player trying to creep up on her crew, based on whether we've met her before or not.
session_synopses.VB_Cellar: Player has descended into a hideout and the person they're chasing has disappeared.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_Idle: Doubting artist has been kidnapped and is now enslaved by Zhentarim. Everything is peaceful around, for now.
session_synopses.Zhent08: Karad is bored, guarding the back of the cave.
session_synopses.Zhent04: Garias is a lowly Zhent recruit left with guarding the gate. He's sullen about it.
session_synopses.Zhent02_AD_Stage2: Zarys is pulling her troops back as we intrude on their hideout
session_synopses.Zhent02_Stage3: Zarys is fleeing while her hideout blows up around her. Player is pursuing.
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD: Jarg is a veteran of the Zhent - but he's on guard duty and he's bored.
session_synopses.Zhent07_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking her turn.
session_synopses.DoubtingArtist_AD_WarnAboutExplosives: The doubting artist warns the player about the explosives inside the Zhent dungeon
session_synopses.Zhent06_AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the zhent is taking his turn.
session_synopses.Zhent02_Dead: A SwD with Zarys, the Zhentarim leader. She can tell us about the situation in the outpost, and the missing agents and cargo she's waiting for.
session_synopses.Zhent03_AD_Zhent04: Brem and Garias are brothers, ADing back and forth about the artist they've taken captive (or sold)
session_synopses.AD_InvestigationCheck2: Player passes investigation check to discover hidden door, but it's locked.
session_synopses.PAD_HiddenEntrance_Opened: Player has opened a secret entrance hidden behind an elaborate sliding-wardrobe setup.
session_synopses.Zhent01_AD_Idle: Salazon is pacing, packing up ahead of the plan to blow the hideout.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A human man awaits you, a spell crackling at his fingertips.*
node_data.context: NodeContext: [Salazon is crouching behind the shelves with Fire Bolt ready].

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait!

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Wait - listen!
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *He freezes, waiting on your next word.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Careful. You won't kill me, but you will make me mad.
False
False

node_data.speaker: Salazon
node_data.text: That ain't the pass-phrase!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Fire bolt is still in hand.NodeContext: Salazon gets up frantically as he exclaims his line.

session_synopses: Salazon is preparing a fire-trap at the entrance to his gang's hideout. We can either sneak up on him or be sneaked up on in turn - either way we have to convince him we should be there or he'll get skittish and blow us all up. In general he's jumpy and suspicious of us, but relieved when we convince him we're a friend. Think an inexperienced guard pointing a gun at us when he's been told to be on alert.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Zarys promised good coin for an unopened chest. If we want to collect, it needs to stay shut.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Yes, but who knows what's inside? It could be worth more than any purse she'll offer.

session_synopses.PAD: This PAD was converted from a RD where the party were discussing what to do with a valuable chest they've found. It triggers when agents are not nearby and a character picks up the chest or tries to open it, or deals with the agents and then notices the chest in the cave.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: describing a corpse after casting a speak with dead spell on it

session_synopses.Dead: Speak with dead dialogue initiated when speaking to the decomposing corpse of a toll collector found in an abandoned tollhouse basement

session_synopses.AD_AlertingYapping: After hyena sees the player, before running and calling other gnolls, it skips it's first turn in combat nervously yapping.
session_synopses.AD_Growling: After hyena sees the player and growls before running away to call gnolls to attack.

node_data.speaker: Wyll
node_data.text: Counsellor Florrick - are you all right?

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Fresh air, at last.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Your boldness is a blessing - I'm in your debt.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Surprised, but slightly monotone. Not overtly fearful.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Listen close: drow have taken Grand Duke Ulder Ravengard - westward, if my eyes and ears may be believed.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I must report to the Flaming Fist manip, with haste.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: And you - I must ask again for your aid.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Please - rescue Ravengard from his drow captors. The Council will reward you for your effort.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: May I trust you'll see it through?

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll rescue Duke Ravengard. You have my word.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll search for Duke Ravengard.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: Go. You should pick up the drow trail with ease.

node_data.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
node_data.text: I will seek reinforcements and join you when I can.

FirstThanks.speaker: Counsellor Florrick
FirstThanks.text: Come. I'm afraid proper thanks must wait.

session_synopses: Councilor Florrick is working in secret for a dragon in the city of Baldur's Gate. She is acting as an advisor to Grand Duke Ravengard. She should come across as good but no nonsense. SHe is used to getting her way.
session_synopses.FirstThanks: You speak with Desire after freeing her but before she reaches safety and engages the flaming fist

PAD_FoundKey.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundKey.text: The corpse mentioned a key... this must be the one.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Cut it out. There's worse than gnolls out there.
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: admonishing a companion, but in a friendly way

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: Nothing we need to worry about.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: How about a dragon? Would that worry you?
AD_Refugees.context: NodeContext: trying to get a rise out of a companion

AD_Refugees.speaker: Trynn
AD_Refugees.text: I'd give it a bloody good fight, that's for sure.

AD_Refugees.speaker: Anders
AD_Refugees.text: Ha! Only thing you'd give a dragon is bad gas.

AD_RefugeeAlarm.context: NodeContext: Calling for help to companions nearby

session_synopses.PAD_FoundKey: Lines spoken when the player spots a key in the undergrowth near a tollhouse. Different variations depending on what the player already knows about the key.
session_synopses.AD_Refugees: Dialogue between two refugees who are secretly cultists of Zariel. This dialogue is spoken before the player enters the tollhouse where they are hiding out. If a player enters during the dialogue, they stop talking to address the newcomer.
session_synopses.AD_RefugeeAlarm: A paladin calls to their companions when they see hostile players.

session_synopses.VB_DeadDrow1Armor: Party comments on finding the armour of a dead drow in the tavern region.

PAD_PrickedFinger.speaker: Player
PAD_PrickedFinger.context:
NodeContext: Noise of pain. Your finger has been pricked by a thorn.

Karlach: 'Fing' is on purpose

session_synopses.PAD_PrickedFinger: The player has pricked their finger on a thorny bush. The player encounters a thorny bush full of fruit. In order to take the fruit from the bush without cutting theirself, the player must pass a Sleight of Hand test.

PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest.text: Be ready. Whoever - or whatever - did this could be close.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundBrothersAfterLongRest: This occurs after the player has refused to help the brothers and subsequently finds them dead/one of them dead. It can trigger in the swamp, teahouse or lair, and you may not know that Ethel is a hag at this point (depending on where it triggers). In the first, you've met the brothers, in the second you skipped the confrontation and have no idea who these men are.

IllusionRedcap.speaker: Redcap Blood Sage, Redcap, Redcap Blood Sage, 0446e7c4-3076-415c-aa7f-deb7f43e5d06, Redcap, a72e6051-d06b-469c-b6dc-4c962cfe307f
IllusionRedcap.context: NodeContext: Redcap pretending to be a sheep, isn't very good at the impression.

session_synopses.IllusionRedcap:
This occurs in the swamp. Sheep wander the area - except they're redcaps (a type of violent faerie) hidden by the hag's illusions. The creatures are pretending to be sheep. 
The illusion can be shattered by an animal handling check. OR if the player preciously succeeded in a perception check in the area.

Brother_002_AD_Fallback.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_Fallback.context: NodeContext: You're in the swamp and want to keep moving. Gruff and impatient.

AD_HagDisappear.context: NodeContext: You've disappeared into thin air. A mocking goodbye.

AD_Argument.text: You're both this close to getting a slap.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Annoyed and unimpressed. You're having none of these brothers  and they're starting to piss you off.

AD_Argument.speaker: Johl
AD_Argument.text: Enough. We know you have her.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: You're getting tired of Ethel - and trying to sound threatening.

AD_Argument.speaker: Demir
AD_Argument.text: Please, we just want Mayrina back.
AD_Argument.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm the situation - you don't want it to get violent and you're also terrified of Ethel/

Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.speaker: Johl
Brother_002_AD_BrotherDied.context: NodeContext: Your brother has died in front of you.

AD_HagThankPlayer.text: Come here and let me see you proper, petal. We need to chat.

Confrontation.text: Lads, for the love of all that is holy, I've never clapped eyes on your poor sister.
Confrontation.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking at the brothers - hasn't noticed the player yet. NodeContext: Opening line of the dialogue. Annoyed as you plead with the two men who advance on you. You sound sincere and genuine.

Confrontation.speaker: Johl
Confrontation.text: Drop the act, hag. You was the last to see Mayrina.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Not buying Auntie Ethel's claim that she hasn't seen Mayrina. Accusation and fury in your voice - you're prepared to get violent if needs be.

Confrontation.speaker: Demir
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: Your brother is on the brink of violence and you're trying to regain control of the situation. You just want your baby sister back, you don't want anyone to get hurt.

Confrontation.text: You there! Please, I don't know what's come over these boys. I just want to go home.
Confrontation.context: NodeContext: You've caught sight of the player. You call out, fear and pleading in your voice - in your mind you've hatched a plan - you're going to force the player to defend you and kill the brothers.

session_synopses.Brother_002_AD_Fallback: Player tries to speak to the brother while either the other brother is in the shared Brothers dialogue (and this one missed it for some reason), or because they're waiting for the hag to come back into the house and start her dialogue.
session_synopses.AD_HagDisappear: AD that fires as the Hag disappears during the ambush.
session_synopses.AD_Argument: This argument is the beginning of the situation. The three of them are yelling at each other out in the open. The brothers believe Ethel has taken their sister, while she is denying any knowledge of the girl.
session_synopses.AD_HagThankPlayer: This occurs after the ambush. Player has sided with Ethel and killed the brothers. Player has either not spoken to Ethel yet OR they are wildshaped and cannot speak.
session_synopses.Confrontation: Auntie Ethel has been cornered by two brothers - Demir and Johl - who claim Ethel is a hag and has taken their sister. Ethel is pleading that she has no idea what they're talking about and begs the player to help her.Ethel is actually a hag. Should we step back and do thing, she summons monsters to cut the two brothers down. Should we side with her, we have to kill the brothers. Should we side with the brothers, Ethel is angry and disappears with a threat.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Do you have anything of value?

session_synopses.Dead: We can speak to Gandrel if he dies - he'll hint at his mission to hunt Astarion on behalf of Maiden Fel. Separate options if it's Astarion himself speaking to him.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Gods, didn't hear you coming. I know I should head home, but I can't bring myself to leave.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: look up from quietly crying, surprised

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: The thought of putting him in a wheelbarrow and making the journey all over again... *Sigh.*
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: turns back to the grave, arms crossed - then gestures to the coffin. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: I could say a prayer, if you'd like.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.text: Please. Connor used to say only a fool turned down the divine.
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Sincere. Grateful. Trying not to cry.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Player
ResurrectHusband.text: Light wanes only to wax again - and though life fades, memory shall not.

ResurrectHusband.speaker: Mayrina
ResurrectHusband.context: NodeContext: Player has said a prayer that has made you feel much better. Sincere thanks as you hold back tears.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband turned into summon, Mayrina knows this player killed brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.context: InternalNodeContext: Brothers dead, husband killed by players, Mayrina knows this player killed brothers.NodeContext: Spitting with rage but also on the brink of tears. This player killed people you loved.

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Player
SurrogateMother_Dead.text: Why did you come to the teahouse?

SurrogateMother_Dead.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Dead.text: Ethel... bring husband... bring back... my Connor.

SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.text: Who are you? You need to leave. Now. Before she sees you.
SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sitting down in her chair - looking at her foodNodeContext: Afraid - looking around for the hag. Head low.

HusbandResurrected.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
HusbandResurrected.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looking around - frantice and afraid. Clumsy and jittering movements.NodeContext: Animalistic noises through you're rotting jaw - looking around for your wife afraid and panicked as you struggled to speak, to form words with a jaw that no longer works

HusbandResurrected.speaker: Connor Vinderblad
HusbandResurrected.context: CinematicNodeContext: Centres on the player and charges - enragedNodeContext: ROARING in rage and fear as you attack the player

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: No. What did she do to you? What did that monster do?
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.context: NodeContext: Twisted corpse of your husband on the ground. Horror and grief.

SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp.text: Connor, I'm sorry. I'm so sorry.

session_synopses.ResurrectHusband: The player has discovered a wand that will allow them to raise Mayrina's husband from the dead. Mayrina is standing by the coffin that holds her dead husband. When player raises Connor from the dead, the coffin door bursts open and he crawls out of it a zombie - unable to speak in anything other than moans and groans. Player can take the zombie as a summon, kill the zombie, or give the zombie to Mayrina.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Dead:
This occurs when Mayrina dies. There are multiple permutationinlcuding, but not limited to, you killed her brothers and/or her husband, she knows that one or more of these people are dead but doesn't blame you, you took her husband as a summon, and you know one of the brothers is dead but she doesn't hold you responsible. 

Sad and far away sound - except in parts when she knows you killed her family.
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_HagOccupied: This is an edgecase in which the player talks to Mayrina when the hag isn't present. Mayrina is afraid, looking around for the hag - doesn't want to get into trouble. Sitting down in her chair.
session_synopses.HusbandResurrected: This is one of the key moments in the hag's region. The player raises Connor from the dead but without Mayrina present cannot control the Zombie that is now Connor. Panicked and afraid, the zombie struggles to call his wife's name before barelling forward - attacking the very person who raised them from the dead,
session_synopses.SurrogateMother_AD_CorpseDugUp: Triggers when Mayrina gets to the grave. In the top node the grave is empty. In the bottom the corpse is lying there for her to see. She leaves and does not return.

PAD_TriedTart.speaker: Player
PAD_TriedTart.text: Gods spare me, why did I think eating a second one was a good idea?

PAD_Fled.speaker: Player
PAD_Fled.text: Where has she gone, I wonder?

session_synopses.PAD_TriedTart: Player eats a disguised Hag Tart, not knowing it's truly rotten and noxious. Brave (or foolish) players can eat the tart a second time, deepening their misery.
session_synopses.PAD_Fled: In the top node player has started combat with the hag in the teahouse. She has disappeared, fleeing to her lair. In the bottom, business has been conducted peacefully and she has left.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: Bloody way to end an argument. I hope we chose the right side.

PAD_SidedHag.speaker: Player
PAD_SidedHag.text: No point in debating what's already done. Let's go on ahead.

session_synopses.PAD_SidedHag: This VB plays after saving Ethel from the two brothers of the sister she's holding captive. Ether disappeared in a magic puff, and she was acting suspicious. The players are reacting to her exit and discussing that there may be more to Ethel than meets the eye.Speaker 1 may have been the character who was in dialog for the scene with Ethel. Speaker 2 is another party member. However, since there may be combat, this setup isn't guaranteed and it's best to write this assuming everyone had a hand in the actions that led to this VB playing.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: You protected a child-stealing vampire? Bold choice.

PAD_ProtectedAstarion.speaker: Player
PAD_ProtectedAstarion.text: Let's hope it doesn't come back to bite me later.

session_synopses.PAD_ProtectedAstarion: This voicebark plays when a player chooses to not give up Astarion to the Gur hunter.Speaker 1 is assumed to be the player who did this action, and speaker 2 may have an opinionated comment on the outcome.Astarion can be neither of the speakers.

session_synopses.WRLD_TendFlowers_HagForm: Timeline dialog for Auntie Ethel in Hag form tending flowers
session_synopses.WRLD_GettingBloodFromTrough: Timeline scene trigger for redcap getting blood from a trough

SurrogateMother_Lair.speaker: Mayrina
SurrogateMother_Lair.text: Ethel's gone, isn't she? I felt it.
SurrogateMother_Lair.context: NodeContext: Scared and horrified - the reality of what almost happened sinking in.

session_synopses.SurrogateMother_Lair: This occurs after the hag fight. Mayrina is in one of two states. In the top she is horrified, shaken and trying to calm herself. She can't believe she almost made a deal with the hag and explains her deal to the player.In the second, she is FURIOUS with the player for ruining her deal. And leaves angry with them (unless you tell her about ethel planning to eat her child.)

AD_HagCackles.context: NodeContext: A set of different cackles for Ethel. All evil. All nasty. All mean. At least three different kinds.

PAD_Explore1.speaker: Player
PAD_Explore1.text: That smell - something died in here.

AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor.text: 'A thief who tried to steal from Auntie. Now the good little pet guards my home.'

AD_VictimSign_004.text: 'My sweet Calim, whose beloved asked that his beauty never fade.'

PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.speaker: Player
PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral.text: They're not attacking. Must think I'm one of them.

Victim_001.speaker: Efrin
Victim_001.text: I'm getting out of this hellhole. You'd best do the same.
Victim_001.context: NodeContext: You're alive but that could change at any moment. Nearly running out the door.

AD_VictimSign_005.text: 'This poor dear wished never to lay eyes on her family again.'

VB_BurningCage.speaker: Player
VB_BurningCage.context: NodeContext: You're trying to save a woman. She's trapped in a cage that is one fire.

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.text: Hah! Catch me if you can, petal!
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2.context: NodeContext: You've turned invisible and disappeared during the fight. Laughing and joking with amused menace.

TalkingDoor.speaker: Narrator
TalkingDoor.text: *The door trembles at the thought of the hag. She would be furious if she caught intruders here.*

AD_VictimSign_002.text: 'My darling Magron. She wished for the mind of a genius, but the silly head crossed me.'

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.speaker: Mayrina
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.text: Get me out of this hellhole!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real.context: NodeContext: The hag has sent out illusions that look like you. You're horrified and crying out to the player, running towards them for safety. It's in the middle of a fight and you're scared but still being your usual bratty and petulant self.

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_003_Dead.text: What can you tell me about the hag?

Victim_003_Dead.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003_Dead.text: ... she gives you... exactly what... was promised...

AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.text: Don't let that awful hag hurt me!
AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake.context: NodeContext: This is the fake illusion. She has Mayrina's voice and is pretending to be Mayrina. Crying in the fight - begging and pleading for the player to believe that they are the real Mayrina and the other is the fake. It should ring a little false.

AD_SummonVictims.context: NodeContext: You're forcing two people to come help you in battle - it's a spell and they have no free will. Soft alluring voice as you call our to them across the room.

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Player
Victim_005_Dead.text: Why did you go to the hag?

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: My family took her... my baby girl...

Victim_005_Dead.speaker: Blinded Elf
Victim_005_Dead.text: Told Ethel... never wanted... to see them again... she... took my eyes...

VB_MayrinaInCage.speaker: Player
VB_MayrinaInCage.context: NodeContext: You've spotted the woman you're trying to save.

AD_VictimSign_003.text: 'My gentle Lorin. He wished to know what was to come.'

AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.speaker: Mayrina
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.text: Come on! Bash her brains out!
AD_SurrogateMotherInCage.context: NodeContext: You're roaring encouragement at the player. You're in a cage - high above the fight.

Victim_004.speaker: Narrator
Victim_004.text: *You see the shadowed outline of a figure.*

VB_MirrorScreams.speaker: Player
VB_MirrorScreams.context: NodeContext: Confused at the sound but you can't tell where it is.

PutOnMask.text: Hello, petal. My, my - the mask suits you. Just relax. See the world with fresh eyes.
And let your dear old Auntie Ethel look after you.

AD_VictimSign_001.text: 'My dearest Efrin. He begged me to halt the deadly disease that ravaged him.'

AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.text: Am I here? Or am I there?
AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1.context: NodeContext: You've summoned illusions of yourself to confuse and taunt the player. You're calling out to them in a mocking and amused tone.

AD_ViciousMockery.text: I wonder which parent regrets you more, half-breed.

AD_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
