AD_Victim_003.context: CinematicNodeContext: One the ground - cowering. Curled up - looking in front of you at a mirror and then ducking behind your hands. NodeContext: Panicked and afraid. You're severely traumatised and not really aware of your surroundings.

AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.speaker: Demir, Johl
AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of a fight. The hag has assumed the form of your sister and you can tell which is the real one. You've spotted your sister. A warning to player not to attack your sister!

EntranceDouble.text: You are as thick as they come, sweetness.
EntranceDouble.context: NodeContext: Threatening smile while taunting player.The old lady act is gone.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Wait! Argh. Wait just a tick.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: You're on the brink of being defeated in the fight and you've stopped it - preparing to beg for your life with a new deal. You're breathless and in pain, fighting to regain control.

HagBegsForMercy.text: Killing me is a waste of time - I'll find a way to return. Always have, always will.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: little breathy from the fight, coldly determined in the second line

HagBegsForMercy.text: But it's... unpleasant. So how about we be civilised about this, hmm? I have something you want.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: wincing at the thought in the first line, turning on the charm in the second, trying to regain control

HagBegsForMercy.speaker: Player
HagBegsForMercy.text: Indeed. I'll take your head and stick it on a pike.
Now, petal, there's... there's no need for such talk.
HagBegsForMercy.context: NodeContext: Player has threatened to kill you. You're scared and not used to it - trying not to show it.

VB_EnteredGallery.speaker: Player
VB_EnteredGallery.context:
NodeContext: Creeped out and horrified as you enter a 'gallery' of the hag's victims.
Shadowheart: droll.

Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
Victim_003.context: NodeContext: Player has spoken to you once already. Fighting back tears - panicked and afraid - wishing these visions of death would end.

AD_HagAttacksCage.text: You want the girl so bad? Fine. Have her roasted!
AD_HagAttacksCage.context: NodeContext: You've just set the cage holding a pregnant woman prisoner on fire. Middle of a fight. Laugh and a vicious smile.

AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed.context: NodeContext: You're in the middle of the fight - the player has figured out which illusion is the real you and hit you. You're PISSED. Furious at the player, yelping in pain for one of them, and roaring at the player for the others. Furious, vengeful and MAD.

Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.speaker: Player
Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer.text: A mind flayer. No intention of letting that happen.

AD_DoubleDied.context: NodeContext: You have created illusions of yourself. The player is attacking you - but getting the illusion instead. You're laughing and taunting them - rubbing it in their face that they can't find you.

session_synopses.AD_HagCackles: A set of different cackles for Ethel to be used in the lair.
session_synopses.PAD_Explore1: Players have wandered into the Hag Lair without Ethel being present and are commenting on the creepy environment. This is the first to fire.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_TalkingDoor: This person has been turned into a door and is unable to speak. Sign attached to it.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_004: This person is trapped in a mirror and mute.
session_synopses.PAD_MaskedVictimsNeutral: You are wearing the mask and the other masked victims do not attack you.
session_synopses.Victim_001:
The dwarf was turned to stone by the hag to stop the spread of an deadly disease - Laduguer's Bite. Little does he know that the hag was the one who cause the disease in the first place.

Should you remove the petrification spell BEFORE the hag is dead, the disease will kill him.

Should you speak to him after the hag is dead, you can figure out that the hag is the one who made him sick in the first place.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_005: An eyeless woman - dead. One of the hag's victims. You're reading a sign in front of her eyeless body.
session_synopses.VB_BurningCage: This occurs when the hag sets the cage on fire.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase2: The hag turns invisible and disappears during the fight.
session_synopses.TalkingDoor: The door guarding the entrance to the hag's lair. It's actually transparent and the player can walk through it. It's a cut scene as the door tries to project images onto the player and communicate to them. Pleading with them to leave. The door was a thief that was taken by Ethel and torn to shreds, with the remainder of his body transformed into a door.Much of this is a 'cut scene' as the door projects visions into the player's mind instead of communicating.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_002: A victim holding their own decapitated head in their hands. This is the sign attached to their corpse.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Real: Triggered during the fight with the hag. She has sent out illusions mimicking Mayrina. The real Mayrina is trying running towards the player. Her voice and mannerisms should be a clue to the player that this is the real Mayrina.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Dead: The characters has died and player is using the 'speak with dead' spell. Character is at peace. He lived in fear of his own death. Now that it's happened, he's at peace.
session_synopses.AD_MayrinaIllusion_Fake: These are fired during the fight. It's the hag pretending to be Mayrina.
session_synopses.AD_SummonVictims: Auntie Ethel summons victim_001 and victime_003 to aide her in battle.
session_synopses.Victim_005_Dead: A dialogue with the corpse of a hag victim with her eyes gouged out. She is happy to be dead-- she lived a terrible life and carried family secrets heavily upon her. Her voice should be meek and delicate. She has borne too much in this life already and is ready to be done.
session_synopses.VB_MayrinaInCage: Triggers when the player enters the lair and sees Mayrina trapped in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_003_Freed: This occurs if Lorin survived the fight with the hag. He is dazed and out of it. This is the victim who first say the player as a mind flayer and freaked out. 1) In scenario one, he was never summoned by the hag2) He was summoned and attacked the player and saw the player turn into a mindflayer3) He was summoned and attacked the player but never saw the player as a mind flayer
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_003: This person is alive but severely traumatised and hysterical.
session_synopses.AD_SurrogateMotherInCage: ADs fire by Mayrina when she is trapped in the cage. In the first set it's when combat has started and she is cheering the player on, in the second set she just wants the player to leave her alone. In the third set the cage is on fire, and in the last the fighting is over but she's still locked in the cage.
session_synopses.Victim_004: A victim of the hag's. They're trapped inside a mirror.
session_synopses.VB_MirrorScreams: Trigger near mirror - someone is trapped inside.
session_synopses.PutOnMask: Player put on mask and is hearing auntie's voice telepathically booming around them.
session_synopses.AD_VictimSign_001: This is the plaque that is attached to the petrified body of one of the hag's victims.
session_synopses.AD_SpawnDoublesPhase1: The fires as Ethel summons illusions of herself to confuse the player.
session_synopses.AD_ViciousMockery: The Hag will cast Vicious Mockery on the party in combat. Whoever she targets will be insulted by origin or race. If a character is targeted multiple times, another insult in the chain will be used.
session_synopses.AD_Victim_003: This is a victim of the hag. He was cursed to see the future - he's severely traumatised. In the first AD he's been summoned to fight by the hag. In the rest, he's curled up ont he ground and talking to himself. Severely traumatised.
session_synopses.AD_BrotherReactToMayrinaIllusion: The hag assumes the form of Mayrina in the boss fight. The brothers are able to tell who is Mayrina and who is the hag.
session_synopses.EntranceDouble: This fires when the player enters the victim gallery, She appears to taunt them and then vanishes.
session_synopses.Victim_001_Dead: Dialogue with dead hag victim using Speak with Dead. He's relieved to be 'free' at last after haivng lived a life petrified/ afflicted with Laduguer's Bite, a terrible illness.
session_synopses.HagBegsForMercy: The hag is on the brink of defeated. She's stoppped the fight to try and plead for her life by offering the player the thing she does best - a deal. If Mayrina is present she asks offers you a powerful gift in exchange for her life (she will also take Mayrina with her) or the hag can bargain for Mayrina's life but lose out on the powerful gift. It is a tense and heightened situation.
session_synopses.VB_EnteredGallery: Triggers as you enter the hag gallery. It's creepy.
session_synopses.Victim_003:
This victim was cursed to see the future by the hag. In his initial dialogue, he is SEVERELY traumatised - sitting down, knees up, peeking out between his arms. He should sound quite disturbed, as if his sanity has long since deserted him.

He doesn't look at the player until halfway through the dialogue. When he looks up, he believes the player to be a monster of nightmares - a mindflayer. This is a terrifying moment for the player, as they are fighting a parasite in their head that will cause them to turn into a mindflayer.

In his dialogue in which he's met the player but has survived the hag, his gift is gone - but once he realises the player is the monster he saw before, he runs - terrified. 

In his post hag dialogue he is saddened and clearly traumatised by his time with the hag - and the thought of the life he could have led.
session_synopses.AD_HagAttacksCage: These are fired during the fight with the hag. The first occurs when Mayrina's cage is set on fire, the second if she dies.
session_synopses.AD_DoublesIllusionRevealed: This fires during the fight with the player. The player has figured out which illusion is the real hag and hit it.
session_synopses.Victim_003_PAD_Mindflayer: This occurs after speaking to the prescient victim in the hag's lair, who sees the player turn into a mind flayer in a vision.
session_synopses.AD_DoubleDied: This fires during the fight with the hag. She's created doubles of herself and the player has attacked the double - missing her. She's taunting them.

HagLair_Victim_003.speaker: Lorin
HagLair_Victim_003.context: NodeContext: *With a gasp, the corpse shuddered.*

AD_ControlledByMask.speaker: Player
AD_ControlledByMask.text: Get out. GET OUT OF MY HEAD!
AD_ControlledByMask.context: CinematicNodeContext: Clutching head NodeContext: Panicked and afraid as the hag invades your mind. Lae'zel's line; Pa'vrylk = Stop! Pronounced; PAH-vrill-ck

AD_ControlledByMask.text: Quiet, little one. Auntie will make it all better.
AD_ControlledByMask.context: NodeContext: Soothing and cruel. A vicious insult as you take over their mind.

Lair.speaker: Mayrina
Lair.text: You wretched little insect. I'm going to rip out your spine!
Lair.context: NodeContext: Roaring it at the player - likely on the other side of the lair. They've freed your captive and you are furious and out of blood. Fit to kill everyone in the room.

MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, resisting a telepathic command from the hag

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext: as if drugged - hushed voice

MaskedVictim4.speaker: Mask of Terror
MaskedVictim4.text: Very droll, my friend. Most amusing.
MaskedVictim4.context: NodeContext:  a deranged but poltie butler

MaskedVictim2.speaker: Mask of Servitude
MaskedVictim2.text: Don't be afraid of Auntie - she'll take good care of you.
MaskedVictim2.context: NodeContext: halting speech, unsure if the statement is true but brainwashed to believe it is

MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist.speaker: Mask of Vengeance
MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist.context: NodeContext: in pain, trying to resist telepathic commands from the hag who is ordering them to kill the players in combat

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: We need to leave. You're not supposed to be here - she'll be furious.
MaskedVictim1.context: CinematicNodeContext: panicked, confused, as if coming out of a stuporNodeContext: confused, afraid

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Player
MaskedVictim1.text: You served her - give me one good reason to let you live.

MaskedVictim1.speaker: Mask of Regret
MaskedVictim1.text: It was the mask. It dug its roots into me... took away my will. I tried to fight it.
MaskedVictim1.context: NodeContext: explaining something she barely understands

AD_WearMask.context: NodeContext: You've broken into someone's mind - and taken over. Victorious and cruel as you BEND THEM to your will.

session_synopses.AD_ControlledByMask: The player has failed the wisdom save while wearing the mask - and fallen prey to the hag's control. Auntie Ethel takes over your mind.
session_synopses.Lair: These are fired at the very beginning of the fight with the hag - tense scene. Hag is at one end of the cavern. Mayrina is trapped in a cage in the middle. Player is on the other side.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim4: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This one is wearing the Mask of Servitude and is brainwashed to serve the hag and her 'visitors'.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim2: A victim of the hag, bound into her service for so long that their mind is almost completely lost. This victim is wearing the Mask of Terror, which fills them with fear of everything but the hag.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim3_AD_Resist: Lines that play in combat when the hag's masked victim resists the commands of the mask.
session_synopses.MaskedVictim1: A victim of the hag, forced to wear a mask that takes away her free will so that she fights for and serves the hag. If the hag is killed, this character regains her senses and resolve. She's deeply shaken by her experience, but courageous, telling the player that she'll inform the people of Baldur's Gate of our heroism, and vowing to hunt down the hag's accomplices in the city.
session_synopses.PAD_FreedFromControl: Player breaks free from the hag's control.
session_synopses.AD_WearMask: This occurs when the player puts on the hag mask and on ever subsequent 'turn' thereafter. The player must continually succeed on a wisdom save or risk the hag taking over their mind.

node_data.speaker: Tracker Tozad
node_data.text: If yer plannin' to talk ta the drow, watch yerself - she's in a right mood.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Nervous and deferential (when speaking to a drow) Insulting (when speaking to a Tiefling)  Friendly word of advice (if speaking to neither a drow or tiefling).

session_synopses: A female goblin grunt. Nervous and respectful to drow, insulting towards tieflings. World-weary and advisory to others.

Goblin_001.speaker: Warrior Plagg
Goblin_001.text: Keep moving, 'less you're wanting a clubbing and drubbing.

Goblin_002.speaker: Sharp-Eye Crub
Goblin_002.text: Nowhere the faithless can hide. It's the Absolute's world now!

session_synopses.Goblin_001: Goblin talking about that chump hero the Blade of Frontiers
session_synopses.Goblin_002: One goblin announced the blade of frontiers has no change against the Absolute!

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Huh? What do you want? I'm tryin' to concentrate on readin'!
node_data.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Can I see the manuscript?

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: I ain't finished with it! There's enough readin' here to last me a lifetime.
node_data.context: NodeContext: indignant

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You should spend your time in prayer - not reading this nonsense.
True

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: S'pose you're right. Absolute rewards faith, not book-learnin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: after being persuaded to give something away - pleased to have learned something

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Piddle
node_data.text: Take it. Maybe if I pray hard enough I can get some of that booyahg for myself.

session_synopses: He is smarter than your average goblin, and is reading a manuscript - loose papers, freshly written by Volo. It's a study of goblin behaviour that would give anyone who reads it an advantage in combat against goblins.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: You see that eye wotsit floatin' about? Best hope it don't take a fancy to you...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nodding as if towards the 'wotsit'.NodeContext: Conspiratol tone. He doesn't like the 'device' and takes issue with it.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: ... unless you like playin' hide an' seek when yer tryin' to take a dump.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Crass. Obviously speaking from experience.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: It can look all it likes. I've got nothing to hide.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: If that's how you get yer kicks, ain't no business o' mine.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Player has said they don'tt mind the device watching them. Goblin has interpreted it as having no issue with being watched in the latrine.

node_data.speaker: Skrut
node_data.text: But when yer takin' a tinkle, be sure to wave, eh? The bigwigs at Moonrise love a good show.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Almost a sly wink at wave. He's joking -  Knows those in Moonrise would be furious.

session_synopses: There's a floating eye moving throughout the camp. This goblin takes issue with it, he feels they are being spied on by their bosses, who don't trust them.

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.text: I said he's MINE. Now YOU are, too.
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.context: NodeContext: H's mad and petulant because the playerkept attacking the tortured adventurer, who he considers to be his.

session_synopses.Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom: Grush gets mad at the player for attacking or killing the tortured adventurer.

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't polite to stare, worm-wart. If you ain't got the guts to get branded, clear off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Dismissive

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Why would I let anyone scar me for life?

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Ain't just a mark on the flesh: it's magic. Only them what follows the Absolute can see it.
node_data.context: NodeContext: as if trying to explain something obvious to an idiot

node_data.speaker: Warlock Greez
node_data.text: Let's us know you're on our side. That way, nobody'll mess with ya.
node_data.context: NodeContext: explaining something simple, talking down to us a little

session_synopses: Newly-converted goblin is eager to talk about the virtues of the  the Absolute. He's full of religious zeal and relative good cheer, which is amplified if he finds the players are on the same side. Or pretending to be.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: The player suddenly halts as they experince a deafening ringing sound in their head. They wince in pain.

VoiceOfAbsolute.text: Hear my voice. Obey my command.
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: CinematicNodeContext: Characters look on the verge of collapsing. NodeContext: Faint, yet authoritative. The voice of a omnipotent, yet unseen being.

VoiceOfAbsolute.speaker: Narrator
VoiceOfAbsolute.text: *The voice is irresistible. Every word is drenched with a power and authority that you do not understand, but cannot deny.*
VoiceOfAbsolute.context: InternalNodeContext: The player hasn't used their illithid powers

session_synopses.VoiceOfAbsolute: Before entering the goblin camp, a scene triggers in which the party hear the voice of the Absolute, and experience a vision of its Chosen Three (Ketheric, Gortash and Orin). The voice orders the player to help the three find the Orpheus artefact and to seek 'the path of illumination'.If a party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory, they take it into their hands. It glows brighter and brighter, and then the voice and visions stop. The light from the box then fades, and the player(s) discuss the apparent protection the box provided from the Absolute’s influence.If no party member in the group has the Orpheus box in their inventory,and Shadowheart isn't alive to show up, the visions and voice will cause the party to pass out and experience a forced camp night where they receive the box.NOTE: this dialogue contains narrator nodes that're intended to be player-forward in the medium term until NPC assets are available for cinematics.

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: Open your peepers, freak. It's time.
Warlock.context: CinematicNodeContext: player waking up - blinking, seeing priestess standing right before them, leaning in closeNodeContext: speaking to player who is captive, in chains - they've been resting and she's waking them

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: You should be sprouting tentacles by now, but you're still the same kind of ugly you always was.

Warlock.speaker: True Soul Gut
Warlock.text: Disappointing not to have my own squiddie... but your giblets'll make for a tasty supper.
CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player
Warlock.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~A portal opens behind the priestess, and the warlock steps through and slits the priestess' throat. As the priestesses throat is slit, her blood sprays all over the player

Warlock.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock.text: Sorry - I may have left that a little late. No lasting damage, I hope?
Warlock.context: NodeContext: brushing herself down after killing a goblin priestess - apologetic, amused. speaking to a chained player she just rescued

Warlock.speaker: Korrilla
Warlock.text: My master has been keeping a close eye on you. When you got yourself into this predicament, he sent me to help.

session_synopses.Warlock:
However this scene plays out, the warlock is enigmatic and self-assured - she saves players and then departs, hinting toward the help that her master can offer in other similar situations.Players have been captured by the goblin priestess and could not escape their chains. After they rest, the priestess returns to see if they've transformed into mind flayers (as she expected) and is disappointed to see they haven't. She intends to kill them, but a warlock intervenes and saves the players, killing the priestess.

The warlock has been sent by its master, a cambion called The Monitor, who players may have met already.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: That was... intense. Wouldn't want to bump into that thing while it was still alive.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A little incredulous. The ritual is done, so he can speak freely.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: You really wouldn't.

node_data.speaker: Kagran
node_data.text: Of course, the Absolute protects us now, but still...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Still a little hushed. He's still a bit awestruck about what just happened.

session_synopses: Human cultist watching the Goblin King perform the Speak With Dead spell.

Adventurer.speaker: Smythin
Adventurer.text: Thanks. I thought I was done for.

session_synopses.Adventurer: an adventurer who survived being thrown into the goblins' spider pit

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Nass
node_data.text: Seen this mess? Flamin' Fist thuggo took a chunk outta me arm last raid out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: She's holding her arm up to playerNodeContext: Speaks to the player slightly more as an equal - they've been accepted into the camp thus far, after all. She's displaying a nasty wound

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Non crit-path. This goblin is recounting stories of her last raid and displaying a wound. It's less a cause of pain than a subject for boasting.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Still got it, True Soul! Must be all that practice you're doin', heh.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Still cheerful and respectul, but a bit more forced this time. You've done this once before and he's growing tired of it, even if he can't say it.

AlarmUsedReaction.speaker: Sentinel Olak
AlarmUsedReaction.text: Oh look - backup's on its way. Again.
AlarmUsedReaction.context: NodeContext: Creeping annoyance, but masking it. He's already had to explain your mistake once and he knows they're going to be annoyed.

Guard005.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
Guard005.text: I can see the Absolute from here. I can!

Guard004.speaker: Tracker Rindle
Guard004.context: InternalNodeContext: Gained access by poop smearingNodeContext: Level of disgust - player has shit on their face.

Worg_001.speaker: Klaw
Worg_001.text: Rip ya. Rip ya fer yer giblets. Got thick giblets. Want 'em.
Worg_001.context: NodeContext: Slavering worg, hungry, vicious. Spoken quickly.

CliffWarning.speaker: Sharp-Eye Snurd
CliffWarning.text: Oi, thicko! This here's off-limits. Get to the main gate, or I'll plug you full o' arrows.
CliffWarning.context: NodeContext: Warning an intruder to leave  - shouting last line

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Well! Look who's gettin' dragged back. And by such high company! How badly did you mess up?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak to Sazza, a fellow goblin he doesn't have respect for.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Can it! I know something Ragzlin will want to hear.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is ragging on Olak. They don't like each other.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: I been in some druids' grove. This one sprang me. Now move over, so I can tell Ragzlin myself!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza is arguing on the player's behalf to the hostile Olak.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Hold on. Where are the raiders?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Olak is full of gleeful malice.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Ragzlin's drow friend won't be happy to hear that.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: She'll be happy enough when I tell her where them looters is holin' up. Let me through.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Hard 'g' on ranga. Sazza's pride is wounded but she hates Olak, so doesn't want to show it.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olak turns to the playerNodeContext: To player. Cool and malicious.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Is it true, what Saz says? You helped her escape that grove?
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. Genuine inquiry, but he's disinclined to believe you.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sentinel Olak
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: Quiet type, eh? Good. Keep outta trouble, or you and Saz'll get it.
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: e's not exactly friendly here, but he will let you into camp.

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: Sazza to Olak. 'Shut up and let us in.'

ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.speaker: Sazza
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.text: C'mon! Gotta let the drow know where them looters is. We'll be heroes!
ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin.context: NodeContext: To player. More bright and friendly.

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: NodeContext: Greeting node inquiring - is the player part of her clan?

Backup001.speaker: Sharp-Eye Sluck
Backup001.context: CinematicNodeContext: She turns away from you with a huff.NodeContext: She's very put off. Player has confirmed they are NOT part of the same clan. She turns away with a huff.

Trespassing.text: You again? That's enough creepin' around. Lads - attack!

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *A great, taut drum sits before you. One strike would likely ring for miles, alerting goblin reinforcements.*

AlarmSystem.speaker: Narrator
AlarmSystem.text: *From the far distance, you hear a blast of goblin voices.*

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: haven't met the guards yet, not drowNodeContext: Goblin's talking to his worg (big gross wolf). Evil character, not a nice person.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Unless you got another reason to be here, feck-shite.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player. Dripping with disdain.

Guard001.speaker: Gale
Guard001.text: Let's try to be diplomatic, shall we? Goblins don't come by the handfuls, but by the dozens.

Guard001.speaker: Narrator
Guard001.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Beautiful animal. Does she belong to the Nordiland worgata family?

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: NodeContext: He's impressed. He's a worg expert so your knowledge appeals to him, but he doesn't want to make it too easy for you.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Dumb as a rock, but world class at tearin' the throats outta wee ones, she is.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Rest of her litter's inside, in the pens. Beautiful beasts.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Bit of affection, he's talking about his dog. Still with a hint of malice, though.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: I've never seen a pack up close - always wanted to.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Be a shame if you came all this way without havin' a look. But I can't let you pass just like that.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Celebratin' a raid, we are. You'll need to wear our war colours.
Guard001.context: NodeContext: Said greasily. He's playing a trick on the player.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.text: Nice dab o' this across the mug oughta do it.
Guard001.context: CinematicNodeContext: *He pointed to a steaming pile of worg dung at his feet.*NodeContext: Pointing to worg shit as he says this. Stifling an evil laugh. He's told the player to smear shit in their face.

Guard001.speaker: Player
Guard001.text: Scoop up the warm dung and fling it at Olak's face.

Guard001.speaker: Sentinel Olak
Guard001.context: InternalNodeContext: Can flinging dung at Olek make him go blind for combat?NodeContext: Player threw dung in Olak's eyes. This leads to combat.

session_synopses.AlarmUsedReaction: The player used the alarm drum, which is meant to alert other guards that there are enemies attacking. Depending on who the player is and how they performed, the goblins around the alarm will either be impressed, neutral, or willing to fight.
session_synopses.Guard005: Goblin standing on a hill. Fibbing like a child about what he can see.
session_synopses.Guard004: Goblin grunt guarding a checkpoint. Laconic; gruff.
session_synopses.Worg_001: Squirrely, quick-breathing, animalian worg (wolf-like creature) stands guard at a checkpoint with its masters.
session_synopses.CliffWarning: Goblin warns an intruder to leave
session_synopses.ThreeWayDialogWithCapturedGoblin:
If the player released the captured goblin in Halsin's den, the CG will be waiting for the player at the checkpoint. When the player starts the dialog with the main guard at the checkpoint (or gets closer to him) and the CG is at the checkpoint, this dialog is shown. After this dialog, the CG leaves the checkpoint and the main guard gets his normal dialog back.

 Olak and Sazza have a very antagonistic relationship, ripping each other to shreds.
session_synopses.TopCliffWarning: Player is climbing a cliff they shouldn't be and is spotted by a goblin guard.
session_synopses.Backup001: One of the three goblins that are serve as a backup for the checkpoint in case of emergency. This goblin is a bit touched in the head and wonders whether you're a member of her tribe. She's a woman even though some of the notes are male.
session_synopses.Trespassing: The player can enter the trespassing area from the checkpoint side or from camp side. Different reactions from the checkpoint guards.
session_synopses.AlarmSystem: The dialog for the alarm system. If the player activates it then the first half of the camp will become hostile.
session_synopses.Guard001:
All guards at the checkpoint point the player to the guard with this dialog. He is an evil, nasty character who has no reason to go easy on the player. Should ooze disdain. This is the first goblin we meet and their weasly, cruel, wicked nature should stand out.
The goblin will let a non-allied player in only if they smear worg shit on their face. Yuck.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Awshh... drink's goin' straight through me...
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk, to the point he's slightly unsteady on his feet

Goblin006.speaker: Player
Goblin006.text: The only cure is drinking more - as fast as you can.

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: That's the plan! We looted an entire inn - brought back enough booze to drown a dragon.
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: drunk - explaining the reasons for the party with respect and excitement

Goblin006.speaker: Sharp-Eye Aggy
Goblin006.text: Here's to them we nicked it off! Down one mug of ale for every throat we cut!
Goblin006.context: NodeContext: as if proposing a toast; he's drinking and celebrating

GoblinKid001.speaker: Five
GoblinKid001.text: I won't do nothin'! Please stop!

Ogre_00.speaker: Guard Gurgon
Ogre_00.text: Someone kill beer. No more fun - I smash him.
Ogre_00.context: NodeContext: The ogre is mad becuase someone poisoned the beer tub and killed his friends. He's saying that the fun is over and he'll kill the person who did it.

GoblinSleeper_01.speaker: Tracker Dullwill
GoblinSleeper_01.context: NodeContext: goblin is drunk and sleeping, belches when disturbed but doesn't wake

Trader.speaker: Grat the Trader
Trader.context: CinematicNodeContext: Eyes the player suspciously.NodeContext: Suspicious.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: Wot are you s'posed to be? You look like a dead elf wot got left out in the sun for too long.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: sneering, mocking. He's a cocky teenager who just met a gith (alien creature; not well known) for the first time

GoblinKid000.speaker: Player
GoblinKid000.text: I'm a githyanki; a stranger to this land.

GoblinKid000.speaker: Four
GoblinKid000.text: There's plenty of weirdoes about - you'll fit right in, freakshow.
GoblinKid000.context: NodeContext: Mocking. He's replying to a player who just explained that they're from another plane of existence.

BugbearSleeper_00.speaker: Stimk
BugbearSleeper_00.context: NodeContext: Goblin language words muttered in his sleep (Grash rhymes with crash, a-rah-ga, hard g on 'ghist' and pok rhymes with lock)

Goblin001.speaker: Warrior Sul
Goblin001.text: This ale tastes like hobgoblin spit. Who's been pukin' in the barrel?

DwarfOperator000.speaker: Tracker Klagga
DwarfOperator000.text: Some coward move, poisonin' our drink. But we'll get them, you'll see.
DwarfOperator000.context: NodeContext: Someone poisoned their beer and killed his mates. He's determined to catch the killer.

Goblin002.speaker: Tracker Tak
Goblin002.text: Watch yerself - there's somethin' rotten in the booze.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Hey... hey! You ain't roundin' me up for no raid. No way. I'm DRINKIN'!
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: She's boozy and aggressive - especially if you try to stop her having another drink. Friendly as could be if you join her in a drink.

Goblin005.speaker: Player
Goblin005.text: You'll need to sober up before another raid.

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: Tha's wot I said! Too sozzled for slicin' folks.
Goblin005.context: NodeContext: Pleased to have the player's support

Goblin005.speaker: Tracker Puli
Goblin005.text: I'd sleep it off in the worg pens... but that place is a madhouse right now.

session_synopses.Goblin006: A goblin at a party who has had far too much to drink already. He's celebrating the raid in which the goblins stole all of the booze they're now working their way through.
session_synopses.GoblinKid001: a young goblin kid hanging out with his friends on the periphery of a party. Insulting and rude.
session_synopses.Ogre_00: This ogre has two states: one where he's enjoying the festivities, and one where he is angry at the person who interrupted the festivities.
session_synopses.GoblinSleeper_01: A drunk, sleeping goblin. If woken, he's tired and angry, and likely to attack the player
session_synopses.Trader: Grat is selling items laid out on a blanket in the middle of a drunken celebration in the goblin camp. He's not participating in the drinking - he expects to make a good bit of coin off his drunk mates.
session_synopses.GoblinKid000: A goblin kid, hanging out with two friends at the goblin camp near the corpse of a dead adventurer. He's trying to sound tough, like a cocky teenager impressing his friends.
session_synopses.BugbearSleeper_00: A sleeping bugbear is woken by the players hitting a nearby wall. Like a very angry drunk, woken up with a sore head. Guttural voice - not stupid-sounding, but savage and sinister.
session_synopses.Goblin001: A goblin drinking merrily at a party - tipsy.
session_synopses.DwarfOperator000: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.
session_synopses.Goblin002: This goblin is a chatty one, enjoying the party and making pleasant conversation. She assumes you're here for the same reasons she is - enjoying the spoils of a recent brutal raid.
session_synopses.GoblinKid002_LootingCrime: An unpleasant goblin kid's crime reaction on looting dead adventurer's body.
session_synopses.Goblin005: A drunk goblin who is trying to get out of doing any more raiding

node_data.speaker: Booyahg Gnat
node_data.text: True Soul, eh? Figured the Absolute had standards.

session_synopses: Goblin absolutely enamoured with his own king and less impressed with the player.

SpottedHostilePlayer.text: You! I remember you from the forest. You should never have come here.
SpottedHostilePlayer.context: NodeContext: They are hostile toward you and will fight you after htis line.

session_synopses.SpottedHostilePlayer: Priests of Conquering God can become hostile in FOR. If player leaves combat, priests still apear at Goblin Camp. This dialog happens if they spot a hostile player just to show player the reason why the whole camp suddenly becomes hostile.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Don't worry on the worgs, cavey. They won't eat anyfink wot grows in the ground.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Normal back-and-forth.NodeContext: Takes pleasure in trying to intimidate the player - if the player triggers the Underdark option, he's snide about it as well.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Eef
node_data.text: Might still kill ya, mind.

session_synopses: Goblin is (gleefully) warning player about wandering down into the wolf pens.

Parent.speaker: Brawler Birka
Parent.text: Come to see the bear? Just wait 'til Boss Ragzlin sets the worgs on it.
Parent.context: NodeContext: Polite in the come to see the traitor node, rude in the other one. She doesn't want to be bothered.

Kid_002.speaker: Three
Kid_002.text: It was so big but... it died so easy.
Kid_002.context: NodeContext: disappointed, doesn't really understand what's going on.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~The bear is tucked away in a corner, trying to make himself small.InternalNodeContext: default - not met, didn't speak about leaving the captiveNodeContext: excited/in awe because he made a bear squeal.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: Giggle before the line. She's excited because the woman makes noises when they throw stones at her.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Brawler Birka
GroupDialogWithBear.context: NodeContext: stern - she's trying to turn this torture into a learning experience for the kids.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Three
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: ~Three picks up a stone and throws it, hitting the bear in its faceNodeContext: A little humph of excertion while Three throws the stone.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks up at us, growling in pain.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: One
GroupDialogWithBear.text: Again! Again! Make it squeal again!

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Halsin
GroupDialogWithBear.context: CinematicNodeContext: The bear looks at our backs as we turn away, as if begging us to help it.

GroupDialogWithBear.speaker: Player
GroupDialogWithBear.text: That's it. I'm putting a stop to this.

Beastmaster002.speaker: Beastmaster Zurk
Beastmaster002.text: Ever tried cuttin' up an elf? All skin an' bones, the rangy gits. My arm's gonna be sore tomorrow.

Halsin_Following.text: Those ringleaders still draw breath. We must end them.
Halsin_Following.context: NodeContext: Halsin in his bear form, spoken to using SwA. More animalistic than usual, on the hunt.

HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.speaker: Halsin
HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage.context: NodeContext: SFX only - Halsin in bear form. Do not voice record.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: 'Ere to see the bear? Just follow the noise. Worgs 'ave been goin' crazy for it.
Beastmaster001.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful - worgs are not acting their usual selves.

Beastmaster001.speaker: Butcher Vrak
Beastmaster001.text: Just hope these scraps will satisfy the bunch when they're in this state.

Kid_001.speaker: One
Kid_001.text: Throw a stone - see if it growls!

Worg_001.speaker: Ferr
Worg_001.text: Smells big. Big belly. Big GUTS.

session_synopses.Parent: Goblin parent standing next to the goblin kinds throwing stones at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.Kid_002: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or the bear.
session_synopses.GroupDialogWithBear: Player finds a group of goblin kids throwing stones at a bear, spurred on by their mother. The bear is the arch druid Halsin, in bear form. He won't make this apparent to the player, even if they have Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster002: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Halsin_Following: Halsin, arch-druid of the Emerald Grove, is  following the player inside the Goblin Camp in his bear form, trying to find and kill the goblin leadership. The player can tell him to hold his position.
session_synopses.HalsinsBear_AfterCombat_InCage: A  bear who is imprisoned in the goblin camp. This bear is in fact the arch druid Halsin, though he doesn't reveal this to us until after he's out of his cage, even if we use Speak with Animals.
session_synopses.Beastmaster001: Goblin beastmaster cutting up meat for the worgs.
session_synopses.Kid_001: One of the goblin kids that is throwing rocks at Helia or Halsin's bear
session_synopses.Worg_001: One of the worgs in the worg pens, driven mad with excitement by the presence of Halsin, a druid transofrmed into a bear.

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *A longing for small spaces, stone walls hugging close. Confining. Comforting.*

LocalRat_002.speaker: Narrator
LocalRat_002.text: *There is a light here, in the tight space beneath the floor. Secret things that shine.*

session_synopses.LocalRat_002: This rat is skittering around the goblin camp - we can learn of a puzzle hidden in the floor.

Penance.speaker: Abdirak
Penance.text: The pain you suffer will cleanse you - do not fight it.
Penance.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon in hand (it will be either a dagger, a scourge, or a handaxe). Perhaps by his side as he takes a breathe between strikes to speak to the player. NodeContext: First time stirking the player. Excited and joyous - think a preacher building up to a full 'the lord will save us' act in a church.

Penance.speaker: Player
Penance.context: InternalNodeContext: When the event flag CancelPenance is set, Osiris takes care of clearing more flags and resetting the penance

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Sweet child. While I enjoyed that, I'm afraid your reaction was... lacking.
RewardPenance.context: NodeContext: Voice low and intimate. Player did penance but did not react correctly. He regrets that the player does not get a reward (but he had a great time, which is all he really cares abotu)

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: To gain Loviatar's favour, every single strike should be met with an honest cry of pain - or perhaps a touch of begging.

RewardPenance.speaker: Abdirak
RewardPenance.text: Nevertheless, thank you. And I pray you've learned from today's little... lesson.

Battlestation.speaker: Abdirak
Battlestation.text: My penitent child, the goblins have blood on their minds. I am leaving - I suggest you do the same.
Battlestation.context: NodeContext: The goblins are fighting, he's calm and measured but about to flee. He wants no part in it.

session_synopses.Penance: This occurs as Abdirak is beating the player. Breathless with excitement. Reveling in the act of penance - think preacher in 'god will save us, save us ALL!' mode as he, well, beats the crap out of the player. All of his reactions should be manic, joyous and vaguely sexual. Player is in front of him, facing a wall as he raises his weapon and beats the player. The weapon will be either a dagger, handaxe or a scourge.
session_synopses.RewardPenance:
Father Abdirak is a follower of Loviatar, a goddess that thrives on inflicting pain on others. He is indulging in some private 'worship' (self flagellation). He offers to help alleviate the player's pain by giving them 'penance' - i.e, beating them. 
Loviatar = loh-VEE-a-tar. He is a young and charismatic preacher with a threatening and creepy edge.
session_synopses.Battlestation: The goblins are fighting. He's going to leave, He loves pain - not death.

Dead.speaker: Narrator
Dead.context: NodeContext: after casting a spell to speak with a corpse - matter of fact despite the weird situation

session_synopses.Dead: players use a spell to speak with the corpse of a powerful drow commander at the goblin camp

node_data.speaker: Warrior Nrog
node_data.text: Go on. Sooner yer marked, sooner ye'll heal.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Bored. Giving advice to one less wise than he.

session_synopses: This goblin is standing guard inside temple - he's a little more relaxed than his zealous companion. Offers 'beginners' advice to player. As hostile as any other goblin if you try to pass without his superior's permission.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You are no goblin. Who are you? Answer me or die.

Tiny.speaker: Player
Tiny.text: Just a visitor. I mean you no harm.

Tiny.speaker: Smaller Giant Spider
Tiny.text: You don't mean harm. I do.

session_synopses.Tiny: A giant spider confronts players when they enter the pit where it is captive. It is hostile, but can be persuaded not to attack.

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
With fragulous crown, and with sceptre abrade,
Dror Ragzlin short work of the innkeeper made!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'fragulous' has a hard 'g' to sound somewhat like 'fabulous'. 'abrade' is pronounced a-braid. Dror Ragzlin is 'Drawer RAGS-lin'

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
The inn burned to ash! The captives were many!
Goblinkind had reduced them to cowering filfenny!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'filfenny' pronounced 'filth-any'

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Volo
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text:
So raiseth your goblets, and drain them with pride!
Dror Ragzlin, the True Soul, hath led you galide!
Volo_FestivitiesArea.context: NodeContext: singing improvised nonsense under duress, projecting his voice. 'Dror Ragzlin' is the goblins' leader (pronounced 'Drawer RAGS-lin'), 'galide' is a nonsense word pronounced with a hard 'g' (Gah-lied)

Volo_FestivitiesArea.speaker: Wyll
Volo_FestivitiesArea.text: I reckon Dror Ragzlin's the gobbo in charge, the way this one's carrying on.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Ha-HA! I knew I could count on you, my friend.
Volo_InCage.context: InternalNodeContext: The cage is unlocked. Player talked to Volo prior to unlocking the cage.

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: We mustn't tarry, but I'd hate for our friendship to end here. Please - won't you meet me, once we've both slipped the goblin yoke?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Player
Volo_InCage.text: A fine mess you landed yourself in. How'd you get caught?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: Why, by design, my friend. How better to learn the ways of a people than to live among them?

Volo_InCage.speaker: Volo
Volo_InCage.text: I daresay the experiment has proven most fruitful, too. I'll be happy to share my findings... once we've found somewhere safe to parley.

session_synopses.Volo_FestivitiesArea: Volo, a reknowned scholar, has been captured by goblins and is being forced to sing on a stage at their celebratory party following a raid. One goblin has the responsibility of guarding him and engages him in conversation. If the goblins are killed, he investigates the corpses, researching the cause of death.
session_synopses.Guard_AtCage: Drunk, excited goblin who's guarding Volo and forcing him to sing even though Volo's no singer.
session_synopses.Volo_InCage: Volo has been caught by the goblins and imprisoned. He has an invisbility potion he can use to escape once he's out of the cage, but he needs the player's help. He's a combination of desperate for help and his usal, confident self.

Guard.speaker: Warrior Plig
Guard.text: Steal somethin' or act the bollocks, will ya? I'm itching to throw someone in the brig. It'll be fun. I promise.
Guard.context: NodeContext: plig wants the player to act out so she can throw them in jail

session_synopses.Guard: Warrior Plig is a goblin on patrol around the wolf pens in the goblin camp. She's bored and wishing for some action.

Backup_02.speaker: Tracker Tizg
Backup_02.text: Smell that meat sizzlin'? Can't tell if it's the brandin' or the party - makin' me bloody 'ungry either way.
Backup_02.context: NodeContext: Sniffing at the air - craving meat and jealous of the party going on outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Sudden, barked - she's on guard duty and takes it very seriously, assumes you're a drunkard coming in from the party outside.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Shut it, Graw. Olak cleared us - got a visitor for the drow, I do.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: As if at a yapping dog. Sazza and Graw have bad blood, and Sazza loves being in a position of authority above her.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: My arse - what's a True Soul want with any mate o' yours?
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disbelieving - to Graw, Sazza is the lowest of the low but has always had high opinion of herself.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Private business, that is. Raidin' business. But if anyone wants a pisspot guarded, we'll call.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Putting on airs - Sazza has been chosen to go out on raids, Graw hasn't, and Sazza's rubbing it in.

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Warrior Trinzas
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: Just get your friend branded proper, right Sazza? Got better things to do th-
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Disgusted, dismissive. Trying to have the last word and claim a scrap of authority by telling Sazza to the player marked so she doesn't have to stop us again. Cut off at the end by Sazza's reply

3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.speaker: Sazza
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.text: No you don't. Come on, then.
3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins.context: NodeContext: Dismissive, bored, matter-of-fact. Snubbing Graw and sweeping past, addressing us to follow with the second line.

session_synopses.Backup_02: Guard is bored and would rather be at the party outside.
session_synopses.3way_UpsetAndCapturedGoblins: A three-way checkpoint dialog if Sazza (Captured Goblin) was freed in the Den. The guard would usually stop us but instead gives player free access to the Goblin Throne region.

Goblet.speaker: Lookout Grush
Goblet.text: Ya didn't touch my prisoner, didya? 'E's mine. Mine!
Goblet.context: CinematicNodeContext: He might not be standing next to the prisoner anymore.NodeContext: disgruntled and a little crazy. He didn't actually see you do anything, but he's suspicious.

session_synopses.Goblet: One of the guards standing next to the torture. He's mean (and a cannibal).

ChainedCharacter.speaker: True Soul Gut
ChainedCharacter.text: Wakey wakey. Don't bother strugglin' - you ain't goin' nowhere.
ChainedCharacter.context: CinematicNodeContext: speaking to character who is chained to a wallInternalNodeContext: Character was kidnapped and chained by priestNodeContext: malicious - she pretended to be our friend and now she's chained us to a wall. Should be a real change in tone from everyhing before this branch - true nature revealed, and it's not pretty

session_synopses.ChainedCharacter: Players wake from a sleeping spell/potion to find themselves chained, captive, in a cellar. The last thing they remember is accepting help from the goblin priestess, who has now captured them. She is sadistic and takes great pleasure in explaining that they're going to become mindflayers due to the parasite in their head, and that she's going to keep them trapped here until that happens.Barbarian characters can break free at the end if they succeed a strength check. Combat with Gut ensues.

session_synopses.CINE_ClimbDown: Cinematic Cutscene with the character using a ladder to get from the Goblin Camp to the Underdark

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Found yer manners?
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin sneers and hold out his foot.NodeContext: He asked us to kiss his feet, we ran away, and now we've come back. He wants to humiliate us some more.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: I'm waitin'.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Smug. He wants us to kiss his feet and there's nothing we can do about it (or so he thinks)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'd sooner spit in your face.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: What was that?
node_data.context: NodeContext: You just muttered an insult. The goblin is challanging you.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Apologise and drop to your knees.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: Thought so.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: We are on our knees, the goblin is looking down at us. close-up of his foot: his nails are cracked and black with mud, but we should clearly see a ring glittering on his big left toe.NodeContext: We muttered an insult, but after challenging us, we did what he wanted.

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: That's more like it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: close-up of his foot: his nails are cracked and black with mud, but we should clearly see a ring glittering on his big left toe.NodeContext: condescending - he asked us to kiss his feet and we got on our knees.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Kiss his foot - and try to slide the ring off his toe.
True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *As your lips touch filthy flesh, you catch a whiff of... lavender?*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The pleasant scent gives way to the muddy taste of something you try not to identify. You carefully slide the ring off.*

node_data.speaker: Crusher
node_data.text: You enjoyin' that? Disgustin' worm. Just remember: you're nuffing 'ere.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: We're at his feet still, so he's talking down to us. We get up during the last sentence.NodeContext: We've just kissed his feet for a long time. He's trying to humiliate us even further.

node_data.speaker: Astarion
node_data.text: Not bad. I would've taken the whole toe, but whatever works for you.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Did you see a druid named Halsin?

session_synopses: Annoyed at being interrupted while he's telling a story over a beer, this goblin wants to humiliate you in front of his lackeys.
session_synopses.Dead: SwD dialog for Crusher, an absolute legend (pun intended) among the goblin tribe.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Huk
node_data.text: Shh! Boss!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: The goblin looks from the goblin boss, to the player and back to the goblin boss, gesturing towards him.

session_synopses: This goblin is watching his boss in awe and doesn't want to be sisturbed. When he speaks, he does so in hushed tones.

node_data.speaker: Sharp-Eye Neem
node_data.text: Don't let our little pet scare ya, mate. Bloody bugbear couldn't break those bars.

session_synopses: Goblin is telling player of the captive they've placed in the wolf pens.

Commentator.speaker: Krolla
Commentator.text: What? Ain't nothin' left to chase, unless you fancy volunteerin'.
Commentator.context: NodeContext: Bored, surly - for one reason or another she can't play the game any more, and there's a dull hostility to her.

Ball.speaker: Narrator
Ball.text: *The chicken's head bobs, eyes darting around at the leering goblin faces. She's terrified.*
Ball.context: NodeContext: Appealing directly to the player for help. Hoping anyone will save her.

Ball.speaker: Narrator
Ball.text: *She meets your eye, and the fear there hardens into rage. She gathers herself.*
Ball.context: NodeContext: Desperately angry and afraid - but determind to attack the goblins and peck their eyes out.

session_synopses.Commentator: This goblin is a commentator on the much-loved goblin sport of chicken-chasing, which involves chasing a chicken (or later, a much larger owlbear) through a set of posts to score a 'chicken-strike'. She's fanatically devoted to the sport, and expects the same dedication from everyone. She'll invite the player to take part, but only if you make a bet.
session_synopses.Ball: This chicken is being used as the 'ball' in a goblin sport. The goblins chase it around an enclosure, trying to make it run between two posts so that they can score a 'goal'. It's exhausted and frightened.

Attack_AssaultCustom.speaker: Dror Ragzlin
Attack_AssaultCustom.text: You defile the Absolute's name. Boys!

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Tell me where I can find a healer.

session_synopses.Attack_AssaultCustom: Goblin king sees player commit a crime and initiates attack.
session_synopses.Dead: The player interrogates Dror Ragzlin's corpse about Z'Rell, Halsin, and Moonrise Towers. His N+1 info means he can be forced to talk even if the player killed him.

node_data.speaker: Brawler Gurd
node_data.text: Oh, bugger off.
node_data.context: NodeContext: "gotta stick to my work" delivered deferentially, 'bugger off' dismissive

session_synopses: A goblin preparing for a raid, at a distance from the party going on elsewhere in the camp. He's trying to keep his head down, getting on with his work.

Goblin.speaker: Brawler Rancer
Goblin.text: Tha's the that of it. Heh!

session_synopses.Goblin: He's super drunk and is talking to himself more than to you.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Bez
node_data.text: If you're headin' down to the spiders, give 'em a tickle. They're real friendly...
node_data.context: NodeContext: Said in a cheeky, sarcastic tone. Making a joke when she's actually terrified of the spiders she's guarding.

session_synopses: This guard is watching over a pit containing two giant spiders. She is afraid of them and says as much to the player (unless player is a drow, who venerate spiders)

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Brand looks good on you. Priestess reckons we should all be marked up before the next raid.
node_data.context: NodeContext: warm - sees us as allies

node_data.speaker: Devout Mrak
node_data.text: Make sure whoever we're stickin' it to knows we're doin' it for the Absolute.
node_data.context: NodeContext: proud

session_synopses: Goblin is recently converted to new religion and eager to head out on a raid.

node_data.speaker: Warrior Clack
node_data.text: If yer close enough to talk with me, then yer too damn close.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Busy sharpening spears, a bit brusque.

session_synopses: Impatient goblin sharpening his spears while guarding a heretical goblin. A bit of an attitude to this one.

TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.speaker: Narrator
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.text: *The goblin appears annoyed. It might be best to leave the prisoner alone.*
TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom.context: InternalNodeContext: Assault - gobs don't know about Den

session_synopses.TortureredAdventurer_AssaultCustom: Crime dialogue when a random goblin sees you hurting or killing Liam.

EyeMurder_AD.speaker: Dror Ragzlin, Erna, GROUP_Goblins, Nightwarden Minthara, Yerle
EyeMurder_AD.text: 'S dead. Spied one too many bowels movin', I expect.
EyeMurder_AD.context: NodeContext: Satisfied contempt - the goblins hated this creepy thing and are glad it's dead

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Crusher
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX : The goblin bends over and kisses the player's foot
DrunkGoblin.context: CinematicNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped InternalNodeContext: Needs to be mocaped

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins cackle as the drunk goblin point out the player kissed his feet

DrunkGoblin.speaker: Sharp-Eye Breg
DrunkGoblin.text: VO_SFX: All surrounding Goblins menacingly cackle as the drunk goblin threatens the player

session_synopses.EyeMurder_AD: A one-time line triggered when a goblin guard spots the dead scrying eye.

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Our blood to fill your oceans, oh blessed BOOOAL! Our bones to build your temple in the deep!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: NodeContext: Fanatic devotion, speaking to the air/altar

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *A wave of pure devotion washes over you - and with every surge, you feel a presence grow in response.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: WORDS, PRIEST. PROMISES. YOUR GOD WANTS PROOF. WANTS BLOOD.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his god form. He should be invisible with some VFXNodeContext: DISMISSIVE, IMPATIENT

SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *These beings are kuo-toa - former mind flayer slaves that manifest their gods through sheer belief.*
CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the playerNodeContext: The priest turns to spot the player

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: YOU! Our Lord of Murder demands sacrifice! You will be an offering for the great god BOOOAL!

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal is the true Lord of Murder. Perhaps I should offer you instead.

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Bhaal...? No... we are... we are faithful to Lord BOOOAL...

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You sense a flicker of doubt - brief, but enough. For an instant, the godly presence falters.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: NO! NO! Stop that!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back to his common form. He is invisible for "NO! NO" and becomes visible for "Stop that!"NodeContext: Furious, panicked - his con is being exposed and he's losing power even as he speaks

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: He's a fabrication. Whatever you created him for, you don't need him.
True

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ARGH! NO! SHUT IT! Shut your rotten mouth!
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in the process of reverting back into his common form. He is invisible for the capitalised parts of this now, but then becomes visible for "Shut your rotten mouth"NodeContext: The lack of faith is literally draining power from him - sulky and furious all in one as he returns to his common form

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Narrator
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: *You feel the presence waver - one moment a god of awesome power, the next... a common redcap.*

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Ah. Bollocks.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and he appears as a redacapNodeContext: Realising the game is up

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Don't do anything hasty, now. The fishfolk got plenty of power - we can share.
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and appears as a common redcapNodeContext: Still annoyed with us but willing to make a deal. Only SLIGHTLY wheedling - redcaps aren't known for negotiating

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Pooldripp the Zealous
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: ... blessed Boooal... what...?

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: BOOOAL
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: Shut it, you!  I'm talking to... my Chosen! Chosen got power - you want power, don't ya?
SpeakWithBOOOAL.context: CinematicNodeContext: BOOOAL is in his common form. He is no longer invisible, and just appears as an ordinary redcapNodeContext: Shouting his high priest down - he wants to seal the deal with us before his idiot followers fully catch on

SpeakWithBOOOAL.speaker: Player
SpeakWithBOOOAL.text: [To priest] Well? Bow before BOOOAL's Chosen!

AD_GodDead.text: BOOOAL! Our Lord has been murdered!
AD_GodDead.context: NodeContext: Dismay, grief - their god has been killed

session_synopses.SpeakWithBOOOAL: The player encounters a group of kuo-toa, humanoid fish beings capable of creating gods just by imagining them. They're overzealous and easily duped, and are currently worshipping a murderous redcap they've mistaken for a god of murder. He's capitalising on the situation and very much enjoying the incredible power with which he's been invested. In this dialogue, we can deal with him as this great inscrutable power, or see through the situation and expose / do a deal with him. In all cases he's brash, offensive and generally gross.The all cap lines are BOOOAL in his fully powerful form.When we suddenly rever to lower caps, it's when we've forced him into his 'common' form.BOOOAL = Boo-AHHL (almost guttural)Kuo-Toa = Koo-oh-TO-ah
session_synopses.AD_FishChanting: Fanatical chanting at the altar of a murder god, a crowd heard from afar rather than direct dialogue. This dialog has no lines that are spoken by the character - the lines are intended to be subtitles for the SFX
session_synopses.AD_GodDead: The Kuo-toa have found their god dead.

session_synopses.Spider04: Followup dialogue with spider after they attack and kill Lur Xanta

session_synopses.AD_BeckonPlayer: An amulet calls out to the player amid the rocks surrounded by lava in Grymforge.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *As you look at the skeletons, you realise they are all clad in the same dark armour.*

Looted_Solo.speaker: Player
Looted_Solo.text: Bow down and inspect the corpses more closely.

Looted_Solo.speaker: Narrator
Looted_Solo.text: *You see nothing special - just torn and faded velvet tunics.*

session_synopses.Looted_Solo: Players find remains of Dark Justiciars in the Ketheric City and wonder what might have happened to them and what kind of armor are they wearing.

DisguisedJournal.speaker: Narrator
DisguisedJournal.text: *Mad supposition, questionable diagrams, and many gleeful references to 'tentacles'. Not an overly academic text.*
DisguisedJournal.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and studies the text before them

session_synopses.DisguisedJournal: This book is recovered from the body of Xargrim, a wizard searching for the Adamantine Forge. It contains instructions on how to operate the forge, but is disguised as a rather smutty "nature" textbook.Flumph = FLUMF.

AtPier_02.speaker: Morghal
AtPier_02.text: You got grit, I'll give you that much.

session_synopses.AtPier_02: Gruff duergar guard standing watch ovre the entrance to Ketheric City.

node_data.speaker: Noxious Myconid
node_data.text: ((*cleanse the Circle. the Circle cleansed*))

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speaks with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Let me be. I've got to get Beldron out of there!

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Get Beldron out of there. Please.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: One-liner dialog in Ketheric City for a gnome working on the cave-in.

node_data.speaker: Welso
node_data.text: Get Meerna out of there. I'll do anything.

Saved.speaker: Welso
Saved.text: You've done so much, I hate asking for more. But you see more slavers? Burn them, skin them - make them hurt.

session_synopses: 'Welso's sister is trapped behind the rubble. He is panicked and scared - frantically trying to dig her out.
session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome worker on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player.

PAD_OnPlatform2.speaker: Player
PAD_OnPlatform2.text: Platform's covered in rust - must be older than bonedust.

session_synopses.PAD_OnPlatform2: The player steps on a rusted platform in Grymforge suspended by four chains. (An elevator, really.)

006.speaker: Petrified Drow
006.text: By Lolth... of course. Dhourn - damn.
006.context: NodeContext: Doorn, 'oo' like in 'boot'. He realizes he's here for Dhourn, then realizes he's dead

006.speaker: Petrified Drow
006.text: Rest up. Go home. If I still have a home.

session_synopses.CINE_SpectatorReveal: This is a Combat Cutscene Dialog. A spectator rises from a chasm.
session_synopses.Dead_Wizard: SwD with Dhourn (leader of the petrified Drow).You can learn from this dialog about:- Forge- Memory Crystal and Activation Word for it;- Xagrism (one of his frenemies)
session_synopses.006: This drow was petrified by a spectator. He's a bit cheekier than the others, likeable and chill.Now he is unpetrified.Worries about his companions and the group's leader - the wizard.Leave after a long rest.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *The myconid cloaks you in dream: duergar spore servants shambling toward you in unison.*

session_synopses: Myconid one-liner. Speakes with hivemind/mysterious voice.

node_data.speaker: Stone Guard Kur
node_data.text: Time you freed Nere. That drow head needs crackin'.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standing guard. He is seated with the duergar elder most of the time.

01.speaker: Danna
01.text: Shit. You better grab what you can, before the worms get to the corpses.

02.speaker: Mirthis
02.text: Drugnin' Nere - glad you offed him. Ain't no one divides the clan and lives to tell the tale.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: What's this? Got ourselves an infiltrator?

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: You move pretty quietly. Not quietly enough for my liking, though.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Too loud, sun-scum. Heard you stumbling. Can hear you blinking.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A low growl

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Noise gets you eaten down here. Reckon I'll hush you, before something hungry comes along.
node_data.context: NodeContext: A grim statement of fact. He intends to kill you rather than let you bumble around.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His gnarled fist grips an axe.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand doesn't need to have attention drawn to it.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *His fist grips an axe. On his gnarled, grey skin, you see the Absolute's brand.*
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Grips his weapon threateningly. Absolute brand visible if possible (or just leave it to the narrator)

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Stand down. I am a True Soul.
True

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: ... that's right. You are a True Soul.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Weapon lowered a littleNodeContext: Weapon lowered a little

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Not like me to overlook one of the Absolute's Chosen. Let myself get distracted...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Looks in the direction of this quarry - the myconid circle/injured gnome - with contemplation

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Won't happen again.
node_data.context: NodeContext: The closest thing to an apology that Gekh can manage.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Anyway. The hunt's not over yet.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: What hunt? Explain yourself.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Tracking a runaway slave - deep gnome. Stole boots from my sergeant.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'm to kill the runaway - but she's holed up with myconids.
node_data.context: NodeContext: My-con-ids. Spits out the word with some venom - we'll soon learn the myconids killed some of his squad.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Can't get past those rotflowers. They get in your head, make you see things. Half my squad jumped off a cliff, laughing.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Referring to psychic attacks by sentient mushrooms. Not the sort of fight he's used to.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I'll see what can be done - but I expect a reward.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Serving the Absolute ought to be reward enough. But no matter...
node_data.context: NodeContext: The player's request for a reward raises his eyebrow, but he lets it slide.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: Sergeant Thrinn will cough up big to hear that slave's got her comeuppance.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: The stolen boots will do nicely as proof. And a True Soul like yerself could name their prize then, I reckon.

node_data.speaker: Gekh Coal
node_data.text: I'll keep watch here. Gnome might make a run for it.

Squad_Sniper.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Sniper.text: If you need attention, see Gekh.

Henchmen_Surprised.text: What...? Gekh! Got someone sneaking up on us!
Henchmen_Surprised.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player sneaking.NodeContext: Raising the alarm. Doesn't need to be shouted - more of an urgent hiss

Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.speaker: Holvik
Squad_Ranged_AD_CombatTurn.text: I will split your corpse and roast the pieces!

session_synopses: A duergar scout sent by his superior to track down an escaped deep gnome slave and retrieve the valuable Boots of Speed that she stole from the scout's superior. His progress has been hampered as the escapee his hiding amongst some myconids - fungal creatures with telepathic powers. He confronts the player, who may convince him they aren't a threat. They may be able to assist him agains the runaway and myconids, or could betray him, In general, Gekh is a gruff, vicious type. If the player convinces him that they're his superior (a true soul, for instance) he'll show a little more deference.
session_synopses.Squad_Sniper: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.
session_synopses.Henchmen_Surprised: An alternate intro to the Gekh Coal scene, where the player manages to sneak up on Gekh's henchmen before Gekh himself managed to confront the player. They call for his attention.
session_synopses.Squad_Wizard: A duergar, part of the cult of the Absolute. He and his brethren are part of a squad sent to track down an escaped deep gnome prisoner from their camp in the Underdark.

session_synopses.AD_Combat_AnimatingSpores_03: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is using Animating Spores spell.
session_synopses.AD_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid sovereign is taking his turn.

PAD_Reaction.speaker: Player
PAD_Reaction.context: NodeContext: Facing off against a large monster that's just burst out of the ground. Said with focus and determination, rather than fear.

session_synopses.PAD_Reaction: The bulette appears for a second time in the Underdark and is going to attack the players. Said with focus and determination rather than fear.

Saved.speaker: Beldron
Saved.text: Never thought I'd owe a bunch o' mushrooms my life. Only wish the rest of my people were here.

session_synopses.Saved: Dialog for gnome foreman on the other side of the ebon lake after they were saved by player. Mentions the other gnomes being kept at moonrise towers.

CINE_HammerStrike.text: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
CINE_HammerStrike.context: CinematicNodeContext: As the player character watches, the forge hammer descends and crashes into the dais below with a loud clang and a flash of sparks. It then rises back into its original position.
