session_synopses.CINE_HammerStrike: A party member pulled the lever that activates the hammer strike.NOTES:- To be replaced by combat cams.- For now, we're ignoring the scenario where the lever was activated some other way than using it.

AD_GaleEntrance.speaker: Gale
AD_GaleEntrance.text: A wizard's tower is his sanctum, a private place for research and respite. But as this wizard's not home - I say we take a peek.
AD_GaleEntrance.context: NodeContext: At first solemn/reverential. Then delighted you're about to snoop around.

AD_GalePowerRestored.speaker: Gale
AD_GalePowerRestored.text: Ingenious use of the magic in the tower's floral core. Though not ingenius enough to outsmart Gale of Waterdeep.
AD_GalePowerRestored.context: NodeContext: His hypothesis proved correct. Respecting the ingenuity, but smug that he/the party was able to disable it

session_synopses.AD_GaleEntrance: Gale enters the Arcane Tower for the first time
session_synopses.AD_GalePowerRestored: The Arcane Tower has been powered again.
session_synopses.CINE_PowerCutscene: This is a pure cutscene cinematic dialog. After player activates the main generator in Arcane Tower by placing a Sussur Flower in it, there should be a camera flyover showing how all the tower teleport platforms activate, lights turn on, etc.This dialog can be easily triggered from console with    SetGlobalOsirisFlag UND_ArcaneTower_MainPowerOn

PAD_InteractingWithOrb.speaker: Player
PAD_InteractingWithOrb.text: Something's off. Pure shadow - around me, inside me.

session_synopses.PAD_InteractingWithOrb: The character voicing feeling the presence of Shar when interacting with a Sharran artefact used to gain Darkvision.

PAD_SharTempleVista.speaker: Shadowheart
PAD_SharTempleVista.text: That almost looks like... no, it couldn't be, surely...
PAD_SharTempleVista.context: NodeContext: Awe/hesitation, as if doubting what she's seeing in the distance. Has not let the player know she is a shar worshipper.

session_synopses.PAD_SharTempleVista: Shadowheart notices the Shar Temple in the Underdark

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: ((*I will not cross. painful memories beyond*))

BroodingSovereign_Raft.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Raft.text: Don't worry, we'll stay here for now.

session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Raft: Glut says he cannot follow you across the lake, and must remain on shore.

CaveIn.speaker: Skickpit
CaveIn.text: You've done more than I'd have hoped for. I should never have doubted.

session_synopses.CaveIn: Elevator gnome one-liner if you sent him to be with the others after the mutiny.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *The gnome was under the protection of the myconid circle. They will see you answer for violating it.*

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Player
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: If you cared so much, you'd have cured her already.

InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.speaker: Narrator
InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder.text: *It is not for you to judge the circle - but for the circle to judge you.*

session_synopses.InjuredGnome_ThullaMurder: Myconid responses to seeing Thulla - the injured gnome - being killed through the dialog.

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *A slender drow blade impales the stone before you, keeping a silent vigil.*

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise your goddess' rite - a warrior's sacrifice. Only blood, freely given, will honour the fallen.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: Player discovers an improvised shrine to a dead drow warrior. There's a helmet resting on a sword that's been rammed into a stone. You can take the helmet, but you'll need to think of another way to get the sword free.

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: *A faint voice echoes in your mind.*
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mindmeld: Nere is calling out to player from a distance

Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.text: I sense you, True Soul... come to me, come to Nere... the poison spreads.
Mindmeld_LeavingRegion.context: NodeContext: Voice goes in and out, as if the connection is weak

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *As you near the rubble, a fragmented voice clutches at your mind.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nere starting to Mindmeld with the player

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.context: NodeContext: The original line is 'A True Soul? This is Nere. Tell those Imbiciles to hurry up! I am choking on poison.' Should be recorded normally, and effects should be added later to make it sound like the voice is fading in and out.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: Finally! You must clear... rubble. Filling... poison!

Mindmeld.speaker: Player
Mindmeld.text: Stay still. I'll do what I can.

Mindmeld.speaker: Nere
Mindmeld.text: ...it quick or... head! Careful... mercs... on the edge...

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *The view through Nere's eyes is a blur. You only make out a bit of rubble and few moving figures.*
Mindmeld.context: CinematicNodeContext: View from Nere's persepective Vision blurred and

Mindmeld.speaker: Narrator
Mindmeld.text: *You sense Nere's frustration, tinged with rage, as the connection fades.*

node_data.speaker: Nere
node_data.text: Why are you still here? Go!

session_synopses.Mindmeld_LeavingRegion: When trying to leave Grymforge before freeing Nere, you get a mindmeld from Nere, warning that he will die if you leave. Nere is not physically present in scene - only his voice is heard.
session_synopses.Mindmeld: A mindmeld with a True Soul through a brick wall - the connection is unstable because of this, and we do not hear everything the True Soul says.
session_synopses: Dialogue with Nere after you fought the duergar with him and he sent you away either to find help in Moonrise or simply to leave him alone. His cold malice and zealotry should shine through.

node_data.speaker: Elder Brithvar
node_data.text: I got big plans for us. Ain't no one stopping Clan Flameshade.

session_synopses: Leader of the Merceneries-to-be-mutineers. An elder mind-master with psionic sensitivity. You can follow up with him about the quest he gave you earlier.

node_data.speaker: Drar
node_data.text: Nothing you can do up here. So you can get down by yourself, or I can give you a nice push.

session_synopses: Duergar raider who is standign guard, loyal to The Absolute.

session_synopses.Companion: Short dialogues with this character after you have your main dialogue with him. He doesn't talk much, hasn't been the same since a rock slide.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: At ease. Without magic, things feel so peaceful.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.text: *A quiet contentment settles in your chest. Perhaps a life without power would not be so terrible.*

session_synopses.IVB_Aura_Sorcerer: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.

Boat.speaker: Player
Boat.text: Continue your journey across the lake.
Boat.context: InternalNodeContext: Sailing to the camp after the lake fight

Boat.text:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player stays the course, to the Fortress
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]
Boat.context:
CinematicNodeContext: ~The player stays the course, to the Fortress
~[EA: Treat this like it's propelled by sails, there is not rowing or special animations for this]

DuergarBoatAtCamp.speaker: Narrator
DuergarBoatAtCamp.text: *The boat floats in the murky waters.*
DuergarBoatAtCamp.context: CinematicNodeContext: Boat floating in the water

session_synopses.Boat: Raft dialogue. The player can decide either to sail somewhere or to walk away from the raft.
session_synopses.DuergarBoatAtCamp: Dialogue when clciking boat in Grymforge to reach the other side of the lake. Player can cross or stay.

node_data.speaker: Jerris
node_data.text: One wrong move, and you're goin' in the lake.

session_synopses: Possible dialog during the Lake Encounter (if the player jumps on another raft when another player is in dialog)

SurvivalCheck_PAD.speaker: Player
SurvivalCheck_PAD.text: What happened here? It's hard to make any sense of this mess.

session_synopses.SurvivalCheck_PAD: The player identifies Thulla's tracks to be that of an escaping gnome if they pass a survival check

001.speaker: Narrator
001.text: *Alcohol - an odd vice for duergar, prone to triggering ancestral memories of brutal illithid enslavement.*

session_synopses.001: One-liner for duergar thug. He tells you to leave after speaking previously. You get a passive skill check that may relate how alcohol can cause bad memories for duergar, and then ask about it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: You're going up there? You've either got iron guts - or one of those Moonlanterns.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: One of Nere's magic lamps. You won't last without one.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Skickpit
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: The death-dark's clogged the top-land, clear to Moonrise Towers. Only a Moonlantern dispels it.

ElevatorWarningGnome.speaker: Player
ElevatorWarningGnome.text: Thanks for sharing. I'll keep it in mind.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Well I'll be ploughed sideways - we got a welcoming party.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives. Greymon on a boat.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: You shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Greymon. Projected from the boat. Morgha is talking to him from the shore.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: Spit it out. Sergeant finally choked on True Soul Nere's prick?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Morghal, from the docking boat.NodeContext: Projected voice

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Drugh no. The Twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, his party and Greymon/Orgarth get off the boat.NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

Checkpoint.speaker: Corsair Greymon
Checkpoint.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: That's the trouble - he's got the gold on him. Sergeant's arm is falling off with all the gnome slaves she's been beating.
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down after line is spoken.

Checkpoint.speaker: Morghal
Checkpoint.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?
Checkpoint.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Greymon, looking at player

Checkpoint.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint.text: Call me 'slave' again, and I'll feed you your own stomach.

Rothe_01.speaker: Deep Rothé Calf
Rothe_01.context: NodeContext: Sad. Very young and frail sounding.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: Hold up, jargh. Y-you ain't just walking away.
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Aggressive in their words, but something hesitant. They're afraid of you, they just don't want to show it.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You got Brithvar chopped - and I still haven't seen a damned coin for my trouble.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: You owe - what's the word? Restitution.  ([6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.text: That, or - or I add your corpse to the heap. Which is it?

RebelsExtort.speaker: Narrator
RebelsExtort.text: *You sense hesitation. The duergar talks tough, but fears you.*

RebelsExtort.speaker: Player
RebelsExtort.text: You've got this backwards. You keep your head, and I pay you nothing.

RebelsExtort.speaker: Kirgrath
RebelsExtort.context: NodeContext: Zavagh! is a battle cry. za-VAHG!

Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.speaker: Kirgrath
Mutineers_GroupFollowUp.text: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.

Mutineers_FollowUp.speaker: Elder Brithvar
Mutineers_FollowUp.text: Sschindylryn's shithouse - you see it? Cock-stench had a wriggler in his skull. All the more reason to clear out.

session_synopses.ElevatorWarningGnome: Player clicks on elevator leading to the shadow-cursed lands. Nearby gnome  butts in to let you know you don't look like you're in any shape to go up there. The land is cursed, and you need a moonlantern. Plays only once.
session_synopses.Checkpoint: After you sail to the other side of the Darklake, two duergar greet you. If Greymon is with you, he confirms you are a True Soul - as long as you don't mention the boots. Otherwise, the player is revealed as a True Soul through a mindmeld-type moment.there. Morghal tells you that another True Soul, Nere, is trapped above, then asks for a bribe to let you in.
session_synopses.Mutineers: Two duergar consider how their fellow duergar have fallen for this new cult that showed up. You can inspire in them a mutiny. If you do, they'll join you when you free Nere (UND_TheDrowNere_Mutiny).Brithvar is a Mind Master, a duergar with psionic skills. He wears a strange mask.
session_synopses.Rothe_03: The rothe is trying to sleep while her fellow rothe talk. She is tried from a long day's work and knows there is little time to sleep before her next shift.
session_synopses.Rothe_01: This younger rothe is trying to rest, but is afraid from the older one's story.
session_synopses.RebelsExtort: In this dialogue, you have killed Nere without doing the duergar mutineers quest. As a result, they want you to pay for the trouble you've caused. You can give them money, persuade them to let you live, or attack.
session_synopses.Mutineers_GroupFollowUp: The mutinous duergar is dead, so another takes his place to tells you they are moving on
session_synopses.Mutineers_FollowUp: The mutinous duergar tells the player what comes next for them: an assault on Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Stop, STOP!
node_data.context: NodeContext: In a loud, panicked whisper.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Bibberbang!
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Motions to the mushrooms surrounding him, then mimes 'blowing up'.NodeContext: A warning of nearby danger

node_data.text: True

node_data.speaker: Narrator
node_data.text: *You recognise the name - bibberbang, a mushroom that releases dangerous spores. Highly flammable.*

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Turn away.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Wait! Please, hear me out!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Scroll - escape! My bag! Please. I've dropped it - somewhere!
node_data.context: NodeContext: Urgent. He's basically standing in the middle of a mine field of sorts.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Hold up a scroll of Misty Step.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: Yes! That's - yes!

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Scrolls don't come cheap, you know.

node_data.speaker: Baelen Bonecloak
node_data.text: I'll give you what I have if you get me out of here - please!

session_synopses: Baelan, a mushroom hunter,  is surrounded by dangeous Bibberbang mushrooms. He was trying to get to the Noblestalk mushroom, but one of the stone ledges collapsed underneath him and he fell down. His partner Derryth (Dwarven Alchemist) is in the Myconid Village. Important: Baelan seems to have trouble keeping his train of thought - he loses track of his responses, changes the subject and generally seems out of sorts at times. Later, it will be confirmed that he's been suffering from a dementia-like condition for some years now.

HiddenGnome.speaker: Philomeen
HiddenGnome.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: He hid from the Hells' forces - but they still got to him.

session_synopses.HiddenGnome: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
session_synopses.PAD: Players find the journal in the Panic Room after identifying the Merregon Masks. This belonged to a Dark Justiciar who hid from the orthon when it rampaged, and was trapped when rubble fell.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: Did you have any allies nearby?

session_synopses.BottomFairyRingActivationCinematic: Cinematic dialog. Shows the activation process for a Fairy Ring.Before the dialogue: the player approaches an active (has vfx) fariy mushroom ring. The dialogue starts. The camera shows the ring and the player (or only the ring) and then rotats and looks down, at another fairy mushroom ring which is inactive, it has no vfx. The VFX activates for the bottom ring, emphasizing activation. End of the cinematic.
session_synopses.Dead: Dead drow who tried to climb to the secret fairy rings near the Hag's lair. He was using his backpack to check the the ledges (mushrooms) that he was using to climb, but the platforms have a weight limit, which lead to his demise.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Incredible. Every rock, every jewel tells a story.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The most interesting secrets are alway lurking just under the surface.

session_synopses.PAD: Players can talk to Stonemason Kith to obtain some info on the city. The following VB is a reaction to the knowledge acquired in that dialog. For specifics, see UND_DuergarRebelMason_01.This will be anchored on the character who left the dialog but this is mostly reacting to an info dump, so all characters can be opinionated.

Dead.speaker: Player
Dead.text: What were you doing in the ruins?

session_synopses.Dead: An SwD dialog for the Duergar Leader. She could be dead either because of player, Nere (her superior) or gnomes.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: 'Less you're here to kick some stiffs lake-side, I suggest you bugger off.
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera first pans acros the field of dead, then focuses on the duergar

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Viss
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: Spit on the groundNodeContext: He spits on the ground, glowering.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Player
CorpseDisposers.text: I hope you're checking them for loot first?

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: You gotta be kidding. These trash don't have nothing on 'em but rocks.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.text: Done gawking? Lend a hand or get gone.

CorpseDisposers.speaker: Brathwen
CorpseDisposers.context: CinematicNodeContext: The pushing of the corpse into the lake appears to be handled systemnically, so the camera can pan out and let animation take over.

session_synopses.CorpseDisposers: Two grouchy duergar, one a talker and one who somewhat mimics/ repeats what his partner says, are responsible for dumping dead gnome bodies into the lake. You can convince them to let you loot the bodies.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Dry land. My guts'll stop churning now.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: The boat arrives and the captain and players disembark.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Greymon, you shithead - time you showed up. We got trouble.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Spit it up, Morghal. Or you busy choking on that True Soul Nere's prick with Thrinn?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Drugh no. The twat-Soul caused a rockfall. Trapped tighter than a ring on a fat finger.
CampIntro.context: NodeContext: DRUGH NO = FUCK NO. "Droog" like 'good', not 'food'.

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: You're shitting me. He pay up?

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: That's the trouble - he got the gold on him. Thrinn's arm's falling off what with the gnome slaves she been beating.
CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal peers at player and looks them up and down.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Who's the hoon, Greymon - another slave for the dig?

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Did I hear right? You keep gnomes as slaves?

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: Easy to feed, fat thumbs for digging. Won't find none better.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: But your type got their uses. Let's get those meat-paws to work.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: I am a True Soul. You will treat me with honour.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Your Twat-Soul chum owes us a load of coin. You want in? Pay the toll.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: I call it the True Soul special.
CampIntro.context: CinematicNodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.NodeContext: Morghal smiles creepily.

CampIntro.speaker: Player
CampIntro.text: Fine - take this. Consider it a goodwill gesture. |XXX gold|

CampIntro.speaker: Corsair Greymon
CampIntro.text: I'll be shagged to Shanatar. Shit's looking up.

CampIntro.speaker: Morghal
CampIntro.text: Now go on, sergeant's above. Can't miss her - just follow the screams.

session_synopses.CampIntro: Another duergar greets you on the other side of the lake after sailingthere with captain Greymon.Both duergar are surly, but Morghal in particular. She is suspicious of Absolutists, but happy to take their coin. She should be gruff, and absolutely not listless. She tells you that Nere is trapped above.

session_synopses.01: Drow hang from the bridge. PAD as we see them - “Duergar rarely stand up to drow so boldly.”One duergar is here, patrolling with a crossbow. He tells us he’s keeping watch over the lake - these drow were trying to infiltrate the settlement, and more may come.

session_synopses.02: A duergar guard, posted above the docks, watching the lake.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.
CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.
Guard_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

Guard_001.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
Guard_001.text: I almost feel bad about this.
Guard_001.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

Guard_001.speaker: Player
Guard_001.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: Not enough caning for my tastes, but you got the job done.
CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.
RubbleAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Skarjall takes out his weapon and enters combat stance.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Herdmaster Skarjall
RubbleAttack.text: I almost feel bad about this.
RubbleAttack.context: CinematicNodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.NodeContext: Evil smile - snarling voice.

RubbleAttack.speaker: Player
RubbleAttack.text: You'll be feeling even worse in a moment.

session_synopses.Guard_001: The taskmaster is another cruel duergar. He is whipping several pack animals to clear out some rubble, but his arm is tired and asks you to step in. You might discover they want the rubble cleared because a valuable forge can be found behind it. If you convince the beasts to break through, he attacks you because he doesn't want to share the wealth.
session_synopses.RubbleAttack: Duergar dialog that happens if the player attacks / destroys the wall  by fearful rothe.

PAD_FoundRune.speaker: Player
PAD_FoundRune.text: This is a Harper rune. There must be a stockpile nearby.

PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.speaker: Player
PAD_KnowStashIsHidden.text: Left out in plain sight like that? No - the Harpers are too smart for that.

session_synopses.PAD_FoundRune: Party discovers a strange marking. They may or may not recognise it as a Harper symbol.
session_synopses.PAD_KnowStashIsHidden: Note: this PAD follows directly from either RecogniseStashLocation or FoundRune. See Kevin V. with any questions, I know it is a bit weird.--------When the player recognises that the Harper rune in Ketheric City is marking a hidden stash, they make an Investigation check. On success, they realise that the Harpers would be smart enough not to leave their stash in plain sight - the goal of this hint is to deter the player from interacting with the mimics in the area and to instead look around for a hidden stash somewhere

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Seems the 'shrooms are letting in more people every day.
DwarvenAlchemist.context: NodeContext: Not friendly. She's got a real squint in her eye taking you in.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: You see a fella on his own on your way in? Dwarf. Baelen's his name.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: Knock yourself out. But don't come begging for coin if you find him.

DwarvenAlchemist.speaker: Derryth Bonecloak
DwarvenAlchemist.text: If you try to ransom him to me, you'll find yourself skint and stuck with a fat old lout.

AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.speaker: Restless Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat.text: ((*the disease still festers. I will cut it out*))

VB_GlutDead_1P.speaker: Player
VB_GlutDead_1P.text: The usurper is dead. So much for 'Circle Glut'.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You are swallowed by a chorus of turbulent music. Through one creature sing many voices: the harmony of an entire collective.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Restless Myconid
CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*Sovereign. they have come. they are here*))

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The choir fades. A single melody rises above the others, brassy and commanding.*

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *You see a vision: your lifeless body, wrapped in fungal tendrils. The sovereign is threatening you.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if seeing the vision in their head.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Player
CheckpointGuard_000.text: I am a traveller seeking adventure.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Fungal roots weave through your mind, seeking your true intent.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes as if to see the vision.

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *Then the sovereign drones a new melody, cautious but welcoming.*
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range.

CheckpointGuard_000.text: ((*descend to me. let us speak in flesh*))
CheckpointGuard_000.context: CinematicNodeContext: Overhead view, as sovereign is not in sight range. (Custom cameras required)

CheckpointGuard_000.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuard_000.text: *The persistent music coaxes you forward. The sovereign expects you.*

DeepRothe.speaker: Deep Rothé
DeepRothe.text: Should leave here before master gets lost again.
DeepRothe.context: NodeContext: SwA line. A simple beast of burden is pleased. His master, Baelen, has returned.

AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.speaker: Noxious Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat.text: ((*you will fall. and in death, we will raise you*))

SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.speaker: Blurg
SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar.text: I must complete this study. Entertain yourself elsewhere.

ServantHookHorror_01.speaker: Narrator
ServantHookHorror_01.text: *The monstrosity doesn't seem to notice you.*

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*the tumour is excised. the duergar are dead*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*here, I break ground. from the dark will a mighty Circle rise. my song will fill the Grotto!*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*death-doer - the Grotto may sustain but one Sovereign. in the Age of Glut...*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*...there may be no Spaw. eliminate the other Sovereign*))

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign.text: Why not. Spaw's time is done.

BroodingSovereign.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign.text: ((*come, then. bring me to Spaw and I will sing its doom*))

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *Fungus and mould glaze the servant's face and body. Through music and vision, the sovereign reveals its origins.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *You see a frothing duergar, axe drawn, crazed by bloodlust, bearing down on a young myconid.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *The frightened myconid circle conjures mildewed vines. They encircle and transform the duergar.*

ServantDuergar1.speaker: Narrator
ServantDuergar1.text: *It now belongs to the circle. It will obey the sovereign.*

AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat.text: ((*the sickness can't be left to fester*))

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Narrator
RapportSpores_Alone.text: *Your mind is a canyon, and the words echo from every crevasse.*

RapportSpores_Alone.speaker: Player
RapportSpores_Alone.text: I don't know who you are, but you're not welcome in my head.

AD_Myconid_005_Combat.speaker: Mossy Myconid
AD_Myconid_005_Combat.text: ((*cut the blight away. watch it wither*))

MushroomField_Warning.speaker: Restless Myconid
MushroomField_Warning.text: ((*after the light comes the bang. step away. step away*))

DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.speaker: Narrator
DirectToSovereign_HookHorror.text: *The monstrosity stares blankly. The voice that echoes within you belongs not to it, but the sovereign.*
((*leave this one. come to me. we must speak*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*no - no. I feel the faerzress... fading...*))

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Narrator
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: *You recall the faerzress - the energy of the Underdark. The myconid might die if isolated from it.*

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Player
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: Dismiss the myconid and move forward.

BroodingSovereign_Leave.speaker: Sovereign Glut
BroodingSovereign_Leave.text: ((*I will refresh myself near Spaw's Circle*))

session_synopses.DwarvenAlchemist:
Derryth is a dwarven alchemist visiting the underdark from Baldur's Gate. She runs a shop in the city with Baelen, her business partner. They've come to the underdark in search of a very valuable mushroom - noblestalk. When the player arrived, she was tending to an injured gnome.
Derryth is a bit gruff - she's a healer, but her bedside manner leaves a lot to be desired. She's also a very shrewd businessperson. She's in the underdark to get rich first and foremost.
She treats her business partner (Baelen) like he's an idiot, and pretends not to care about him, but in reality he is the most important person to her in the world.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_002_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_001: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.VB_GlutDead_1P: Players refuse to kill Sovereign Spawn on Sovereign Glut's behalf. Glut has attacked the players and is now dead. The party comments afterwards.
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_000: You come upon the myconid guards. They warn the sovereign of your presence telepathically, and it begins to speak to you. This should be creepy, hallucinatory.
session_synopses.DeepRothe: A Deep Rothe that belongs to Derryth and Baelen Bonecloak. A beast of burden with a simple Speak with Animals dialogue. There's some reactivity depending on whether Baelen has returned to the bonecloak camp or not, and if Baelen recovered his senses by eating the noblestalk mushroom. The animal's observations reinforce that Baelen has been more amiable and gentle since his mind began to slip, and his recovery is not seen as a good thing by all.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.SocietyOfBrilliance_Scholar: The player meets Blurg, a hobgoblin (deep orc) member of the Society of Brilliance, a group of intelligent, neutral monsters working to improve the Underdark. He talks about his research and, if the tadpole is mentioned, brings his mind flayer friend Omeluum to talk to the player. The player can either agree to the mind flayer's help or attack.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_004_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.ServantHookHorror_01: You interact with a hook horror servant belonging to the myconids.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign:
A sovereign myconid we call the brooding sovereign has been displaced to this myconid circle, after the duergar attackes his home. He would like to join you as you cleanse the area of duergar as a means of getting revenge - supposedly.

 The top block: The borroding myconid is with the other myconids. You can recruit it.

The middle block: You have killed the lone duergar. the myconid now wants you to kill all the duergars.

 Next block: you have killed all the duergars; now it wants you to kill the sovereign
. 
Final block: you have killed the sovereign and it rewards you. 

This myconid does not speak with the same hive mind voice of the others. He should sound creepy, like FART in Rick and Morty, with a SLIGHT undercurrent of menace.

 As the quest moves on, he gets more and more creepy and angry,
session_synopses.CheckpointGuard_004: Individual myconid responds with one-liner after you have gained access to the myconid circle. Hallucinogenic delivery.
session_synopses.ServantDuergar1: Player tries speaking with an enthralled duergar. Duergar players get an option to go hostile afterwards.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_003_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.RapportSpores_Alone:
Non has met: Triggers if the player is alone when first hearing the myconid circle's collective voice.

Hasmet: Occurs second time, regardless of how mnay players are in party. Player hears a strange voice, and has a reaction to it. Second time: Tries to respond to it.
session_synopses.AD_Myconid_005_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.AD_CheckpointGuard_000_Combat: One-shot combat AD to play when the myconid is taking their turn.
session_synopses.MushroomField_Warning: Myconid warns you that mushrooms explode if you get too close.
session_synopses.InjuredGnome_SporeServant: Player speaks with Thulla - the injured gnome, - after she dies from duergar poison and is resurrected by the myconids as a spore servant.
session_synopses.DirectToSovereign_HookHorror: If you speak to a myconid after the guards speak to you but you have not yet spoken to the sovereign, his voice will speak through them.
session_synopses.BroodingSovereign_Leave: You try to leave the underdark with your myconid companion, and he's having none of it.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Well. You... did it!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I shouldn't be surprised, considering our history. And yet...

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I did. But not out of the kindness of my heart.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I have no coin, but the foreman will be happy to provide.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Nothing good happens in the Underdark.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I don't know if you heard, but some of the Ironhand Gnomes - my friend Wulbren among them - have been taken prisoner in Moonrise Towers.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: I know someone of your background would fit right in in that heart of horrors, but for others of us it's quite a frightening prospect.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And so... to Moonrise Towers I go.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Resolute but actually pretty frightened.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Do you know what Wulbren and the others were doing down here?

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: No.
False

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Farewell, Barcus - I wish you luck with your search.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Won't be needing it, thank you!

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: Good bye, my misery's favourite companion.

node_data.speaker: Barcus Wroot
node_data.text: And, erm, well... thank you.

session_synopses: If you saved Barcus from the windmill, you can meet him again in the underdark. He's been captured once again - this time by a band of duergar (who follow the Absolute, same as the goblins did previously). If you get rid of his captors, you can talk to him some more about his next steps. He's still keen on saving his friend, Wulbren.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: I heard a gnome escaped. Tell me what you know.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No, no... there must be some mistake. Right, Lunkbug?

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Damn it, Laridda. We've lost enough of us. I'm not losing Beldron, too.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to Laridda.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Hear me out - our friends are trapped in the cave-in. And I know a way to get them out.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda shakes her head at Lunkbug, warning him not to say anything. Lunkbug ignores her and turns to you.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: Bug, please. True Soul Nere will - you know what he'll do.
node_data.context: NodeContext: Pleading for her friend not to tell.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: That sounds like quite the drama. I can't wait to watch.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: What? No. Lunkbug, you can't.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To LunkbugNodeContext: Pleading with Lunkbug not to say anything.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: I've... I've got no choice, Laridda. We have to chance it.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: A few days back, there was a... a scene. Our friend Philomeen, she's a sapper. Set off a blast and ran off.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To player

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: We set a spot for hiding if someone found trouble. I'll mark your map.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: If Philomeen made it, you'll find her there. She'll have the stuff to blow that tunnel wide open and get Beldron and the rest out.

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Excellent. I can add Philomeen's head to my collection.

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: No! I told you, Bug.

node_data.speaker: Lunkbug
node_data.text: Laridda - I...
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To Laridda

node_data.speaker: Apprentice Laridda
node_data.text: You better not harm a damned hair on her head.
node_data.context: CinematicNodeContext: To playerNodeContext: Sad more than angry.

session_synopses: Gnome slaves Laridda and lunkbug are in a bad state. Lunkbug's lover is trapped behind the wreckage, and Laridda's lover has run off with smokepowder they could use to blast him free - but this could cause problems with their slavers. The player can convince them to tell you where the smokepowder is.This should be a super stressful and anxious conversation.

session_synopses.WolfPens_AD_WorgOutsideCage: AD which is played when the worgs are outside the cage

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: How you doing, pal? Looking for some odds and ends? I've scavenged all sorts.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly, like a cheeky bloke at a market selling stolen goods

node_data.speaker: Glomp the looter
node_data.text: Didn't expect to see you grubbing around here in the muck and the leftovers.
node_data.context: NodeContext: friendly

node_data.speaker: Player
node_data.text: Leave.

session_synopses: After Goblin Hunt Celebration night and persuading Minthara to spare their lives, player can observe Goblin camp being empty with only one goblin trader looting what's rest in the Festivities area.This is that goblin's dialog.

AD_Guard_004_TakingTurn_Combat.speaker: Tracker Rindle
AD_Guard_004_TakingTurn_Combat.context: NodeContext: Vicously, about to attack. Bit of a taunt

session_synopses.AD_DarkUrge: Dark Urge approaches the Roasting Dwarf

HalsinDiedBearform.speaker: Narrator
HalsinDiedBearform.text: *The corpse before you is no longer that of a bear, but an elf - albeit a large one. Curious.*

session_synopses.HalsinDiedBearform: If Halsin is killed in bear form in the Wolf Pens and the party knew about Halsin, the companions comment on the fact that the large dead elf who can turn in to a bear was probably the druid they were sent to find. Oops.

session_synopses.CINE_Statue_04: Cinematic arena dialog to destroy a statue.

AvatarWorsens.speaker: Narrator
AvatarWorsens.text: *Despite your efforts to stave it off, the gnawing power within you demands more magic.*
AvatarWorsens.context: CinematicNodeContext: Pained grimace. Gale's netherese orb is weakening himInternalNodeContext: Gale gets worse for the second time. He has consumed one magic item but that has proven insufficient.

session_synopses.AvatarWorsens: Gale Avatar - after having journeyed for a while, Gale feels weak from the bomb that exist in him.
